title: Greece becomes first Orthodox Christian country legalise sex marriage
summary: Lawmakers in the 300 seat parliament voted for the bill drafted by centre right government despite church official objection
source_text: becomes first Christian Orthodox country to legalise same sex marriage   videoEqual marriageGreece becomes first Orthodox Christian country to legalise same sex marriageLawmakers in the 300 seat parliament voted for the bill drafted by centre right government despite church official  objectionsHelena Smith in AthensThu 15 Feb 2024 18 04 ESTFirst published on Thu 15 Feb 2024 16 50 ESTGreece ha become the world s first Christian Orthodox nation to legalise same sex marriage after the Athens parliament passed the landmark reform amid scene of both jubilation and fury in the country In a rare display of parliamentary consensus  176 MPs from across the political spectrum voted in favour of the bill on Thursday  Another 76 rejected the reform while two abstained from the vote and 46 were not present Members of the LGBTQ  community  many unable to contain their emotion  watched from the gallery above  We have waited year for this   said the prominent gay activist Stella Belia of legislation that will not only allow same sex couple to exchange vow in civil ceremony but also to adopt child  It s a historic moment  A lot of u weren t sure it would ever come   she said The vote followed two day of heated debate   and week of public rancour   with the reform described by supporter a  bold  and  long overdue  and decried a  antisocial  and  unchristian  by opponent including the powerful Orthodox church Despite facing formidable pushback from within his own centre right New Democracy party  prime minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis had championed the bill  saying it would end a  serious inequality for our democracy   A brilliant start   gay Greeks eager for MPs to legalise same sex marriageRead moreIn an impassioned speech before the vote  the 55 year old leader  who belongs to the liberal faction of his party  said the measure would align Greece with 36 country globally that had already legislated on the issue  Conservatism  he argued  should not be conflated with antiquated view that were out of sync with modern society  The reform that we are legislating today   will make the life of some of our fellow citizen that much better without   and I emphasise this   taking away anything from the life of the many   said Mitsotakis  adding that the law would confer full parental right on same sex couple  We are covering a gap by allowing everyone  if they wish  to institutionally seal their relationship   just a heterosexual couple do  But resistance had been strong from New Democracy MPs aware of their constituent in the socially conservative nation Highlighting the opposition  the former prime minister Antonis Samaras had told parliament earlier on Thursday that same sex marriage wa not a human right and the  dangerous  law should not have been introduced Without the backing of Syriza  the main opposition leftist party led by Stefanos Kasselakis  Greece s first gay political leader  and other smaller group  the reform would not have passed Marriage equality mapYet while three opposition party voted in favour  the law also faced criticism for not going far enough  Describing the bill a  imperfect   Syriza deplored the fact that it still banned same sex couple from achieving parenthood through surrogacy   an option Kasselakis ha acknowledged he would like to pursue with his American husband  Tyler McBeth skip past Mitsotakis  centre right government  Another 76 rejected the reform while two abstained from the vote and 46 were not present in the house  Download the CTV News App for breaking news alert and video on all the top story Mitsotakis tweeted after the vote that Greece  is proud to become the 16th  European Union  country to legislate marriage equality    This is a milestone for human right  reflecting today s Greece    a progressive  and democratic country  passionately committed to European value   he wrote  Scores of supporter of the reform who had gathered outside parliament and were watching the debate on a screen cheered loudly and hugged a the vote result wa announced   This took a long time to be adopted in our country   but at least it happened and that s what is important   said a man who only gave his first name  Nikolas   We are no longer invisible   Earlier  people opposed to the bill had also protested nearby  holding prayer book and religious icon  Opinion poll suggest that most Greeks support the reform by a narrow margin  and the issue ha failed to trigger deep division in a country more worried about the high cost of living  The bill wa backed by four left wing party  including the main opposition Syriza   This law doesn t solve every problem  but it is a beginning   said Spiros Bibilas  a lawmaker from the small left wing Passage to Freedom party  who is openly gay  It wa approved despite several majority and left wing lawmaker abstaining or voting against the reform  Three small far right party and the Stalinist rooted Communist Party rejected the draft law from the start of the two day debate   People who have been invisible will finally be made visible around u  And with them  many child  will  finally find their rightful place   Mitsotakis told lawmaker ahead of the evening vote   Both parent of same sex couple do not yet have the same legal opportunity to provide their child with what they need   he added   To be able to pick them up from school  to be able to travel  to go to the doctor  or take them to the hospital      That is what we are fixing   The bill confers full parental right on married same sex partner with child  But it precludes gay couple from parenthood through surrogate mother in Greece    an option currently available to woman who can t have child for health reason  Greece Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis  center right government is poised to make Greece the first Orthodox Christian majority country to approve marriage equality legislation   AP Photo Michael Varaklas  Many LGBTQ2S  right advocate have criticized that limitation  a well a the absence of any provision for transgender people  Psychologist Nancy Papathanasiou  scientific co director of Orlando LGBT   which advocate for LGBTQI mental health  echoed that concern but said the new law confers a very important sense of equality   Discrimination is the most pervasive risk factor for mental health   she said   So just knowing that there is le discrimination is protective and promotive for LGBTQI mental health   Maria Syrengela  a lawmaker from the governing New Democracy  or ND  said the reform redress a long standing injustice for same sex couple and their child   And let s reflect on what these people have been through  spending so many year in the shadow  entangled in bureaucratic procedure   she said  5 Things to Know newsletter  Sign up to start your day with the top story Dissidents among the governing party included former Prime Minister Antonis Samaras  from ND s conservative wing   Same sex marriage is not a human right     and it s not an international obligation for our country   he told parliament   Children have a right to have parent from both sex   Polls show that while most Greeks agree to same sex wedding they also reject extending parenthood through surrogacy to male couple  Same sex civil partnership have been allowed in Greece since 2015  But that only conferred legal guardianship to the biological parent of child in those relationship  leaving their partner in a bureaucratic limbo  The main opposition to the new bill ha come from the traditionalist Church of Greece    which also disapproves of heterosexual civil marriage  Church official have centred their criticism on the bill s implication for traditional family value  and argue that potential legal challenge could lead to a future extension of surrogacy right to gay couple  Church supporter and conservative organization have staged small protest against the proposed law  Far right lawmaker Vassilis Stigas  head of the small Spartans party  described the legislation Thursday a  sick  and claimed that it adoption would  open the gate of Hell and perversion   Politically  the same sex marriage law is not expected to harm Mitsotakis  government  which won easy re election last year after capturing much of the centrist vote  A stronger challenge come from ongoing protest by farmer angry at high production cost  and intense opposition from many student to the planned scrapping of a state monopoly on university education  Nevertheless  parliament is expected to approve the university bill later this month  and opinion poll indicate that most Greeks support it  Associated Press reporter Derek Gatopoulos  Michael Varaklas and Theodora Tongas in Athens contributed to this Utah governor approves censure school board member questioned student gender
summary: Utah Gov  Spencer Cox ha signed legislation censuring a conservative member of the state Board of Education whose social medium post questioning the gender of a high school basketball player
source_text: Utah governor approves censure of school board member who questioned a student s gender 1 of 2   Members of the Utah House of Representatives applaud for the athlete who wa the subject of school board member Natalie Cline s comment on social medium after passing the House Concurrent Resolution Condemning and Censuring State School Board Member Natalie Cline at the Capitol in Salt Lake City on Thursday  Feb  15  2024   Megan Nielsen The Deseret News via AP  Read More 2 of 2   FILE   Republican Utah Rep  Mike Schultz look on  Feb  28  2020  at the state Capitol in Salt Lake City  The Utah House introduced and swiftly passed legislation Thursday  Feb  15  2024  to censure a conservative member of the state Board of Education whose social medium post questioning the gender of a high school basketball player triggered a firestorm of derogatory comment and led state official to call for her resignation   AP Photo Rick Bowmer  File  Read More By HANNAH SCHOENBAUM Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print SALT LAKE CITY  AP    Utah Gov  Spencer Cox on Thursday signed legislation censuring a conservative member of the state Board of Education whose social medium post questioning the gender of a high school basketball player triggered threat against the girl and led state official to call for the board member s resignation Both legislative chamber had swiftly passed a resolution condemning the action of Natalie Cline a day after the Utah State Board of Education stripped Cline of her committee assignment and nearly all administrative responsibility  The board will no longer allow Cline to attend meeting or place item on the agenda  and her colleague have asked her to resign by Feb  19 The legislative reprimand carry no real punishment but is a formal way for state leader to express their disapproval  The measure calling Cline s action a  repugnant attack on a student  received unanimous support in the Senate after passing the House earlier Thursday with only two vote against  one from a Democrat and the other from a Republican  Both the Legislature and Board of Education have left it up to Cline whether to resign or remain in her role with limited authority  She is up for reelection in November  Democrats had urged the Republican legislative leader to punish Cline more harshly  either by impeaching her or by allowing the board to impeach her   a power it doe not currently have  READ MORE No  8 Arizona outlasts Utah 105 99 in triple overtime Utah governor say school board member who questioned a student s gender  embarrassed the state  In rural Utah  concern over effort to use Colorado River water to extract lithium Cline  who had previously come under investigation for inflammatory comment about LGBTQ  student  had singled out the Salt Lake City athlete in a Facebook post that falsely insinuated the girl wa transgender  After she learned that the girl wa not trans  Cline apologized for provoking a firestorm of vulgar comment  Even then  Cline defended her initial suspicion  saying that a national push to normalize transgender identity make it  normal to pause and wonder if people are what they say they are   Cox  a Republican  pushed back Thursday against criticism from LGBTQ  right advocate who argue he and Republican lawmaker enabled Cline s behavior by enacting a transgender bathroom ban that they say give people license to question someone s gender  Even if this young person wa transgender  it would still have been inappropriate   Cox said   That is not who we are or what we should be doing  House Speaker Mike Schultz  a Hooper Republican  said ahead of the vote that member of his chamber were  scattered  on whether to impeach Cline or allow voter to decide her future in the fall   If this body move ahead with impeachment  this blow up like a mushroom cloud on the national stage   Schultz said   The hate that you re seeing directed toward that family right now then becomes national  That s a hard decision to make  House Minority Leader Angela Romero said she wa frustrated that Republican leader cut off debate before she could propose an amendment that would instead initiate impeachment proceeding  She and her fellow Democrats nonetheless overwhelmingly voted in favor of the resolution to censure Cline  Cox said he think the education board s forceful censure will effectively have the same impact a impeachment  He said he agrees with the action of both the board and the Legislature and hope voter will  hold her equally accountable this fall  In a Facebook post Wednesday  Cline argued the board wa taking away her right to represent her constituent without due process  She wrote that she did not have enough time to read all the material and formulate a response before Wednesday s meeting The board determined that Cline had violated policy requiring member to respect student privacy and to uphold state educator standard  which include not participating in sexual or emotional harassment of student and treating student with dignity and respect  The board s resolution said Cline allowed negative comment about the girl to remain on her social medium page while comment in support of the student were deleted  which together  appeared to constitute cyberbullying a defined  in Utah law In a letter published Thursday in The Salt Lake Tribune  the girl s parent  Al and Rachel van der Beek  also urged Cline to resign and called for her impeachment  Ms  Cline did the very thing we teach our child not to do   she blasted social medium without fact checking  which ultimately led to a barrage of hateful and despicable comment that were directed at our daughter that lasted for more than 16 hour   the letter said   It wa one of the most painful thing we ve had to endure   HANNAH SCHOENBAUM Schoenbaum is a government and politics reporter based in Salt Lake City

summary: Greece ha become the first majority Orthodox Christian nation to legalize same sex marriage  At least for the near future  it will almost certainly be the only one  Orthodox leadership ha unanimously

Navalny dy Election 2024 Religion Greece just legalized same sex marriage  Will other Orthodox country join them any time soon  Greece ha become the first Orthodox Christian nation to legalize same sex civil marriage   Feb 15   Photos 7 By PETER SMITH and DASHA LITVINOVA Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print Greece ha become the first majority Orthodox Christian nation to legalize same sex marriage under civil law  At least for the near future  it will almost certainly be the only one Eastern Orthodox leadership  despite lacking a single doctrinal authority like a pope  ha been united in opposing recognition of same sex relationship both within it own rite and in the civil realm  Public opinion in majority Orthodox country ha mostly been opposed  too But there are some sign of change  Two small majority Orthodox country  Montenegro and Cyprus  have authorized same sex union in recent year  a did Greece in 2015 before upgrading to this week s approval of full marital status  Civil union may become more common among Orthodox country gravitating toward the European Union  They remain off the table in Russia  which ha cracked down on LGBTQ  expression  and country in it orbit  Following is a summary of church position and public opinion in the Orthodox world  followed by the situation in individual majority Orthodox land  THE ORTHODOX WORLDEastern Orthodoxy is a socially conservative  ancient church with elaborate ritual and a strict hierarchy  Churches are mostly organized along national line  with multiple independent church that share ancient doctrine and practice and that both cooperate and squabble Roughly 200 million Eastern Orthodox live primarily in Eastern Europe and neighboring Asian land  with about half that total in Russia  while smaller number live across the world  Like other international church body  Orthodoxy ha confronted call for LGBTQ  inclusion  A 2016 statement by a council of most Orthodox church called marriage between a man and a woman  the oldest institution of divine law  and said member were forbidden from entering same sex union Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew of Constantinople  considered the first among equal among Orthodox leader  affirmed that stance in a statement after the Greek vote  But he added that the church must respond to member in such union  with pastoral responsibility and in Christ like love  In country where they are a majority  Orthodox believer overwhelmingly said society should not accept homosexuality or approve same sex marriage  according to survey conducted in 2015 and 2016 by the Pew Research Center  a Washington based think tank Greek Orthodox showed relative tolerance  with half of Orthodox saying homosexuality should be accepted and a quarter favoring same sex marriage  In more recent poll  Greeks overall narrowly supported the marriage law The Greek law validates marriage in the civil realm but doesn t require any church to perform such rite  Nevertheless  Greece s Orthodox leadership unanimously opposed the law in January  saying the  duality of gender and their complementarity are not social invention but originate from God  Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis acknowledged the church s position but said   We are discussing the decision of the Greek state  unrelated to theological belief  Civil union may be in some Orthodox country  near future  said George Demacopoulos  director of the Orthodox Christian Studies Center at Fordham University in New York   In term of civil marriage  I think the country that are in the European Union will eventually all do it   Demacopoulos said   My guess is the assembly of bishop in those country will offer some resistance to the measure  and depending on where you are  that may or may not delay it   UKRAINEIn Ukraine  same sex couple cannot register their status legally In 2023  the issue became acute a many LGBTQ  people joined Ukraine s armed force  That year  a bill wa introduced in Parliament to establish civil partnership for same sex couple  providing basic right such a compensation if one of the partner is killed in action The All Ukrainian Council of Churches and Religious Organizations   which includes Ukraine s two rival Orthodox church   opposed the draft law  contending that some international entity are using the country s current vulnerability to force unwanted change The legislation remains pending The European Court of Human Rights ruled in 2023 that Ukraine violated the right of a same sex couple who sought legal protection provided to married heterosexual couple  Ukraine is majority Orthodox  with various religious minority RUSSIAIn increasingly conservative Russia  President Vladimir Putin ha forged a powerful alliance with the Russian Orthodox Church and ha made  traditional family value  a cornerstone of his rule  juxtaposing them with  perversion  of the West Putin effectively outlawed same sex marriage in the 2020 constitutional revision that added a clause stipulating that marriage is a union of a man and a woman In 2013  the Kremlin adopted what s known a the  gay propaganda  law  banning any public endorsement of  nontraditional sexual relation  among minor After sending troop into Ukraine in 2022  Russian authority ramped up a campaign against what it called the West s  degrading  moral influence  in what right advocate saw a an attempt to legitimize the war Patriarch Kirill of Moscow ha assailed LGBTQ  right  As head of the Russian Orthodox Church  he oversees the world s largest Orthodox flock  He depicted his country s invasion of Ukraine a part of a metaphysical struggle against a liberal agenda that included  gay parade  In November  Russia s Supreme Court effectively outlawed LGBTQ  activism  labeling what the government called the LGBTQ   international movement  a an extremist group and banning it in Russia  In 2021  a survey by Russia s top independent pollster  the Levada Center  showed that only 33  of Russians completely or somewhat agree that gay men and woman should enjoy the same right a heterosexual  a decrease from earlier year BELARUSThe Belarus Family Code defines marriage a a  union between a man and a woman   There is also no legislation prohibiting discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity Homosexuality wa decriminalized in Belarus in 1994  but the LGBTQ  community face heavy stigma and high suicide rate  advocate say Human right group report hundred of case of the KGB   the country s main domestic security agency   trying to recruit gay people and threatening to out them SERBIA AND MONTENEGROSerbia and Montenegro  two conservative Balkan nation where the Serbian Orthodox Church hold huge influence  have had mixed result addressing LGBTQ  right a part of effort to join the European Union Tiny Montenegro passed a bill in 2020 allowing same sex partnership   not marriage and with fewer right  In Serbia  a similar draft law never made it to a parliamentary vote The Serbian Orthodox Church  which maintains close relation with the Russian church  ha opposed the idea of same sex marriage Serbia s President Aleksandar Vucic ha said he would not sign off a bill on same sex marriage  although Serbia ha had an openly lesbian prime minister for year  Activists have been campaigning for legal partnership Pride march in Serbia are routinely banned or held under tight security  In Montenegro  though same sex partnership are allowed  the highly male oriented society of 620 000 people remains divided over the issue ROMANIA AND MOLDOVARomania is one of the few European Union member that allows neither same sex marriage nor civil union  despite a growing social acceptance of LGBTQ  people In 2023  the European Court of Human Rights ruled that Romania had failed to enforce same sex couple  right by not legally recognizing their relationship  In early February in Romania  LGBTQ  activist were allegedly assaulted while holding a peaceful protest outside the Bucharest headquarters of the country s far right AUR party In 2018  Romania held a referendum   backed by the Orthodox Church   on whether to narrow the constitutional definition of marriage from a  union of spouse  to a  union between one man and one woman  Rights campaigner urged Romanians to boycott the vote  which failed due to low turnout In neighboring Moldova  which isn t an EU member but ha official candidate status  neither same sex marriage nor union are allowed  Large majority in both country are Orthodox BULGARIAPublic opinion in Bulgaria is mostly hostile to gay people and more so to same sex marriage  In the Balkan country  patriarchal family tradition still predominate The European Court of Human Rights last year found that Bulgaria s government wa violating European human right law in failing to legally recognize same sex couple  The court also ruled that Bulgaria is obliged to adopt legal recognition for same sex couple  but Bulgaria show no sign of implementing the decision Leaders of the Bulgarian Orthodox Church  which includes about 80  of Bulgarians  condemned the ECHR ruling and called on the government not to give in Bulgaria s constitution explicitly prohibits the recognition of same sex marriage  Amending the constitution requires a two third opinion in majority Orthodox country ha mostly been opposed  too But there are some sign of change  Two small majority Orthodox country  Montenegro and Cyprus  have authorized same sex union in recent year  a did Greece in 2015 before upgrading to this week s approval of full marital status Civil union may become more common among Orthodox country gravitating toward the European Union  They remain off the table in Russia  which ha cracked down on LGBTQ  expression  and country in it orbit Following is a summary of church position and public opinion in the Orthodox world  followed by the situation in individual majority Orthodox land Eastern Orthodoxy is a socially conservative  ancient church with elaborate ritual and a strict hierarchy  Churches are mostly organized along national line  with multiple independent church that share ancient doctrine and practice and that both cooperate and squabble Roughly 200 million Eastern Orthodox live primarily in Eastern Europe and neighboring Asian land  with about half that total in Russia  while smaller number live across the world  Like other international church body  Orthodoxy ha confronted call for LGBTQ  inclusion  A 2016 statement by a council of most Orthodox church called marriage between a man and a woman  the oldest institution of divine law  and said member were forbidden from entering same sex union Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew of Constantinople  considered the first among equal among Orthodox leader  affirmed that stance in a statement after the Greek vote  But he added that the church must respond to member in such union  with pastoral responsibility and in Christ like love  In country where they are a majority  Orthodox believer overwhelmingly said society should not accept homosexuality or approve same sex marriage  according to survey conducted in 2015 and 2016 by the Pew Research Center  a Washington based think tank Greek Orthodox showed relative tolerance  with half of Orthodox saying homosexuality should be accepted and a quarter favoring same sex marriage  In more recent poll  Greeks overall narrowly supported the marriage law The Greek law validates marriage in the civil realm but doesn t require any church to perform such rite Nevertheless  Greece s Orthodox leadership unanimously opposed the law in January  saying the  duality of gender and their complementarity are not social invention but originate from God  Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis acknowledged the church s position but said   We are discussing the decision of the Greek state  unrelated to theological belief  Civil union may be in some Orthodox country  near future  said George Demacopoulos  director of the Orthodox Christian Studies Center at Fordham University in New York   In term of civil marriage  I think the country that are in the European Union will eventually all do it   Demacopoulos said   My guess is the assembly of bishop in those country will offer some resistance to the measure  and depending on where you are  that may or may not delay it  In Ukraine  same sex couple cannot register their status legally In 2023  the issue became acute a many LGBTQ  people joined Ukraine s armed force  That year  a bill wa introduced in Parliament to establish civil partnership for same sex couple  providing basic right such a compensation if one of the partner is killed in action The All Ukrainian Council of Churches and Religious Organizations   which includes Ukraine s two rival Orthodox church   opposed the draft law  contending that some international entity are using the country s current vulnerability to force unwanted change The legislation remains pending The European Court of Human Rights ruled in 2023 that Ukraine violated the right of a same sex couple who sought legal protection provided to married heterosexual couple Ukraine is majority Orthodox  with various religious minority In increasingly conservative Russia  President Vladimir Putin ha forged a powerful alliance with the Russian Orthodox Church and ha made  traditional family value  a cornerstone of his rule  juxtaposing them with  perversion  of the West Putin effectively outlawed same sex marriage in the 2020 constitutional revision that added a clause stipulating that marriage is a union of a man and a woman In 2013  the Kremlin adopted what s known a the  gay propaganda  law  banning any public endorsement of  nontraditional sexual relation  among minor After sending troop into Ukraine in 2022  Russian authority ramped up a campaign against what it called the West s  degrading  moral influence  in what right advocate saw a an attempt to legitimize the war Patriarch Kirill of Moscow ha assailed LGBTQ  right  As head of the Russian Orthodox Church  he oversees the world s largest Orthodox flock  He depicted his country s invasion of Ukraine a part of a metaphysical struggle against a liberal agenda that included  gay parade  In November  Russia s Supreme Court effectively outlawed LGBTQ  activism  labeling what the government called the LGBTQ   international movement  a an extremist group and banning it in Russia  In 2021  a survey by Russia s top independent pollster  the Levada Center  showed that only 33  of Russians completely or somewhat agree that gay men and woman should enjoy the same right a heterosexual  a decrease from earlier year The Belarus Family Code defines marriage a a  union between a man and a woman   There is also no legislation prohibiting discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity Homosexuality wa decriminalized in Belarus in 1994  but the LGBTQ  community face heavy stigma and high suicide rate  advocate say Human right group report hundred of case of the KGB   the country s main domestic security agency   trying to recruit gay people and threatening to out them Serbia and Montenegro  two conservative Balkan nation where the Serbian Orthodox Church hold huge influence  have had mixed result addressing LGBTQ  right a part of effort to join the European Union Tiny Montenegro passed a bill in 2020 allowing same sex partnership   not marriage and with fewer right  In Serbia  a similar draft law never made it to a parliamentary vote The Serbian Orthodox Church  which maintains close relation with the Russian church  ha opposed the idea of same sex marriage Serbia s President Aleksandar Vucic ha said he would not sign off a bill on same sex marriage  although Serbia ha had an openly lesbian prime minister for year  Activists have been campaigning for legal partnership Pride march in Serbia are routinely banned or held under tight security  In Montenegro  though same sex partnership are allowed  the highly male oriented society of 620 000 people remains divided over the issue Romania is one of the few European Union member that allows neither same sex marriage nor civil union  despite a growing social acceptance of LGBTQ  people In 2023  the European Court of Human Rights ruled that Romania had failed to enforce same sex couple  right by not legally recognizing their relationship  In early February in Romania  LGBTQ  activist were allegedly assaulted while holding a peaceful protest outside the Bucharest headquarters of the country s far right AUR party In 2018  Romania held a referendum   backed by the Orthodox Church   on whether to narrow the constitutional definition of marriage from a  union of spouse  to a  union between one man and one woman  Rights campaigner urged Romanians to boycott the vote  which failed due to low turnout In neighboring Moldova  which isn t an EU member but ha official candidate status  neither same sex marriage nor union are allowed  Large majority in both country are Orthodox Public opinion in Bulgaria is mostly hostile to gay people and more so to same sex marriage  In the Balkan country  patriarchal family tradition still predominate The European Court of Human Rights last year found that Bulgaria s government wa violating European human right law in failing to legally recognize same sex couple  The court also ruled that Bulgaria is obliged to adopt legal recognition for same sex couple  but Bulgaria show no sign of implementing the decision Leaders of the Bulgarian Orthodox Church  which includes about 80  of Bulgarians  condemned the ECHR ruling and called on the government not to give in Bulgaria s constitution explicitly prohibits the recognition of same sex marriage  Amending the constitution requires a two third majority in parliament on three consecutive vote  Such tight security  In Montenegro  though same sex partnership are allowed  the highly male oriented society of 620 000 people remains divided over the issue  ROMANIA AND MOLDOVA Romania is one of the few European Union member that allows neither same sex marriage nor civil union  despite a growing social acceptance of LGBTQ  people  In 2023  the European Court of Human Rights ruled that Romania had failed to enforce same sex couple  right by not legally recognizing their relationship  In early February in Romania  LGBTQ  activist were allegedly assaulted while holding a peaceful protest outside the Bucharest headquarters of the country s far right AUR party  In 2018  Romania held a referendum   backed by the Orthodox Church   on whether to narrow the constitutional definition of marriage from a  union of spouse  to a  union between one man and one woman   Rights campaigner urged Romanians to boycott the vote  which failed due to low turnout  In neighboring Moldova  which isn t an EU member but ha official candidate status  neither same sex marriage nor union are allowed  Large majority in both country are Orthodox  BULGARIA Public opinion in Bulgaria is mostly hostile to gay people and more so to same sex marriage  In the Balkan country  patriarchal family tradition still predominate  The European Court of Human Rights last year found that Bulgaria s government wa violating European human right law in failing to legally recognize same sex couple  The court also ruled that Bulgaria is obliged to adopt legal recognition for same sex couple  but Bulgaria show no sign of implementing the decision  Leaders of the Bulgarian Orthodox Church  which includes about 80  of Bulgarians  condemned the ECHR ruling and called on the government not to give in  Bulgaria s constitution explicitly prohibits the recognition of same sex marriage  Amending the constitution requires a two third majority in parliament on three consecutive vote  Such a scenario seems remote title: Prominent Trans Surgeon Admits Unearthed Video Complications Genital Surgery  Pretty Bad
summary: A prominent surgeon stated that the complication from vaginoplastic surgery that aim at removing male genitals and creating a vagina  can be pretty bad  and noted that there wa  a growing number of program throughout the world of gender affirmation  probably with a lack of training and not proper training   according to the video of a presentation that the Daily Caller News Foundation obtained through a public record request
source_text: My Account News Politics US World Entertainment Sports Business Education Outdoors Satire Opinion Opinion Two Sides Big Tent Ideas Featured Partners Newsletters Documentaries RIGGED  Death of the American Voter Stream Documentaries Patriots Premium Articles Subscribe Daily Caller Merchandise SUBSCRIBE Log In Health EXCLUSIVE  Prominent Trans Surgeon Admits In Unearthed Video That Complications Of Genital Surgery  Can Be Pretty Bad   MAD vertise Shutterstock  Megan Brock Contributor February 15  2024 12 15 PM ET Font Size  A prominent surgeon stated that the complication from vaginoplastic surgery that aim at removing male genitals and creating a vagina  can be pretty bad  and noted that there wa  a growing number of program throughout the world of gender affirmation  probably with a lack of training and not proper training   according to the video of a presentation that the Daily Caller News Foundation obtained through a public record request   Complications can be pretty bad for vaginoplasty and the most dreaded complication is to perforate the rectum while you are dissecting the vaginal cavity   Dr  Alex Laungani  a Canadian surgeon  who ha  expertise in trans surgical care   said at an event sponsored by the World Professional Association for Transgender Health  WPATH   You are essentially dissecting the vaginal cavity between the prostate and the rectum and there s literally no space there   he said   So  you have to create a new plain in a spot that doesn t exist  So  you re very close to the rectum and it s very hard it s very easy to get in there  We don t  I mean  the more you do it  the le risk you have  of course   WPATH is a medical organization that ha published an influential clinical guidance on transgender health care called Standards of Care for the Health of Transgender and Gender Diverse People  SOC   Laungani s presentation  entitled  Foundations in Surgery   wa part of an educational series recorded in September 2022 for licensed clinician seeking WPATH certification in transgender health care  Laungani is a WPATH member  The WPATH Standards of Care recommend that transgender surgeon be educated  trained and supervised on how to perform sex reassignment surgery  However  Laungani said in his presentation that a the number of sex reassignment program had grown  it wa likely some surgeon had not received adequate training   We ve seen a growing number of program throughout the world of gender affirmation  probably with a lack of training and not proper training  for now   said Laungani   And so  you know  better ca any care wa better  probably  than no care  So  it did allow individual to have access to surgery  But it s time just to make sure that we have the right training and that everybody ha the same standard because the patient deserve it   And  so  we need to make sure that  you know  we ll build these training program  fellowship  and thing   he said   And it s really happening now  So  this is going to be something mandatory    Well  you do great only what you do often  right   Laungani said   So  if you do a vaginoplasty every two year  I don t think you could consider yourself proficient  You re going to have more complication   You re not going to follow up  you know  and you re not going to be that interested that you actually go and hang out at these kind of conference and learn from your colleague  because you re not going to do it a much   he said   So  I think you need to dedicate a huge part of your practice to gender affirming care if you are going to do it at all   WATCH  In this WPATH presentation  Laungani gave an overview of vaginoplasty  a surgery that seek to create a vagina by removing male genitalia  surgically creating a vaginal canal  and lining the canal with tissue which often come from other part of the body  Laungani discussed the detail of a vaginoplasty procedure  saying   So  you ll use the skin of the penis to tack it down and invert it and start the beginning of lining of the canal  But you won t have enough skin to line the entire canal to some  there are some rare exception so you ll need some extra tissue there   Laungani said this tissue needed for the vaginal canal can be taken from the abdomen  scrotum  or colon  However  he warned that using colon tissue could increase the risk of complication   Or you could be using even a piece of colon   he said   So  to use colon vaginoplasty  um  usually that s reserved for secondary deepening  We don t do it a a primary intervention because it s more morbid  You get to  you title: House member raise question Johnson invite  hate preacher
summary: Lawmakers are asking for answer after a guest chaplain known for his incendiary preaching wa sponsored by Speaker Mike Johnson to give the House s daily opening prayer last month  according to a letter sent to the speaker and the Office of the Chaplain signed by 26 Democratic House member   The letter describes pastor Jack Hibbs a  a radical Christian Nationalist who helped fuel the January 6th insurrection and ha a long record of spewing h

January ha captured the attention of Huffman and other Democrats Reps  Jamie Raskin  center  and Jared Huffman are among the Democrats calling for answer about a prayer delivered by a guest chaplain in January   Tom Williams CQ Roll Call file photo  By Nina Heller Posted February 15  2024 at 5 34pm Lawmakers are asking for answer after a guest chaplain known for his incendiary preaching wa sponsored by Speaker Mike Johnson to give the House s daily opening prayer last month  according to a letter sent to the speaker and the Office of the Chaplain signed by 26 Democratic House member  The letter describes pastor Jack Hibbs a  a radical Christian Nationalist who helped fuel the January 6th insurrection and ha a long record of spewing hateful vitriol toward non Christians  immigrant  and member of the LGBTQ community   Hibbs should not have been allowed to deliver the opening prayer on Jan  30  argues the letter  which wa led by Reps  Jared Huffman of California  Jamie Raskin of Maryland and Mark Pocan of Wisconsin   After we picked our jaw up off the floor upon learning that this hate preacher had been allowed to give a guest invocation  I think many of u decided we need to start calling this out   Huffman told Roll Call  The letter accuses Johnson of hosting  an ill qualified hate preacher  who share his own  Christian nationalist agenda   and point to guideline for hosting guest chaplain that he may have ignored  In a video posted to his YouTube channel last year  Hibbs called transgender people part of a  sexually perverted cult   He is also a supporter of conversion therapy for LGBTQ people and launched a national campaign requiring school to out transgender student to defeat  demonic and dark satanic power   In his invocation delivered in the House chamber on Jan  30  Hibbs called for  repentance of our national sin   and used the word  holy fear   which the letter argues were  allusion to the militant and fanatical agenda he preaches about the LGBTQ community  Jews  Muslims  and anyone who conflict with his  biblical worldview    Hibbs ha previously called Islam a  death cult  and said Jewish people are under a  God given blindness   For Huffman  the guest appearance represents an affront to  pluralism and religious diversity in this country    We really do continue to elevate certain type of Christian religion above everyone else  in way that I think would have Madison  Jefferson and other founder rolling in their grave   said Huffman  who call himself a  nonreligious humanist  and  along with Raskin  helped found the Congressional Freethought Caucus  The letter seek answer about how Hibbs wa approved to lead the prayer and whether Johnson and the chaplain s office flouted existing guideline  Instructions given to member office say guest chaplain must be from the sponsoring member s congressional district and be known personally by the member  They also say the sponsoring member should plan on giving the first One Minute Speech of the day to personally welcome the guest chaplain  Members are limited to one guest chaplain per Congress  and date for such a prayer must align with the last legislative day of the week  Hibbs lead Calvary Chapel Chino Hills  which is located in Southern California  not in Johnson s district in Louisiana  and the letter detail other deviation from the guideline  The speaker s office did not respond to a request for comment  During his time in Washington at the end of January  Hibbs appears to have attended other event  including the National Gathering for Prayer and Repentance  Johnson and several other member of Congress also attended that gathering  which wa organized by the Family Research Council and held at the Museum of the Bible  Huffman want to know why Hibbs wa invited to lead the House in prayer while some member  according to the letter  have had request for other guest chaplain denied  The letter mention a nontheistic chaplain from Pocan s district  Dan Barker  House chaplain open every session of the House with a prayer and perform various pastoral duty for member   In term of   what he said and the full context of who  Hibbs  is  it doesn t meet the standard  So definitely Chaplain Kibben wa either asleep at the switch or allowed something that should have been disqualifying under her own standard   Huffman said  referring to Margaret Kibben  who ha held the chaplain s post since 2021  The chaplain s office declined to comment  Huffman said he hasn t received a response yet from either Johnson s office or the chaplain but is eager to get his question answered   I think they have some explaining to do   Huffman said  Recent Stories McConnell ha a good week in battle to retake Senate majority Trump s interest in national half of trans identifying individual reported experiencing  serious psychological distress  within the last 30 day according to a study  The U S  Transgender Survey from the National Center for Transgender Equality assessed 92 329 people who identify a trans or nonbinary from Oct  19 through Dec  5  2022  The survey included more than 84 000 people aged 18 and older and wa also open to individual aged 16 and older  The study claim that 94  of participant who lived under a different gender identity reported they were  a lot more satisfied   79   or  a little more satisfied   15   with their life  The study doe not appear to have included individual who detransitioned in it analysis  however Three percent of respondent reported that identifying a the opposite sex made them  neither more nor le satisfied  with their life  while 1  reported they were  a little le satisfied   Another 2  of participant stated that they were  a lot le satisfied  with their life  Nearly all respondent  98   who were taking cross sex hormone reported that the drug made them either  a lot more satisfied   84   or  a little more satisfied   14   with their life   the study further claimed   One percent  1   reported that  opposite sex  hormone made them  neither more nor le satisfied  with their life  and le than 1  said they were  a little le satisfied  or  a lot le satisfied  with their life after receiving hormone   The study also purported that 97  of respondent who underwent a sex change operation said that they were  a lot more satisfied   88   or  a little more satisfied   9   with their life   One percent  1   reported that surgery made them  neither more nor le satisfied  with their life  le than 1  were  a little le satisfied   and 1  were  a lot le satisfied  with their life   the report claimed  However  the study s data also show that 44  of respondent reported they had experienced what the report described a  serious psychological distress  within the last 30 day  Thirty percent of participant said they had experienced homelessness in their lifetime  and more than one third of respondent were experiencing poverty  According to a report released by the American College of Pediatricians titled  Mental Health in Adolescents with Incongruence of Gender Identity and Biological Sex   allowing minor to undergo such procedure doe not improve their mental health  The Healthy Minds Study found that 78  of college student classified a  gender minority  showed sign of depression  anxiety  eating disorder  self injury and suicidality compared to only 45  of respondent who were not  gender minority   The study surveyed 65 213 student at 71 college campus across the U S  between 2015 and 2017   A 2021 comprehensive data review of all 3 754 trans identified adolescent in U S  military family over 8 5 year showed that cross sex hormone led to increased use of  mental  health service and psychiatric medication  and increased suicidal ideation attempted suicide   the report stated ACP board member Dr  Jane Anderson told The Christian Post in an earlier interview that  the most important thing is to recognize that these adolescent need and benefit from mental health support   There is a high incidence of adolescent who come into this medical care who have previous history of depression or anxiety or autism or other medical or psychological concern   she said   And those issue have to be dealt with first   she added   It s just crucial that they receive the mental health service and support that they so desperately need title: Legal expert raise concern Alberta plan transgender youth
summary: Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from two Alberta university are asking the province to reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth
source_text: Legal expert raise concern about Alberta s plan for transgender youth Alberta Premier Danielle Smith arrives for a news conference in Ottawa on Monday  Feb 5  2024   THE CANADIAN PRESS Sean Kilpatrick  Share Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from Alberta s two largest university are asking the province to reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth  The open letter  sent Thursday  wa signed by staff at the University of Alberta and University of Calgary law school   We have come together to express our deep concern with the government s announcement of restriction targeting transgender youth   say the letter   These restriction will harm two spirit  trans  and gender diverse child and youth by undermining their education  restricting their access to health care  and narrowing their sport and recreation opportunity   We believe these restriction violate their right a enshrined in the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms   Alberta Premier Danielle Smith ha said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring new rule  including restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school  a well a on hormone treatment and surgery for gender affirmation  The province would also clamp down on transgender female athlete competing in woman s and girl  sport  Smith s office did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the letter  Jennifer Koshan  a law professor at the University of Calgary  said she and her colleague wrote to the UCP government because they want to shine a spotlight on the legal aspect to the debate   Many of these youth have been speaking out themselves and have been telling very compelling story about their own personal circumstance and the impact that these policy would have on them   Koshan said in an interview   So  we re just trying to add to the discussion with the type of expertise that we can bring forward here  which is the legal expertise that put all of these issue in the framework of the Charter   The expert say the proposed change violate multiple section of the Charter  including freedom of expression  the right to security of the person  and say the rule may constitute cruel and unusual treatment  The letter also address Smith s refusal to rule out using the Charter s notwithstanding clause to push through the change   We believe that it would be wrong for the government to invoke the notwithstanding clause to force through legislation that violates the Charter right of minor   said the letter  The legal expert note the Supreme Court of Canada ha recognized the transgender community a a marginalized group in Canadian society   Two spirit  trans  and gender diverse youth are especially vulnerable   say the letter   They depend on adult to care for them  Too often  adult in their life are not prepared to accept and care for them because of who they are  They are bullied  They are subject to violence and gender based victimization   The Charter ha a critical role to play in protecting them  given their heightened vulnerability   The transgender policy have spurred protest   both at the grassroots level and from professional group such a the Alberta Medical Association  There wa a student walkout at high school across the province last week to show support to student who would be affected by the policy  This report by The reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth  The open letter is from staff at the University of Alberta and University of Calgary law school Alberta Premier Danielle Smith ha said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring new rule  including parental notification and or consent for youth changing their name or pronoun at school  a well a restricting access to hormone treatment and surgery for gender affirming healthcare The province would also clamp down on transgender female athlete competing in woman s and girl  sport The letter say the proposed policy would be unconstitutional and infringe on the right and freedom enshrined in four different section of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms  freedom of expression in section 2 b   the right to life  liberty and security of the person in section 7  the right to not be subjected to cruel and unusual punishment in section 12  and equality right in section 15  Story continues below advertisement  Protecting fundamental freedom  safeguarding legal and equality right  and respecting human dignity are guiding principle of Canadian society  Infringing Charter right and freedom undermines our collective aspiration and diminishes all of u   the open letter read The legal scholar also said any use of the Charter s notwithstanding clause would be  wholly unnecessary  if the government belief the restriction are in the best interest of trans youth  and that using that section of the Charter would be needed if the government belief  neither the science nor the human right are on their side  The law professor said they received confirmation of receipt from the office of the premier and ministry they sent the letter to  More on Politics Alexei Navalny death report  tragic and horrifying   Justin Trudeau say Saskatchewan judge OKs pronoun law challenge NDP close to presenting  final offer  on pharmacare  Singh MPs urge Loblaw  Walmart to sign grocery code of conduct or risk it becoming law Late Thursday  the premier s office responded to the open letter  Alberta s government ha put these policy forward and will develop legislation with the best interest of the child in mind   Smith s press secretary Sam Blackett wrote   There s a legal court process that designates certain individual a mature minor in very limited circumstance  these policy will not change that process  Without seeing the drafted or final language of the policy  the law professor and legal researcher said they are only able to go on what Smith ha said about the type of restriction her government plan to implement  We do think the policy are unconstitutional   U of C law professor Jennifer Koshan said   We think there are strong argument that those policy  once they re put into writing  would violate the Charter   Story continues below advertisement  There is a sense that these type of policy are really chipping away at the respect for human right and respect for the Charter and the Constitution that we have in Canada that are really meant to protect minority group from majoritarian rule   U of A assistant professor of law Florence Ashley said While expressing concern for trans kid  Smith ha previously said the policy are intended to protect the choice a youth could make about altering their body until they ve  grown mature enough to make such choice safely  and with a full understanding of what that mean for the rest of your life   We have to preserve the right of kid to be able to make decision a adult   Smith said on Feb  1   We re aiming to be supportive of child s right  We want to make sure that child do not prematurely make decision that are going to be irreversible  We think that this is preserving of choice   2 54 Danielle Smith unveils Alberta s proposed guideline on parental consent  gender affirming care rule Danielle Smith unveils Alberta s proposed guideline on parental consent  gender affirming care rule Alberta NDP  Smith  playing dangerous politics  in wake of provincial gender pronoun policy Smith using  mean spirited  gender pronoun policy to  distract  Albertans from provincial issue  Notley Previous Video Next Video Story continues below advertisement Freedom of expression The legal scholar said requiring parental approval and or notification for name or pronoun change at school would violate the freedom of gender expression  a fundamental freedom in section 2 b  of the Charter  Denying youth access to care violates their right to autonomy and freedom of expression   the legal scholar wrote  5 18 Comparing Saskatchewan and Alberta s parental consent policy Life  liberty and security of the person The open letter said that will cause youth to either misgender themselves at school or out themselves to potentially non supportive parent  causing  significant harm  and would be a  cruel choice  that violates their section 7 right to  make fundamental personal decision and be free from state imposed psychological distress   Story continues below advertisement The law professor noted a Saskatchewan court granted an injunction to prevent  irreparable harm  to trans and gender diverse youth from a similar policy  Get the latest National news  Sent to your email  every day  The Saskatchewan government would later use the notwithstanding clause to put that policy into law Another  serious violation  of the right to life  liberty and security of the person  the letter said  would be in the government imposing a medical decision by prohibiting  standard of care intervention  of gender affirming care  the letter said Under the mature minor doctrine of common law  youth who understand a medical procedure and it possible consequence can legally make that decision Already in Canada  youth must be the age of 18 before having  bottom surgery  The letter quoted a 2009 Supreme Court decision that said  young people should not automatically be deprived of the right to make decision affecting their medical treatment   but are instead  entitled to a degree of decision making autonomy that is reflective of their evolving intelligence and understanding  Smith wa asked about the possibility of the new policy violating childrens  Charter right in accessing health care on Feb  1  I guess I ll have the lawyer debate that out   the premier said   But my understanding is that it s pretty well understood that parent are principally responsible for their child up to and including age 15  At age 16 or 17  that s of course when kid develop a little bit more autonomy   Story continues below advertisement Koshan previously told Global News there s no set age at which a child can be considered a mature minor  and is instead identified on a case by case basis depending on the minor s maturity  understanding of the decision and the context of the decision The premier claimed a mature minor making decision wa  fairly rare   I think that the practice ha been that we do rely on parent to be able to provide for their kid   Smith said on Feb  1 Restricting trans woman from participating along their cisgendered counterpart would  likely violate all woman and girl  right to privacy and bodily integrity under section 7 of the Charter by encouraging practice of  gender verification    the open letter state  2 04 Alberta LGBTQ2 community member meet with cabinet minister on gender policy  Cruel and unusual punishment  The open letter said the  state imposed psychological distress  imposed by that  cruel choice  of either self misgendering or facing unsupportive parent would also violate youth s right to not be subjected to cruel and unusual treatment or punishment  under section 12 of the Charter  Story continues below advertisement In the video announcing the policy and at subsequent news conference  Alberta Premier Danielle Smith appeared to be relying on existing law to protect child from any violence that stemmed from the policy  We have child protection law that will be strictly enforced   Smith said on Jan  31 The open letter said the existing child protection legislation is  insufficient   and would require child to report their own parent to child protection authority  This reliance on child protection law is completely unrealistic and untenable  and exacerbates the violation of the Charter and human right legislation discussed above   the letter read Ashley said the child protection system in Alberta is already under stress and that the child welfare system is overburdened  Laws need to be there in order to protect precisely those who do not feel safe telling their parent  because that s the population that we re actually thinking about  That s the population that s actually being impacted by these change in law   they said  Trending Now A woman dying of cancer  and the struggle to get treatment to reduce her pain Two teen intentionally run down by Abbotsford  B C  driver  police say The legal scholar also took umbrage with the proposed opt in framework for in school instruction on topic including gender identity  sexual orientation and human sexuality  The proposed restriction will cause harm to all youth  especially to those who are vulnerable to sexual violence  including girl and 2SLGBTQ  youth  In addition to the Charter provision mentioned above  the proposed scheme impact youth s right to access to information  which is an important aspect of freedom of expression   Story continues below advertisement Smith said the change to opt in wa to keep parent  in the loop  about what s being taught in school The legal expert also said the policy announced by social medium video on Jan  31 would be inconsistent with Indigenous law  Citing the Final Report on Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls that  some First Nations also challenged European norm that understood gender a binary  and how two spirit people were revered and included in social and ceremonial role  Therefore  the Government of Alberta should also be consulting with Indigenous community about the impact of the proposed restriction on Indigenous law   the open letter say  10 27 What is SOGI 123  Equality right  By singling out a historically disadvantaged and vulnerable group for adverse impact  the restriction also would violate the right to equality guaranteed by section 15 of the Charter and the Alberta Human Rights Act   the letter say  Story continues below advertisement The same right would be violated under the proposed sport policy excluding trans woman from participating alongside ci woman  Such a clear distinction based on sex and gender identity unquestionably impairs the right to equality of trans woman under section 15 of the Charter and under the Alberta Human Rights Act   the letter say   Differential treatment cannot be based on needle speculation or stereotype  but must be rooted in clear evidence of need and necessity  On Feb  1  Smith said her government want to enshrine the choice of woman who are assigned female at birth to be able to  participate in a biological female only category while still preserving the gender neutral category and coed opportunity so that everyone ha the ability to participate   The notwithstanding clause The Alberta legal scholar said the use of section 33 of the Charter  the notwithstanding clause  allows government to bypass Charter right and freedom  and severely limit the possibility of judicial review  Story continues below advertisement  If the government genuinely belief that the restriction are in alignment with the best interest of trans youth  invoking the notwithstanding clause should be wholly unnecessary   the letter read   Only if the government belief that neither science nor human right are on their side doe using section 33 become necessary  On Feb  1  Smith said she hope her government won t need to use the notwithstanding clause On Thursday  Smith s office did not respond to a request for comment about the possible use of that section of the Charter Koshan said so far  the Alberta government hasn t provided any justification for the restriction that would fall under  reasonable limit  under section 1 of the Charter  11 25  I hope it doesn t come to that   Premier Smith on notwithstanding clause option for new trans policy The 36 legal expert said that lack of evidence led them to a conclusion about why the notwithstanding clause could be used  Story continues below advertisement  Using the notwithstanding clause to promote partisan political aim at the expense of a small  vulnerable group of youth would be  in our opinion  unconscionable  Ashley said a government s choice to use the notwithstanding clause in matter like these sends a clear message  I think that a government that us the notwithstanding clause is more or le admitting in almost all normal situation that this is a law that indeed violates the right of people   they said That section of the Charter wa included because of the possibility that voter could hold legislator responsible for a cavalier use of the notwithstanding clause However  according to the 2021 census  only 0 67 per cent of Albertans over 15 identified a trans or non binary  To override their right knowing that they are too few to hold the government accountable at the ballot box would be fundamentally anti democratic   the legal scholar said  with file from The Canadian Press 4 59 Alberta proposes policy change affecting trans gender youth Alberta proposes policy change affecting trans gender youth Alberta policy on trans youth most anti LGBTQ in Canada  Trudeau  Standing with the bully   Boissonnault slam Poilievre for silence on trans

gender affirmation  Updated 23 hr ago Feb  15  2024 Feb  15  2024 2 min read Save Copy article link Email Share on X Share on LinkedIn Facebook Twitter WhatsApp LinkedIn SMS Email People protest Alberta Premier Danielle Smith s proposed youth transgender policy outside of an event she is attending in Toronto on Feb  6  Arlyn McAdorey flag wire  true flag sponsored  false article type  pubinfo section  cm site custom site domain   thestar com sWebsitePrimaryPublication   publication toronto star bHasMigratedAvatar   false firstAuthor avatar   By Colette Derworiz The Canadian Press CALGARY   Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from Alberta s two largest university are asking the province to reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth The open letter  sent Thursday  wa signed by staff at the University of Alberta and University of Calgary law school    Already a Subscriber  Sign in You are logged in Switch account  We have come together to express our deep concern with the government s announcement of restriction targeting transgender youth   say the letter  ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW  These restriction will harm two spirit  trans  and gender diverse child and youth by undermining their education  restricting their access to health care  and narrowing their sport and recreation opportunity  We believe these restriction violate their right a enshrined in the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms  Alberta Premier Danielle Smith ha said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring new rule  including restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school  a well a on hormone treatment and surgery for gender affirmation The province would also clamp down on transgender female athlete competing in woman s and girl  sport Jennifer Koshan  a law professor at the University of Calgary  said she and her colleague wrote to the UCP government because they want to shine a spotlight on the legal aspect to the debate   Many of these youth have been speaking out themselves and have been telling very compelling story about their own personal circumstance and the impact that these policy would have on them   Koshan said in an interview  So  we re just trying to add to the discussion with the type of expertise that we can bring forward here  which is the legal expertise that put all of these issue in the framework of the Charter  The expert say the proposed change violate multiple section of the Charter  including freedom of expression  the right to security of the person  and say the rule may constitute cruel and unusual treatment The letter also address Smith s refusal to rule out using the Charter s notwithstanding clause to push through the change  We believe that it would be wrong for the government to invoke the notwithstanding clause to force through legislation that violates the Charter right of minor   said the letter  ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW The legal expert note the Supreme Court of Canada ha recognized the transgender community a a marginalized group in Canadian society  Two spirit  trans  and gender diverse youth are especially vulnerable   say the letter  They depend on adult to care for them  Too often  adult in their life are not prepared to accept and care for them because of who they are  They are bullied  They are subject to violence and gender based victimization  The Charter ha a critical role to play in protecting them  given their heightened vulnerability  Sam Blackett  press secretary for the premier s office  acknowledged the letter in an email late Thursday afternoon  ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW  Alberta s government ha put these policy forward and will develop legislation with the best interest of the child in mind   he wrote  There s a legal court process that designates certain individual a mature minor in very limited circumstance  these policy will not change that process  The transgender policy have spurred protest   both at the grassroots level and from professional group such a the Alberta Medical Association There wa a student walkout at high school across the province last week to title: Legal expert raise concern Alberta plan transgender youth
summary: CALGARY   Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from two Alberta university are asking the province to reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth
source_text: concern   Legal expert criticize Alberta s plan for transgender youth CALGARY   Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from Alberta s two largest university are asking the province to reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth  Colette Derworiz  The Canadian Press Feb 15  2024 6 42 PM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from two Alberta university are asking the government to reconsider it planned policy change affecting transgender youth Alberta Premier Danielle Smith arrives for a news conference in Ottawa on Monday  Feb 5  2024 THE CANADIAN PRESS Sean Kilpatrick CALGARY   Thirty six law professor  legal researcher and other staff from Alberta s two largest university are asking the province to reconsider policy change affecting transgender youth  The open letter  sent Thursday  wa signed by staff at the University of Alberta and University of Calgary law school   We have come together to express our deep concern with the government s announcement of restriction targeting transgender youth   say the letter   These restriction will harm two spirit  trans  and gender diverse child and youth by undermining their education  restricting their access to health care  and narrowing their sport and recreation opportunity   We believe these restriction violate their right a enshrined in the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms   Alberta Premier Danielle Smith ha said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring new rule  including restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school  a well a on hormone treatment and surgery for gender affirmation  The province would also clamp down on transgender female athlete competing in woman s and girl  sport  Jennifer Koshan  a law professor at the University of Calgary  said she and her colleague wrote to the UCP government because they want to shine a spotlight on the legal aspect to the debate   Many of these youth have been speaking out themselves and have been telling very compelling story about their own personal circumstance and the impact that these policy would have on them   Koshan said in an interview   So  we re just trying to add to the discussion with the type of expertise that we can bring forward here  which is the legal expertise that put all of these issue in the framework of the Charter   The expert say the proposed change violate multiple section of the Charter  including freedom of expression  the right to security of the person  and say the rule may constitute cruel and unusual treatment  The letter also address Smith s refusal to rule out using the Charter s notwithstanding clause to push through the change   We believe that it would be wrong for the government to invoke the notwithstanding clause to force through legislation that violates the Charter right of minor   said the letter  The legal expert note the Supreme Court of Canada ha recognized the transgender community a a marginalized group in Canadian society   Two spirit  trans  and gender diverse youth are especially vulnerable   say the letter   They depend on adult to care for them  Too often  adult in their life are not prepared to accept and care for them because of who they are  They are bullied  They are subject to violence and gender based victimization   The Charter ha a critical role to play in protecting them  given their heightened vulnerability   Sam Blackett  press secretary for the premier s office  acknowledged the letter in an email late Thursday afternoon   Alberta s government ha put these policy forward and will develop legislation with the best interest of the child in mind   he wrote   There s a legal court process that designates certain individual a mature minor in very limited circumstance  these policy will not change that process   The transgender policy have spurred protest   both at the grassroots level and from professional group such a the Alberta Medical Association  There wa a student walkout at high school across the province last week to show support to student who would be affected by the policy  This report by The Canadian Press wa first published Feb  15  2024  Colette Derworiz  The Canadian Press See a typo mistake  Have a story tip  This ha been shared 0 time 0
