teenager Brianna Ghey ha said the  trans hate  aimed at her daughter online is  horrendous  a she called for a crackdown on social medium and mobile phone usage Esther Ghey  37  said she recently reported a comment about her daughter  who is transgender  on X  formerly Twitter  but the company did not take it down  finding it did not breach their policy  I ve done a few interview now and once the article are posted on Twitter  the comment are absolutely horrendous  and there s a lot of trans hate that s directed to Brianna   Ms Ghey said  Now  I m all for free speech but I actually reported one of these comment and they came back to say that there wa nothing wrong with what wa being said  It s just complete hate and I don t think that there s a place online for that  Brianna s mother Esther Ghey is calling for a crackdown on social medium and mobile phone usage  PA Brianna  16  wa brutally stabbed to death by Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe  both now aged 16 but who were 15 at the time  after they lured her to Culcheth Linear Park near Warrington on 11 February last year The harrowing four week trial at Manchester Crown Court heard how the  warped  pair had a fascination for violence  torture and murder  and shared a  thirst for killing   with Jenkinson downloading a browser allowing her to search the  dark web  for  red room  showing real life torture and killing video After the pair were sentenced to life imprisonment earlier this month  Brianna s mother Esther Ghey  37  began campaigning for improved safeguarding of child against the risk of accessing harmful content online  including an age limit for smartphone usage and stricter control on access to social medium apps  Ms Ghey said it wa  absolutely shocking that a young person can access the dark web  Brianna herself accessed eating disorder and self harm content on X  which worsened her mental health struggle Ms Ghey said company such a X have a  moral responsibility  to protect young people from harm online  and she belief the Online Safety Act doe not go far enough Brianna  16  wa brutally stabbed to death in Culcheth Linear Park near Warrington on 11 February last year  PA Wire She said  nothing is in the diary yet  regarding a potential meeting with prime minister Rishi Sunak  but added   I am hoping to arrange something soon after I ve had a short break  She said she would like to  get his view  on online safety for young people and to discus her Peace in Mind campaign to train more teacher in mindfulness Referring to the comment made about her daughter  Ms Ghey expressed concern for child and young people seeing  this hateful way of speaking  and she would  like to sit down and speak to the regulator and social medium company    Social medium company  have got u into this mess now and it is their responsibility to get u out of it  and it s something that we can all work on together   she said  Social medium company and mobile phone company have both got a moral responsibility to not think about profit so much and actually think about how their product is impacting the people who are using it  Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe  both now aged 16 but who were 15 at the time  murdered Brianna after they lured her to Culcheth Linear Park near Warrington on 11 February last year  PA Media Ms Ghey s comment came a she announced  75 000 had been raised by Peace in Mind to train more teacher in mindfulness  a cognitive skill focused on being in the present moment The campaign ha raised enough money for a teacher in every school in her town of Warrington  Cheshire  to be trained in mindfulness  with ambition to spread the campaign around the country  I feel that if we did have mindfulness in school from a young age then that may have made  Brianna  more resilient  and she would have been le at risk of the thing that she wa going through when she wa a teenager   Ms Ghey said Ms Ghey recently discussed her campaign to get mindfulness taught in school with Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer  which she said wa  a really positive meeting   although Sir Keir did not commit to banning smartphones for young people if Labour won the general election  We explained about mindfulness and how we would like to get into school  and we gave him a roundabout costing and he would like to get more information and is happy to receive how much it would actually cost   Ms Ghey said  I suppose that I understand that he can t commit without having all of the information there  so I think the fact that he s asked for that information is a very positive step in the right direction  Ms Ghey recently discussed her campaign to get mindfulness taught in school with Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer  Getty Images Ms Ghey ha found strength in building her daughter s legacy  but added   Obviously  I have bad day and my daughter struggle quite a bit still  We ve completely changed our life so we don t notice the hole where Brianna wa quite so much  We really made a conscious effort to remember her for all the good thing and to remember her for who she wa  Emily Slater  chief executive of the Mindfulness in Schools Project  which is receiving fund raised by Ms Ghey s Peace in Mind campaign to train more teacher in mindfulness  said   We have a fantastic representative in Esther  for parent and for common sense  and I think we d be hard pressed to find many family at the moment  many parent  that aren t asking themselves question about mobile phone use or the wellbeing of their child and young people  Ms Ghey also on Thursday met Ian Russell  the father of 14 year old Molly Russell  who took her own life in November 2017 after viewing harmful material on social medium Speaking together to the BBC  Mr Russell told Ms Ghey that while  it s never been that easy to be a teenager   social medium wa providing a fresh challenge for young people to navigate He said   We both lost child who had seen harmful thing online and  in your case  there were other child involved who had been motivated to murder by what they d seen online  It s almost impossible for a parent to monitor and mirror and know what their Ratcliffe earlier this year  A judge concluded a  secondary motive  for the killing  wa hostility towards Brianna because of her transgender identity   Brianna s mum Esther Ghey  37  said comment on article posted on X  formerly known a Twitter  following her daughter s death have been  absolutely horrendous  and  absolute hate   She told the PA news agency she reported a comment about her daughter on the social medium platform  but the company did not take it down  finding it did not breach their policy  Join our WhatsApp Top Stories and Breaking News group by clicking this link  Ms Ghey said company such a X have a  moral responsibility  to protect young people from harm online  after her daughter Brianna  struggled with her mental health  which wa worsened by accessing eating disorder and self harm content on the platform  She also said  nothing is in the diary yet  regarding a potential meeting with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak  but added   I am hoping to arrange something soon after I ve had a short break   She said she would like to  get his view  on online safety for young people and to discus her Peace in Mind campaign to train more teacher in mindfulness   I ve done a few interview now and once the article are posted on Twitter  the comment are absolutely horrendous  and there s a lot of trans hate that s directed to Brianna   Ms Ghey said   Now  I m all for free speech but I actually reported one of these comment and they came back to say that there wa nothing wrong with what wa being said  It s just complete hate and I don t think that there s a place online for that   Brianna Ghey  Image  PA  Ms Ghey expressed concern for child and young people seeing  this hateful way of speaking  and she would  like to sit down and speak to the regulator and social medium company     Social medium company  have got u into this mess now and it is their responsibility to get u out of it  and it s something that we can all work on together   she said   Social medium company and mobile phone company have both got a moral responsibility to not think about profit so much and actually think about how their product is impacting the people who are using it   She is campaigning for an age limit for smartphone usage and stricter control on access to social medium apps  Asked what she thought of X owner Elon Musk describing himself a a  free speech absolutist   she added   If people can comment on post that young people are putting up in such a disgusting way and when you report it  nothing happens  it s a bit of a ridiculous title to call himself   Ms Ghey said the Online Safety Act doe not go far enough  Asked what she would say to those in Government and elsewhere who have said the Bill is strong enough to protect young people  Ms Ghey said   Would they still be happy for their child to be scrolling on social medium for the amount of time that most child are scrolling on social medium once the act is in place   I think that  probably  I wouldn t be   One of Brianna s murderer accessed violent content on the dark web a part of the internet which allows user to be untraceable a they plotted to kill the teenager  and Ms Ghey said it wa  absolutely shocking that a young person can access the dark web   She said   Before all of this I didn t even realise that the dark web wa actually a thing  I thought it wa like something that wa just made up in film  and the fact that somebody who is 15 can access it is so disturbing  and it s so worrying  It s beyond belief really   Ms Ghey plan to meet the mother of Scarlett Jenkinson  one of her daughter s murderer  although a date ha not yet been arranged   When I do meet her  it s going to be a very personal and very private thing between both of u   she said  Ms Ghey s comment came a she announced  75 000 had been raised by Peace in Mind to train more teacher in mindfulness  a cognitive skill focused on being in the present moment  The campaign ha raised enough money for a teacher in every school in her town of Warrington  Cheshire  to be trained in mindfulness  with ambition to spread the campaign around the country   I feel that if we did have mindfulness in school from a young age then that may have made  Brianna  more resilient  and she would have been le at risk of the thing that she wa going through when she wa a teenager   Ms Ghey said  Ms Ghey recently discussed her campaign to get mindfulness taught in school with Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer  which she said wa  a really positive meeting   although Sir Keir did not commit to banning smartphones for young people if Labour won the general election   We explained about mindfulness and how we would like to get into school  and we gave him a roundabout costing and he would like to get more information and is happy to receive how much it would actually cost   Ms Ghey said  Brianna Ghey s mother Esther Ghey making a statement to the waiting medium outside Manchester Crown Court  after a boy and a girl  both 16  have been found guilty of the murder of the teenager in a park in Culcheth  near Warrington  Brianna  16  wa stabbed with a hunting knife 28 time in her head  neck  chest and back after being lured to Linear Park on the afternoon of February 11  Picture date  Wednesday December 20  2023   Image  PA Wire PA Images   I suppose that I understand that he can t commit without having all of the information there  so I think the fact that he s asked for that information is a very positive step in the right direction   Ms Ghey ha found strength in building her daughter s legacy  but added   Obviously  I have bad day and my daughter struggle quite a bit still    We ve completely changed our life so we don t notice the hole where Brianna wa quite so much  We really made a conscious effort to remember her for all the good thing and to remember her for who she wa   Emily Slater  chief executive of the Mindfulness in Schools Project  which is receiving fund raised by Ms Ghey s Peace in Mind campaign to train more teacher in mindfulness  said   We have a fantastic representative in Esther  for parent and for common sense  and I think we d be hard pressed to find many family at the moment  many parent  that aren t asking themselves question about mobile phone use or the wellbeing of their child and young people   Ms Ghey also on Thursday met Ian Russell  the father of 14 year old Molly Russell  who took her own life in November 2017 after viewing harmful material on social medium  Speaking together to the BBC  Mr Russell told Ms Ghey that while  it s never been that easy to be a teenager   social medium wa providing a fresh challenge for young people to navigate  He said   We both lost child who had seen harmful thing online and  in your case  there were other child involved who had been motivated to murder by what they d seen online  It s almost impossible for a parent to monitor and mirror and know what their child are doing in Salt Lake City  Rick Bowmer AP CNN   Utah s State Legislature ha voted to censure a state board of education member whose social medium post last week appeared to raise question about a high school girl s gender  Natalie Cline  a member of the Utah State Board of Education since 2020  posted a photo of the high school basketball player and falsely implied the student is transgender  writing   Girls  basketball   The teenage girl in Utah faced threat after Cline s post  which drew condemnation from Gov  Spencer Cox and Lt  Gov  Deidre Henderson   who both urged state education official to hold her accountable  On Wednesday  the Utah State Board of Education approved a resolution to censure Cline  stripping her of committee assignment and asking her to resign  according to a news release   The Board voted to request Member Cline s resignation from the Board by February 19  2024   the board said in the release   Additionally  she will be removed from all committee assignment  not be allowed to place item on upcoming Board agenda  and prohibited from attending any Board advisory committee meeting   Both house of Utah s Legislature on Thursday passed a censure resolution against Cline  saying that her  bullying and failure to treat a student with dignity and respect undermine the mission of the USBE and display a selfish indifference to her sworn oath to discharge her board member duty with fidelity    Cline s abhorrent action caused the student emotional harm and exposed the student to relentless harassment and bullying  including threat of violence that created a need for additional security at the student s school   the resolution say  Transgender right activist wave a transgender flag a they protest the killing of transgender woman this year  at a rally in Washington Square Park in New York  U S   May 24  2019  REUTERS Demetrius Freeman Demetrius Freeman Reuters Related article Largest survey of transgender people in the US reveals key insight at a time when trans right are under attack The governor later signed the resolution censuring Cline   The vast majority of Utahns agree that Natalie Cline s behavior wa unacceptable  I ve spoken with the student s parent and I m heartbroken for this family  We agree with the action of both the State Board of Education and Legislature  and we hope the voter will hold her equally accountable this fall   the governor s office wrote  CNN ha reached out to Cline for comment  After Cline s social medium post  the parent of the high school girl urged Cline to resign from the school board  telling CNN affiliate KSL that their daughter is a tomboy who ha short hair  wear baggy clothing and ha muscle from going to the gym   To look at someone s outer appearance and make an assumption that they re either playing in the right arena or not  based on how someone look I don t think is appropriate   the girl s mother told KSL   It just broke our heart that we needed to have this conversation with our daughter   Cline last week issued a public apology in a Facebook post that also pointed to her free speech right   My deepest apology for the negative attention my post drew to innocent student and their family   she wrote  Maya Stanton  12  and her mother Lisa are photographed at their Colorado home on January 26  2024  Laura Oliverio CNN Related article Anguish lingers a transgender kid  family seek medical care outside Texas   and fight a state ban In the post  which ha the header  Constitutionally Protected Speech   Cline say she removed her original post to protect the player after parent raised concern  and she asserted she  never claimed the student wa a boy    She doe have a larger build  like her parent   Cline said of the high school girl   We live in strange time when it is normal to pause and wonder if people are what they say they are because of the push to normalize transgenderism in our society   Cline s statement came after a record breaking year for anti LGBTQ legislation and the enactment of new law targeting transgender people around the country  In 2022  the Utah legislature banned transgender girl from competing in high school sport  The bill wa vetoed by Cox  who said it targeted a marginalized group with a high suicide rate  but in March of that year GOP lawmaker overrode the governor s veto  CNN s Emma Tucker contributed to this report  Related title: Legislature censure   impeach   Utah school board member Natalie Cline
summary: The Utah Legislature voted Thursday to censure embattled Utah State Board of Education member Natalie Cline  who falsely suggested on social medium that a high school athlete wa transgender  despite the student s parent requesting that the Legislature impeach Cline
source_text: Legislature censure   doesn t impeach   Utah school board member Natalie ClineThe family of a student targeted by Cline told House Speaker Mike Schultz they wanted Cline to be impeached  Trent Nelson   The Salt Lake Tribune  Senate President Stuart Adams  R Layton  and House Speaker Mike Schultz  R Hooper  hold a news conference to address the Natalie Cline situation at the Utah Capitol in Salt Lake City on Thursday  Feb  15  2024 By Emily Anderson Stern   Feb  15  2024  9 30 p m    Updated  Feb  16  2024  3 28 a m The Utah Legislature voted Thursday to censure embattled Utah State Board of Education member Natalie Cline  who falsely suggested on social medium that a high school athlete wa transgender  despite the student s parent requesting that the Legislature impeach Cline Titled  House Concurrent Resolution Condemning and Censuring State School Board Member Natalie Cline   the resolution detail why lawmaker believe Cline s  abhorrent action  are wrong  It say her action  violate the moral and ethical standard expected of an elected official  particularly one charged with the duty to support our child in public education   Now  therefore   the resolution read   be it resolved that the Legislature of the state of Utah  the Governor concurring therein  condemns and denounces board member Cline s repugnant attack on a student in the strongest possible term and find such behavior irreconcilable with the responsibility of a Utah State Board of Education member  In a statement responding to the vote  the student s father  Al van der Beeken  said   It s not the resolution we were hoping for  but it s a step in the right direction  He continued  saying the family is waiting to see if Cline answer call to resign  adding   It might send a bigger message if the people of Utah have had their eye opened a little more a a result of this and don t reelect her  Our state and our child deserve to be represented by people we can trust and that don t undermine and bully our child  Sandy Republican Rep  Robert Spendlove opened a file to create the resolution last week  with Senate Majority Whip Ann Millner also sponsoring the resolution in the Senate Spendlove said on the House floor Thursday that his resolution didn t open impeachment proceeding against Cline because the Utah State Board of Education had already stripped her of the majority of her duty  The state school board voted Wednesday evening to request that Cline resign from her seat While lawmaker over and over called the resolution censuring Cline  historical   it doe not include binding consequence Because the Legislature censured Cline rather than impeaching her  the GOP school board member will be able to remain on the ballot and participate in the Salt Lake County Republican Party s nominating convention in April  The primary election is in June Cox signed the bill shortly after it passed  saying in a statement that he agrees with the Legislature s action  He acknowledged the possibility of her reelection  saying   we hope the voter will hold her equally accountable this fall  In his monthly appearance on PBS Utah earlier Thursday  Cox expressed thought similar to Spendlove s  What happened yesterday ha effectively removed her from any action with the board   Cox told reporter   Whether or not she s impeached is probably immaterial at this point because that is  in effect  what happened  Two representative   Blanding Republican Rep  Phil Lyman and West Valley City Democratic Rep  Brett Garner   voted against the resolution  Lyman said in a text Thursday afternoon that  Cline s social medium activity  in my observation  did not warrant legislative involvement   adding that he  validate s  the feeling of  the student and her family As Spendlove explained why the Legislature wa not impeaching  Garner shook his head in apparent disappointment  He told reporter after the vote that he did not feel a censure wa a severe enough consequence After the House vote  the Utah Senate unanimously passed the resolution Democrats were largely not included in the discussion a to what action lawmaker should take against Cline   the majority of which happened in caucus meeting  As the House prepared to vote on it  Minority Leader Angela Romero repeatedly mouthed   no   while making eye contact with House Speaker Mike Schultz  Trent Nelson   The Salt Lake Tribune  House Minority Leader Angela Romero  D Salt Lake City  speaks a House Democrats hold a news conference to address the Natalie Cline situation at the Utah Capitol in Salt Lake City on Thursday  Feb  15  2024 During a news conference after the resolution passed  Romero said she had prepared a substitute resolution that would have started impeachment proceeding  That substitute wa not brought up for debate  We re here talking to the community now  letting the community know that we heard them and we wanted to start the proceeding to impeach Natalie Cline  but weren t given the opportunity on the floor today   Romero said Schultz told reporter in a separate news conference that the substitute wa not considered because lawmaker voted to end debate on the resolution  That decision wa made with a voice vote  not a roll call vote  so it s unclear how many lawmaker may have supported continuing debate and hearing the substitute Prior to the resolution becoming public  Schultz said Thursday morning that the Republican caucus wa  scattered  on how it wanted to approach the issue  so we re trying to narrow everybody s thought   The body  could swing one way or the other  on impeachment  he added The House and Senate Republicans met in a caucus meeting Thursday afternoon  prior to the resolution being made public Impeachment requires the approval of two third of the member of both the House and the Senate   There wa some support in our body for impeachment  but there wa not enough even for a majority vote   Schultz said after the resolution passed The student athlete s parent did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the proposed censure What the student s parent have saidOne reason member of the House were hesitant to impeach Cline  Schultz told reporter Thursday  is because the controversy then  blow up like a mushroom cloud on a national stage   and would result in further harassment of the student and her family He maintained that position following the vote  saying   Impeachment is a political process that we felt like would put that girl and her family in the middle of a tug of war of sort  and become a political football  and I don t think that s what s best for the girl  for the family  or  honestly  I don t think it s right to give Natalie Cline a national platform to speak from  But the student s parent asked Republican House lawmaker to impeach Cline in a closed caucus meeting two day before the resolution wa made public  van der Beek told The Salt Lake Tribune When asked whether he had a conversation with the family in which they changed their position prior to the vote  Schultz said he had talked with the family  but didn t indicate their position on censure On Thursday morning  Schultz initially mischaracterized to reporter what the family had told representative about their wish  The family ha expressed that they have trust and faith in God  and in the process  and that they would be OK   you know  that it s in God s hand  they re going to let it play out   Schultz said After a reporter pointed out that the student s parent wrote in an op ed published in The Tribune on Thursday morning that they  are asking that  following an adequate due process  we can move towards impeachment of Natalie Cline   Schultz amended his response  I know  they mentioned that to myself and to my caucus   Schultz said   But at the end of the day  they said they re comfortable with the process and they placed it in God s hand  Following Schultz s weekly meeting with journalist  van der Beek said in a call with The Tribune that  essentially  that s what we expressed to them   but said in making those remark  he and his wife were referring to themselves   not the Legislature  We do believe that it s really not in our control   van der Beek said   We just felt like it wa an opportunity for u to express our desire what we would like to happen   which  he added  is impeachment Van der Beek continued   We just continue to move forward and if it s not resignation  if it s not impeachment  which of course is our desire  then I guess the next thing is just to let the voter vote  and do what we can to help support putting someone else in her place at the end of this year    Salt Lake Tribune political correspondent Bryan Schott contributed to this story eanderson sltrib comFollow  emilyreandersonDonate to the newsroom now  The Salt Lake Tribune  Inc  is a 501 c  3  public charity and contribution are tax deductible RELATED STORIESOpinion  Natalie Cline bullied our child  and ORDERUtah House vote 72 2 to censure education board s Natalie Cline over social medium postby Brian Mullahy  KUTVThu  February 15th 2024 at 2 08 PMUpdated Fri  February 16th 2024 at 8 03 PM5VIEW ALL PHOTOSNatalie Cline may avoid impeachment but still face rebuke at state capitol  KUTV SALT LAKE CITY  KUTV    No impeachment in the Utah House  but censure of state school board member Natalie Cline  by a vote of 72 2 The House approved HCR 18  a resolution  condemning and censuring  Cline  roughly a week since a social medium post in which Cline implied a girl basketball player wa a transgender athlete Rep  Robert Spendlove said he sponsored the resolution with  a heavy heart   noting he could not find another instance in which the House censured a public official  No child should be bullied   he said For day  House and Senate leader had said all option to sanction Cline were under consideration  including impeachment which would remove her from the board  and ban her from future political office in Utah  I wish we were doing something stronger  but I m glad we re taking this step   said Rep  Carol Spackman Moss  D Holladay Addressing Cline ha been the focus of legislative m disgusted  She blasted an innocent childit s just wrong  At a news conference  Democrats said they wanted impeachment instead to keep Cline from holding public office again in Utah The Senate vote to censure wa unanimous Gov  Spencer Cox signed the resolution for censure hour later saying Cline s behavior wa  unacceptable   The vast majority of Utahns agree that Natalie Cline s behavior wa title: Utah legislature censure Natalie Cline  stopping short impeachment
summary: The Utah House of Representatives ha filed a resolution to censure controversial Utah State Board of Education member Natalie Cline over an incendiary social medium post targeting a student athlete
source_text: 1 weather alert 1 closing delay Watch Now Watch Now 1 weather alert 1 closing delay Menu Search site Watch Now Watch Now Close x Live Watch Alerts Search site Go News Local News National Natalie Cline  stopping short of impeachment Prev Next By  Ben Winslow Posted at 1 45 PM  Feb 15  2024 and last updated 2024 02 15 23 43 36 05 SALT LAKE CITY   The Utah State Legislature passed a resolution to censure controversial Utah State Board of Education member Natalie Cline over an incendiary social medium post targeting a student athlete House Concurrent Resolution 18 wa filed and passed both chamber on Thursday before being quickly signed by Governor Spencer Cox  It is the first time in state history that a sitting state office holder ha been censured by the Utah State Legislature  Natalie Cline recklessly used her social medium platform to bully a child   said Rep  Robert Spendlove  R Sandy  who sponsored the resolution Cline  an outspoken social conservative  ha been condemned on Utah s Capitol Hill for a Facebook post she made insinuating that a high school student athlete is transgender  She is not  As a result of the social medium post  the girl s family ha received harassment that continues to this day  At one point  the girl wa receiving security protection The resolution stop short of impeachment  which is something some in the House and Senate had been pushing for  But lawmaker lined up to condemn Cline s behavior Rep  Susan Pulsipher  R West Jordan  said elected official   action do matter   What ha happened here  Cannot be tolerated   said a visibly emotional Rep  Dan Johnson  R Logan  a retired school principal Rep  Jordan Teuscher  R West Jordan  pointed out to his House colleague that Cline is the school board member for his district  He rallied lawmaker in support of the censure  We have to spend our time with someone who ha taken such reckless action that there is no other option for u to take out this time and call out what we see is real evil   he told the House It passed the House on a 71 2 vote  Rep  Phil Lyman  R Blanding  told FOX 13 News he believed the resolution went too far and voter should decide Cline s fate  I m not a big fan of condemnation and I felt like this one had enough political implication  motivation I felt the legislature should respectfully decline to participate in that   he said  acknowledging that his colleague felt otherwise Rep  Brett Garner  D West Valley City voted against the censure motion because it didn t go far enough  I feel like this resolution wa an endorsement of Board member Cline s action  Her continued action  Not a censure at all   he told reporter after the vote House Democrats were frustrated there wa no impeachment  Minority Leader Angela Romero  D Salt Lake City  said their effort to introduce article of impeachment were ignored    Cline s  refusal to acknowledge and address her action through resignation is very disappointing and censorship can only do so much   Rep  Romero said  In the Senate  the resolution passed unanimously  Senate Majority Whip Ann Millner  R Ogden  condemned Cline for what she did and said they need to stand against bullying  No child should be bullied especially by adult let alone by an elected official in a position of trust  Not only wa this girl targeted  but her family  her basketball team and her entire school   she told her Senate colleague Senate Minority Leader Luz Escamilla  D Salt Lake City  said her caucus would support the resolution  However  she warned her colleague that if Cline posted anything similar in the future she would not hesitate to seek impeachment  We are glad we could come together on this and stand united in censuring an individual that ha a lengthy history of hateful and discriminatory rhetoric including homophobic  transphobic and racist comment   Sen  Escamilla said Cline ha declined to comment to FOX 13 News on the post and the outrage over it  pointing instead to another Facebook post where she apologized for negative attention her post drew to  innocent student and their family   When legislation is created targeting the transgender community  people will try to judge body to assume who s in that community   said Sue Robbins with Equality Utah  This year  we passed a bill that is wrapped around bathroom and other privacy space  and we will see people try to be the enforcer and judge other people s body to determine whether they belong in a space or not   she said   We ve warned the legislature about this before they pas the bill  Natalie Cline s social medium post is ground for impeachment  said Jeff Merchant  Executive Director of the Alliance for a Better Utah  This is a situation where we had a member of the state School Board engage in cyberbullying against a student  and the legislature decided to slap her on the wrist   he said Al Van Der Beek  the father of the student who wa targeted by Cline  sent the following statement to FOX 13 News  It s not the resolution we were hoping for  but it s a step in the right direction  We ll wait and see if Ms  Cline follows through with what her peer on state board  the governor  member of the legislation and thousand of parent recommend she doe and resigns  It might send a bigger message if the people of Utah have had their eye opened a little more a a result of this and don t re elect her  Our state and our child deserve to be represented by people we can trust and that don t undermine and bully our child  Utah political leader have repeatedly called for Cline to resign  House Speaker Mike Schultz said he and other member of House GOP leadership met with Cline last week  whom he said ha  dug in  and refused to resign from office  I wa really disappointed with Natalie s comment   the Speaker told reporter of the meeting   I think Natalie  unfortunately  feel like she s the victim in this and it s sad  Speaker Schultz said he also ha been speaking with the family of the girl targeted in the social medium post  and he wanted to do what is best for her and her family  Asked by FOX 13 News why he didn t pursue impeachment  Speaker Schultz candidly said the House did not have the two third majority to proceed He also suggested impeachment would become a national medium circus and he didn t want Cline to have the platform  I don t think that s what s best for the girl  for the family or honestly  I don t think it s right to give Natalie Cline a national platform to speak from   he said   And that would do that  In a couple short month  the voter will hold her accountable at the ballot box  On Wednesday night  the Utah State Board of Education met and voted unanimously to strip Cline of her duty and censure her  Cline refused to attend the meeting Under Utah law  the board cannot remove her from office  The House of Representatives in the Utah State Legislature could impeach her from office At his monthly news conference on Thursday  Governor Spencer Cox said he supported impeachment of Cline in the House of Representatives  but said the state school board s action did  effectively impeach  her  Whether or not she s impeached probably is immaterial at this point because that s in effect what happened  She s not participating in meeting  she s not able to participate on committee  she doesn t have authority to put agenda item on   the governor said   That s effectively what ha happened  But absent impeachment  there is a chance that Cline can be re elected  As FOX 13 News reported last week  Gov  Cox and Lt  Governor Deidre Henderson both personally donated to the campaign of Amanda Bollinger  who is challenging Cline for the Republican nomination for school board The governor acknowledged the possibility that voter could send Cline back to the state school board for another term  In other state  he pointed out  the state school board is appointed by the governor The American Civil Liberties of Utah blasted state political leader for creating a climate that allowed the Cline situation to happen thanks to a series of bill over the year targeting transgender people  And despite warning of the consequence from kid  parent  teacher  medical professional  and advocacy group  we are seeing tragic and embarrassing result where adult are targeting child  We can t be surprised when policy violence lead to community violence and leadership violence   the group said in a statement  later adding  Until state official repudiate these law  we will all suffer the legal and social consequence they have created  It doesn t have to be this way  We call on Utah s lawmaker to repeal all law attacking the right of LGBTQ  people in Utah that have created an environment of dehumanization  exclusion  and News Food   Drink Music Culture Browse Things To Do Promotions Events Browse Film Film Reviews February 15  2024 News Natalie Cline censured by school board and Legislature  Gov  Cox predicts a Donald Trump win in November Publicly Schooled By Benjamin Wood  BjaminWood Tweet Pin It Email Print Favorite Saving  Utah Board of Education State school board member Natalie Cline wa denounced and censured by the Utah Legislature on Thursday  UNIVERSITY Utah Gov  Spencer Cox said Thursday that the question of whether to impeach controversial state school board member Natalie Cline is effectively moot after Cline s board colleague voted to take disciplinary action against her on Wednesday  In a unanimous decision  the Utah Board of Education adopted a resolution censuring Cline and formally seeking her resignation  stripping her of board committee assignment and her power to place item on the board agenda  and prohibiting her from attending advisory meeting  The vote followed a week of widespread condemnation against Cline  with lawmaker  local district school board  city council and advocacy group calling for her resignation and or removal after Cline falsely insinuated on social medium that a high school athlete wa transgender  posting the student s image and identifying information and generating a torrent of hateful and dangerous rhetoric from Cline s follower  Speaking to reporter at his monthly televised press conference at PBS Utah  Cox said he supported the school board s action  adding that it ha the practical effect of ending Cline s power and influence over public education   What I think should be done is I think she should resign  That s the right thing to do that s the best thing to do   Cox said   Whether or not she s impeached probably is immaterial at this point  That is  in effect  what ha happened   click to enlarge Laura Seitz   Pool Photo Gov  Spencer Cox take question at his monthly televised press conference on Thursday  Feb  15  2024 By Thursday afternoon  both chamber of the Utah Legislature voted to approve a resolution censuring Cline  denouncing and condemning her  repugnant  behavior in the  strongest possible term   Sandy Republican Rep  Robert Spendlove  the resolution s House sponsor  said that lawmaker were in  uncharted territory  with no comparable example in state history  But Cline  he said  had violated the public trust   The action of Miss Cline are so outrageous  so abhorrent and so reprehensible that we must act   Spendlove said  While the Senate wa unanimous in it vote for the censure  two House member opposed the resolution  Rep  Brett Garner  D West Valley  and Rep  Phil Lyman  R Blanding  Garner released a statement suggesting that  without the launch of impeachment proceeding  the resolution did not go far enough in response to Cline s action  Alternately  Lyman said that condemnation is a strong action for lawmaker to take   Natalie Cline s social medium activity  in my observation  did not warrant legislative involvement   Lyman said   I have also observed the action of some who may have political motif   On impeachment  Spendlove said the state is better served by acting quickly to condemn Cline and that an effort to remove Cline from office would likely feed into her hunger for notoriety   These people crave attention and they will do anything to get this attention  even resorting to outrageous and abhorrent behavior   Spendlove said  Cline issued a muddled apology after deleting the initial post that incited the backlash but ha otherwise defended herself and her action in subsequent statement  Prior to the school board s vote to censure her  Cline accused her colleague and other critic of engaging in  election interference  a she is up for election against challenger who are broadly expected to defeat her if she attempt to weather the current controversy and remain in the race   Hardened criminal get better due process than I am being provided   Cline wrote on Facebook   Is a decision by the  School  Board legitimate if you don t provide the accused with proper due process right    Asked about Cline s claim on Thursday  Cox wa dismissive of the insinuation  noting that the otherwise ideologically divided school board wa united in it disdain for Cline s behavior  He also dismissed the idea that he and lawmaker were complicit in creating an environment of gender vigilantism by their passing and his signing of anti transgender legislation restricting a person from participating in sport  accessing health care and  new this year  using gender designated restroom and locker room that correspond with their gender identify   We are all personally responsible for our action  Natalie Cline is an adult  this is not the first time that she ha done thing like this   Cox said   Even if this young person wa transgender  it would still have been inappropriate  That is not who we are or what we should be doing     I think you see that with the backlash the backlash ha been profound  it s been unanimous   Cox also spent a considerable amount of Thursday s press conference talking about the immigration crisis at the southern U S  border and it potential impact on November s presidential election  Cox suggested that President Joe Biden s poor handling of the crisis would cost him the election and lead to a second term for former President Donald Trump  An occasional critic of Trump  by Republican standard  Cox said he would not be voting for the former president and would prefer to see Nikki Haley win the Republican nomination  but wa nonetheless prepared to work with whomever occupies the White House in January   I would love to see Haley nominated and win but I think it s pretty clear that s not going to happen   Cox said   I don t hate people that support Donald Trump  I know why they do that and I think we would be better off asking that question   Cox wa critical of both Biden and Trump s advanced age  suggesting that U S  president should not be octogenarian  He said if either of the major party abandoned their frontrunner and nominated another  younger candidate  that party would likely win in November by  historic  margin   I think we re making a huge mistake a Americans  we should be nominating different people   Cox said   I think people support president Biden because he s not Donald Trump  When you put another candidate like Nikki Haley on the ballot  people don t support president Biden   click to enlarge Larry H  Miller Company A rendering of The Power District and a new Major League Baseball stadium along the Jordan River  planned for development on Salt Lake City s west side  On other topic  Cox continued to express optimism that Utah will launch Major League Baseball and National Hockey League team in the coming year  Just before his press conference  the Larry H  Miller Company released new rendering for their proposed baseball stadium on the west side of Salt Lake City and announced a  3 5 billion investment into development of the so called Power District on North Temple   We are passionate about this once in a generation opportunity to invest in our capital city   Miller Company CEO Steve Starks said in a prepared statement   This project will serve a a vibrant extension of and gateway to downtown Salt Lake  complement the mission of the State Fairpark  and brings the Jordan River to life  The Power District will be a gathering place for Utah s family to live  work  play and enjoy the best view in Major League Baseball   Cox reiterated that while he s opposed to  writing out a check to billionaire  to build sporting facility  he support and anticipates tax increment financing and other incentive being made available to shape and facilitate investment in the area  which wa long neglected by both the state and city   This is kind of an outside indication that everything we ve been working on for the past decade is working and Utah s arrow is pointing up   Cox said  Cox also commented on the litigation filed by opponent of the new Utah State Flag  seeking to overcome their deficit in a signature gathering campaign that attempted to place adoption of the new design on the ballot for a public vote   I think it s a tremendous waste of resource   Cox said   I m confident that like everything else they ve tried so far will fail a Archives and History  a change proposed after some lawmaker were upset about the department hosting a lecture on LGBTQ  history State senator also approved legislation that would allow local government official to dismiss library board member they appointed if they become displeased with their performance  Both bill now move to the Alabama House of Representatives  The Archives  monthly lunchtime lecture series last year included a June presentation titled  Invisible No More  Alabama s LGBTQ  History   The lecture discussed topic ranging from the state s first Pride march to the contribution of gay Alabamians Sen  Chris Elliott  the sponsor of the bill approved Wednesday  said a dozen lawmaker called the Archives urging them to cancel the lecture but the department went forward with it   This isn t history  This is indoctrination   Elliott said during debate  He said the change would ensure board member are responsive to elected official   I m making sure that there is some accountability   Elliott said  Senate Minority Leader Bobby Singleton told Elliott that his bill appeared to be retribution because department official didn t change course when  big bad senator  called   I let history be history   Singleton said  The board currently ha two member from each congressional district  two at large member  and the governor  Board member are selected by a vote of the trustee and confirmed by the Alabama Senate  Current board member include famed civil right lawyer Fred Gray  who is perhaps best known for representing Rosa Parks after she refused to give up her seat on a segregated Montgomery city bus in 1955  Under the legislation  the board would be appointed by the governor  lieutenant governor and legislative leader  The bill dealing with the Archives wa approved on a 25 8 vote  The bill related to local library is being debated a conservative group in several state have tried to remove or restrict access to child s book with LGBTQ content Already have an account  Log in here   MONTGOMERY  Ala   AP    The Alabama Senate voted Wednesday to put a politically appointed board in control of the Alabama Department of Archives and History  a change proposed after some lawmaker were upset about the department hosting a lecture on LGBTQ  history  State senator also approved legislation that would allow local government official to dismiss library board member they appointed if they become displeased with their performance  Both bill now move to the Alabama House of Representatives  The Archives  monthly lunchtime lecture series last year included a June presentation titled  Invisible No More  Alabama s LGBTQ  History   The lecture discussed topic ranging from the state s first Pride march to the contribution of gay Alabamians  Sen  Chris Elliott  the sponsor of the bill approved Wednesday  said a dozen lawmaker called the Archives urging them to cancel the lecture but the department went forward with it   This isn t history  This is indoctrination   Elliott said during debate  He said the change would ensure board member are responsive to elected official   I m making sure that there is some accountability   Elliott said  Senate Minority Leader Bobby Singleton told Elliott that his bill appeared to be retribution because department official didn t change course when  big bad senator  called   I let history be history   Singleton said  The board currently ha two member from each congressional district  two at large member  and the governor  Board member are selected by a vote of the trustee and confirmed by the Alabama Senate  Current board member include famed civil right lawyer Fred Gray  who is perhaps best known for representing Rosa Parks after she refused to give up her seat on a segregated Montgomery city bus in 1955  Under the legislation  the board would be appointed by the governor  lieutenant governor and legislative leader  The bill dealing with the Archives wa approved on a 25 8 vote  The bill related to local library is being debated a conservative group in several state have tried to remove or restrict access to child s book with LGBTQ content  Elliott said existing state law give 11 38 AM ET Font Size  Over 30 teen and preteen girl who identified a transgender had their breast removed at a Northern California healthcare system from 2013 to 2020  according to a study published in May 2022  The study focused on female patient who received a mastectomy under the Kaiser Permanente Northern California healthcare system by measuring the patient s  gender affirming mastectomy referral  The number of transgender patient who had mastectomy in the next age category  from 14 to 15 year old  jumped to over 50  while at least 60 of the patient were between the age of 16 and 17  according to the study  Under Kaiser s care guideline  doctor could refer minor patient for a mastectomy even if they hadn t been on hormone or lived in the  desired gender role  for a full year   Clinicians at KPNC provide care in accordance with the WPATH guideline  which state that gender affirming mastectomy may be advised for patient  18 year preferably after living in the desired gender role for at least one year without hormone therapy a an absolute requirement   the study read   Adolescents with gender dysphoria can be referred to the KPNC Multi specialty Transitions  MST  Department by their pediatrician  endocrinologist  therapist  parent  or self if   13 year of age   In a Northern California health system  209 preteen or teen girl underwent double mastectomy a gender affirming care between 2013 and 2020  15  of these girl were 12  or 13 year old  That s 32 girl who were 12  or 13 year old when they had their breast removed  pic twitter com o9YbDw5lsx   Kevin Bass PhD MS   kevinnbass  February 14  2024 The researcher lamented  barrier  to transgender medical procedure in certain state and said that they hoped to confirm their belief that regret and complication post surgery were low  The study found that the demand for transgender mastectomy increased by 13 fold over the seven year and that 7 3  had complication post surgery and 10 9  went back for a revision   any subsequent procedure that involves the insertion  removal  and or replacement of a prosthesis or implant   Of the 209 patient  only 137 had a follow up of at least one year for the  evaluation of complication and revision  and were included in the total  Out of that subset  the researcher determined that 10 patient had a total of 15 complication including  hematoma  wound infection  seroma  hypertrophic scar requiring steroid injection  or suture granuloma   The study also stated that 127 of the patient said they were satisfied with the procedure  while only two of the patient  who were both 16 at the time  expressed regret  with eight left undocumented  The researcher noted that one of the two patient with regret wa in an  un affirming and unsupportive home and FRANKFORT  Ky   AP    A Republican backed measure to limit diversity  equity and inclusion practice at Kentucky s public university won approval from the state Senate on Tuesday after an emotional debate that delved into race relation and what the bill s sponsor portrayed a the liberal bent on college campus The bill cleared the Senate on a 26 7 vote after a nearly two hour debate  sending the proposal to the House  The GOP ha supermajorities in both chamber  One Democratic lawmaker  predicting a legal challenge  said the final arbiter could be the court Debates revolving around initiative on diversity  equity and inclusion   known a DEI   are playing out in statehouse across the country  So far this year  GOP lawmaker have proposed about 50 bill in 20 state that would restrict DEI initiative or require their public disclosure  according to an Associated Press analysis using the bill tracking software Plural  Meanwhile  Democrats have filed about two dozen bill in 11 state that would require or promote DEI initiative  In Kentucky  opponent warned the proposed restriction on campus could roll back gain in minority enrollment and stifle campus discussion on topic dealing with past discrimination  READ MORE Republicans work to recruit female and minority candidate even a they criticize diversity program Republican lawmaker are backing dozen of bill targeting diversity effort on campus and elsewhere Kentucky Senate committee advance bill limiting diversity  equity and inclusion initiative The legislation  among other thing  would bar public college and university from providing preferential treatment based on a person s political ideology  It would prohibit the school from requiring people to state specific ideology or belief when seeking admission  employment or promotion  Republican Sen  Mike Wilson said he filed the bill to counter a broader trend in higher education toward denying campus job or promotion to faculty refusing to espouse  liberal ideology fashionable in our public university   He said such practice have extended to student and staff a well  Diversity of thought should be welcomed in our university and higher education   Wilson said   But we ve seen a trend across the United States of forcing faculty  in order to remain employed  to formally endorse a set of belief that may be contrary to their own  all in violation of the First Amendment  Democratic Sen  Reginald Thomas said the proposed restriction would jeopardize success in expanding the number of minority student on Kentucky s university campus   The richness of our diversity and our difference  that s what make u strong   said Thomas  who is Black   We are like a quilt here in America  Wilson responded that there s nothing in the bill to prohibit college from supporting diversity initiative  a long a those effort don t include  discriminatory concept   The legislation set out a host of such concept that would be prohibited  among them that a person  based on their race or gender  bear responsibility for past action committed by other member of the same race or gender  Another is meant to keep people from feeling guilt or discomfort solely because of their race or gender The state attorney general s office would be allowed to take legal action to compel a school s compliance Other senator opposing the bill warned that it restriction could have a chilling effect on what s taught on college campus  They pointed to the woman s suffrage movement and the landmark Supreme Court ruling that outlawed segregation of public school a possible example of topic that could be excluded  In supporting the bill  GOP Sen  Phillip Wheeler said it s important for student to delve into the past and learn about the struggle of people  The bill attempt to  get to a balance  to where we re no longer looked at a the oppressor and the oppressees  that we are each judged on our own merit   he said  I think that some of the vitriol that occurs on the campus  some of the topic  have really done more to divide u than unite u   he added The Supreme Court s June decision ending affirmative action at university ha created a new legal landscape around diversity program in the workplace and civil society On Tuesday  one of the most emotional moment of the Kentucky Senate debate came when Republican Sen  Donald Douglas talked about his own life experience  recalling that some classmate believed he got into medical school because he wa a Black athlete  despite his academic achievement   You know how embarrassed I wa   Douglas said in supporting the bill   How embarrassed I wa to tell them I had an academic scholarship to medical school and I had to explain  a a Black man  how I got a scholarship to medical school   The change proposed in the bill would be painful for some people  Douglas acknowledged  But he predicted that most affected student will  succeed with vigor and they will succeed with a sense that they are responsible for their success and not just the system     The legislation is Senate Bill 6  The Associated Press is an independent global news organization dedicated to factual reporting  Founded in 1846  AP today remains 57 a m    UPDATED  February 15  2024 at 8 28 a m The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado alleges in a lawsuit filed Wednesday that Children s Hospital Colorado is discriminating against transgender patient by refusing to perform surgery it offer to cisgender patient with other condition  The lawsuit  filed in Denver District Court  also state the hospital is discriminating on the basis of disability because gender dysphoria   distress when a person s sense of their gender doesn t align with physical characteristic   is a medical condition  The ACLU filed the lawsuit on behalf of an 18 year old Denver patient who wa on track to receive chest reconstruction surgery before the Aurora hospital discontinued gender affirming surgery for adult last year  Representatives of Children s Hospital Colorado said they couldn t comment Wednesday because the hospital hadn t yet been served with the lawsuit  The main reason young cisgender men seek chest reconstruction surgery is if they developed feminine appearing breast because of hormonal imbalance or medication side effect  according to the lawsuit  The hospital also sometimes performs breast reduction surgery on young woman who have excessive chest tissue that cause pain  the lawsuit said  The patient  who is identified in the lawsuit by the pseudonym Caden Kent  started receiving care at Children s for mental health concern when he wa 16  He wa diagnosed with gender dysphoria a few month later and had undergone about eight month of assessment before determining he wa a candidate for surgery once he turned 18  In July  the hospital announced it would no longer offer chest reconstruction surgery for transgender patient  though they could still receive other gender affirming treatment  including counseling  puberty blocker and hormone therapy  The hospital had only offered surgery to patient who were at least 18  At the time  the hospital stated it had received an unusual number of referral for gender affirming surgery a program shut down in other state  and that it didn t shut down the program because of threat  It came at a time when child s hospital were scrubbing reference to transgender care from their website  though  with at least 21 removing information in 2022  According to the lawsuit  Kent chose to undergo surgery at Children s because he received other care there  and hoped to recover from the surgery before leaving for college in the fall  Other surgical provider who accept his family s insurance were booked up  meaning his parent will have to pay out of pocket for him to undergo the surgery in that time frame  Kent had resorted to chest binding to ease his dysphoria  but found himself withdrawing from others when binding became too painful and he gender affirming surgery for it trans patient wa devastating to Caden  other impacted patient  and Colorado s transgender community   ACLU of Colorado legal director Tim Macdonald said in a news release   Refusal to provide medically necessary care based on the identity of the person seeking it  and the condition for which they are seeking it  is discriminatory and illegal under the Colorado Anti Discrimination Act   One Colorado  a group that advocate for LGBTQ people  said it ha been working with the hospital to address concern and reinstate the option for surgical care there  but support Kent and the lawsuit   While we are grateful for the step Children s Hospital ha taken to repair with our community  we must acknowledge the rippling systemic impact of their decision   setting the precedent for a hospital to provide service to one group of individual but not another   health equity director Alex Floyd said in a news release   For this reason  we stand behind the Darren Whitehead  Janelle Finch Published  2 59 PM MST February 14  2024 Updated  7 00 AM MST February 15  2024 DENVER   The ACLU of Colorado filed a lawsuit Wednesday against Children s Hospital Colorado  claiming the hospital s decision to stop offering gender affirming surgery violated Colorado s Anti Discrimination Act  CADA   The lawsuit  filed on behalf of 18 year old Caden Kent  which is a pseudonym  say Kent began receiving care at Children s Hospital Colorado s TRUE Center for Gender Diversity in 2021 when he wa 16 year old  Kent wa struggling with gender dysphoria that prevented him from  living a full life   the lawsuit claim  In December 2022  Kent began discussing chest masculinization surgery with his doctor and care team at Children s Hospital Colorado  the lawsuit say  The surgery typically consists of subcutaneous mastectomy that is followed by reconstruction of the chest  The ACLU s filing say the surgery is regularly performed on transgender men who have a higher risk of developing cancer  Kent and his family chose a plastic surgeon associated with Children s Hospital Colorado  The family wa told that before surgery  they needed to receive letter of support from an endocrinologist and a mental health professional  a well a insurance preauthorization  the lawsuit say  In May and in June of 2023  Kent received the needed letter of support  On July 13  Kent s insurance authorization came in the mail  The next day  Kent s father sent a message through the patient portal to the surgeon s physician s assistant to schedule the surgery  the lawsuit say  The lawsuit claim Children s Hospital Colorado determined it would no longer provide medically necessary surgery to transgender patient for treatment of gender dysphoria beginning on or about July 13   You re on the cusp of living a your true  authentic self and to have that ripped out from under you is a truly devastating thing   ACLU legal director Tim Macdonald said   We ve talked to lot of people in the community that provide support to the trans community and there ha been a lot of outcry for this about why the hospital chose to make this decision and to try and persuade them to go back to treating people fairly and consistent with the law   The ACLU s suit say Children s Hospital Colorado still offer the same procedure to patient  including non pediatric patient  to treat condition other than gender dysphoria  which violates the Colorado Anti Discrimination Act  on the basis of his sex  gender identity  gender expression  and disability   Kent and his attorney requested  An injunction and order that would require Children s Hospital Colorado comply with CADAA fine of  3 500 or actual monetary damagesThree fine for violating CADA  totaling  1 500  You ve taken one of the provider doing these life affirming  life saving treatment and taken them away  that just increase the burden on the remaining entity that will do that and you have people who are in desperate position who really need these surgery  they re going to have to wait longer and try to find other place that will do the surgery   Macdonald shared  on behalf of his client  Children s Hospital Colorado said they did not immediately have a statement because they had not yet been served with the lawsuit  To this  Macdonald said the lawsuit should not have come a a surprise   Before we filed the lawsuit  we sent them a letter saying we thought this wa a violation of anti discrimination law  so this is not something that came out of the blue   Macdonald said  The letter to Children s wa sent via email on July 31  2023  shortly after the hospital moved to ban the surgical practice   We re pressing our shoulder against the wheel and we re going to try to make sure that the wheel of justice turn a quickly a they can so that Children s will start providing the care that we believe the hospital is lawfully obligated to provide and were providing up until July   Macdonald said  Related Articles Mead teen back on the football field after hospitalization for flu complication Children s Hospital revers course on fully funded tuition benefit cut Some family title: Canadian conservative divided trans policy
summary: Alberta premier s move to ban trans treatment rejected by fellow rightwing leader in OntarioAt the end of January  Danielle Smith  the premier of Alberta  announced a list of policy change targeting transgender youth in the Canadian province  including a ban on hormonal treatment  puberty blocker and gender confirmation surgery for child 15 year old and younger  The move marked the most restrictive rule on gender confirmation in the cou
source_text: policy of Alberta s premier  Danielle Smith  in Toronto on 6 February 2024  Photograph  Canadian Press Rex ShutterstockView image in fullscreenPeople protest against the proposed youth transgender policy of Alberta s premier  Danielle Smith  in Toronto on 6 February 2024  Photograph  Canadian Press Rex ShutterstockCanadaCanadian conservative divided over trans policy Alberta premier s move to ban trans treatment rejected by fellow rightwing leader in OntarioLeyland CeccoWed 14 Feb 2024 08 06 ESTLast modified on Wed 14 Feb 2024 10 13 ESTAt the end of January  Danielle Smith  the premier of Alberta  announced a list of policy change targeting transgender youth in the Canadian province  including a ban on hormonal treatment  puberty blocker and gender confirmation surgery for child 15 year old and younger  The move marked the most restrictive rule on gender confirmation in the country A few day later  Doug Ford   the Conservative premier of Ontario  and one of the most influential politician in Canada   wa asked whether his government intended to follow Smith s policy   No   he told reporter   We have a lot here  and we re leaving everything alone  Canada province us constitutional override to advance pronoun legislationRead moreThe two conservative leader  contrasting view on care for transgender youth highlight the limit of a culture war apparently imported to Canada from the United States  The issue  which affect only a slim minority of youth across the country  ha nonetheless sharply divided political leader within the conservative movement  with some believing it is a losing political issue that put them on the wrong side of public opinion In a video posted to social medium on 31 January  Smith announced a string of what she described a policy change  She said top and bottom gender confirmation surgery would be banned for minor under age 17  although bottom surgery is already limited to adult  While top surgery is permitted in Alberta  reporting also suggests only eight youth received surgery for gender confirmation last year Under the new proposal  hormone therapy will only be available to teen aged 16 and older  with permission from their parent  a physician and a psychologist  instead of at the onset of puberty  Parents will need to give permission before student 15 and under can use a name or pronoun at school other than the one given at birth  Smith said  Students will need to opt in to class dealing with sexuality and gender  reversing previous policy under which parent could have their child opt out of sexual education class  Transgender woman would be banned from woman s sport In the day after the announcement  Smith told the medium the change were motivated by a  concern of what will happen   rather than any current issue facing her government Smith s announcement prompted widespread criticism  both from the Alberta Medical Association  which called on the premier to  reconsider  the proposed policy and to work with  experienced professional  and the Canadian Paediatric Society  which warned that the proposal  will lead to significant negative health outcome  including increased risk of suicide and self harm   It ha to be the most hateful piece of legislation that we ve seen in the LGBTQ community   said Jen Gilbert  a professor at the University of Toronto   They seem to want to take a very small number of young people and turn them into political pawn  And not only doe it hurt those young people  it sends a signal to all queer and trans kid that their identity are up for debate  Gilbert  who specializes in sex education  said Smith s proposed change mirror the legislative activism of conservative in the United States and the burgeoning  parental right movement   These activist are networked with each other and they re sharing technique  strategy about how to affect policy  This particular set of restriction is very similar to what we ve seen proposed in the US   said Gilbert   And these policy that claim to be for the right of parent clearly aren t  what about LGBTQ parent and the parent of queer and trans kid  Months before Alberta waded into the issue  New Brunswick and Saskatchewan   both led by conservative premier   announced change to pronoun policy in school  the latter using the notwithstanding clause of Canada s constitution to block any legal challenge But a a growing list of conservative politician court a fixation on gender issue  Doug Ford ha bucked the trend  Of course  we don t know where he s going to be six month from now  He s the king of the flip flop   said Susan Gapka  a Toronto based community organiser and transgender right activist   But he also care a lot about public opinion  And so his recent stance   that he s not going to get involved in this   ha given me a bit of hope  And hope is something we desperately need right now  Ford ha resisted neat political categorisation amid the deep partisanship that ha come to define modern Canadian politics  He s rightwing  he belief in smaller government  But he s not a driven ideologically a other leader in the province   said Nelson Wiseman  a professor of political science at the University of Toronto   His background is in business  not politics  The Ontario premier also ha a reputation a a leader willing to quickly retreat on major policy proposal if he sens a shift in public opinion against his government  The proposal in Alberta would not stand up to court challenge and so Smith would need to invoke the notwithstanding clause to suspend the fundamental right of trans people if she want to pas these sort of policy   said Gapka   I suspect Doug Ford see this   and realizes it s something he want to avoid  Other Ontario conservative seem baffled by Smith s decision  One told the Toronto Star it wa a  solution in search of a problem  Wiseman said few people in Ontario   or even in Alberta   list gender confirmation for young people a a major voting concern   When you ask people in either province what are the issue  nobody mention this  They talk about inflation  they talk about the environment  And so you re stupid wading into it  But Gapka say about offer  event and update from The Independent  Read our privacy notice Activists and LGBTQ  community member handed out colorful chocolate candy for Valentine s Day in Tokyo on Wednesday  marking the fifth anniversary of the launch of a legal battle to achieve marriage equality for same sex couple Japan is the only member of the Group of Seven nation that still excludes same sex couple from the right to legally marry and receive spousal benefit  Support for legalizing marriage equality ha grown among the Japanese public  but the governing Liberal Democratic Party  known for it conservative family value and reluctance to promote gender equality and sexual diversity  remains the main opposition to the campaign  Gathered outside of a busy downtown Tokyo train station  activist and LGBTQ  community member urged for equal marriage right a they handed out bag of Meiji  marble chocolate  candy   Japan s version of M Ms   with flyer explaining their lawsuit Wednesday is also the fifth anniversary of the launch of first lawsuit petitioning for LGBTQ  marriage right  Since Feb  14  20019  more than a dozen couple have filed lawsuit in six separate case at five court across Japan  Four of the five ruling so far have found that not granting the right wa unconstitutional  one said it wa in line with the constitution while the ruling in the sixth petition  before a district court in Tokyo  is due next month  At Wednesday s rally  41 year old former police officer who go by the name of Kotfe  an alias to protect his identity because of fear for legal ramification  said he and his male partner hope there will be more public awareness and support for sexual diversity and same sex union  He and his partner  a former firefighter  have been together for 12 year and plan to consider marriage once they achieve the right Fumiko Suda  a lawyer representing plaintiff in Japan s northern city of Sapporo   one of the venue of the six legal case   said she wa frustrated over the government s reluctance to legalize marriage equality Marriage equality is now recognized in 36 country  not only in the West but also in Asia  including Taiwan  Thailand and Nepal  according to the Marriage for All Japan  a civil group which Suda is a member of While Japan s conservative government is seen stonewalling diversity  recent survey show a majority of Japanese back legalizing same sex marriage  Support among the business community ha rapidly increased  Though critic said it wa watered down  the government enacted an LGBTQ  awareness promotion law in June  The Supreme Court separately ruled that Japan s law requiring compulsory sterilization surgery for transgender people to officially change their gender is unconstitutional   Despite many year I have spent with my partner  we are considered stranger  not family   in the eye of the law  said Hiromi Hatogai  a lesbian who is part of the case before the Tokyo district court   We only want to marry and  be  legally summary: Parliament is expected to pas bill on Thursday but the rancour it ha caused show country s entrenched social conservatismViktoria Kalfaki can still vividly remember the moment she and her wife  Christina Leimoni  realised they would have to fight for their family s right to exist  The couple  both senior tech company executive who had returned to Greece after year in London  were in hospital with their daughter  Niovi wa two and sick with
