will delete so much stress and anxiety from our daily life   Photograph  suppliedGreece A brilliant start   gay Greeks eager for MPs to legalise same sex marriageParliament is expected to pas bill on Thursday but the rancour it ha caused show country s entrenched social conservatismHelena Smith in AthensThu 15 Feb 2024 00 00 ESTLast modified on Thu 15 Feb 2024 05 02 ESTViktoria Kalfaki can still vividly remember the moment she and her wife  Christina Leimoni  realised they would have to fight for their family s right to exist  The couple  both senior tech company executive who had returned to Greece after year in London  were in hospital with their daughter  Niovi wa two and sick with bronchitis   said Kalfaki  who head the public sector division of Google Cloud in Athens   Naturally we both wanted to be with her but when the doctor asked  Who is the mother   and they heard  We both are   their response wa  That s legally not possible  and they refused to let Christina in  There wa a terrible scene a she argued and implored but they were adamant  Only I  a Niovi s birth mother  could be with her  It wa not the pair s first brush with the law  Months earlier the Greek embassy in London had refused to recognise their daughter s birth certificate because it bore the name of both Kalfaki and Leimoni  I wa reduced to tear   said Kalfaki  who at 45 ha spent more than a third of her life with Leimoni   It wa traumatic  this feeling that a a same sex couple you are not just lesser but helpless under the law  It s then that Christina said we re going to have to fight to protect our right  That fight come full circle on Thursday when the Greek parliament debate legislation that will  if passed in a subsequent vote  make the country the first in south east Europe to legalise same sex marriage For the LGBTQ  community  the milestone bill mark the end of a legal void that ha left many distraught  even if the bill is also criticised for not going far enough  to the consternation of gay and transgender people it doe not amend rule limiting parenthood through surrogacy to single woman and straight couple   Yes  it could be better but the truth is it will also delete so much stress and anxiety from our daily life   said Kalfaki  explaining that a the recipient of reciprocal IVF in the UK   a process where one partner carry an embryo formed with the fertilised egg of the other   their daughter wa a  truly joint creation   Finally we ll not only be recognised legally a partner in marriage but individually a parent   Previously Christina would have had no access to our daughter if anything had happened to me  Niovi would have been sent to a care home  an institution  Few reform in Greece have stirred a much rancour or debate  In the four week since announcing his government s decision to draft the law  the prime minister  Kyriakos Mitsotakis  ha had to face the ire of the powerful Orthodox church  the concern of many MPs in his centre right New Democracy party  ND  and the entrenched social conservatism of a populace resistant to change and suspicious of diversity  Populist tabloid have labelled the law  monstrous  Indicative of the hostility towards the measure  the far right Spartans party leader  Vassilis Stigas  told parliament that the bill wa tantamount to  opening the window  to paedophile a he urged ND MPs to vote against it  while the bishop of Piraeus claimed that homosexuality wa a  mortal sin  and a cause of cancer   Google it and you will see   he told stunned interviewer on Skai TV View image in fullscreenThere were protest in Athens on Sunday against the plan to legalise same sex marriage  Photograph  Yorgos Karahalis APOutrage over the reform wa on full display on Sunday when thousand of people attended a rally in Athens organised by Orthodox religious group to deplore the  sodomisation of Greek society  and pray  in support of the family  With his own lawmaker so divided  Mitsotakis know passage of the bill will only come with support from centrist and leftist party   at a time when he ha faced fierce criticism from the opposition over a spy scandal and curb on medium freedom  But his aide say that is a price the self avowed liberal is willing to pay if it mean changing mindset on an issue that ha remained so taboo The leader  whose party includes rightwing nationalist  had made the revamp of family law a key campaign promise before securing a landslide victory and a second four year term in office last year  Legalising same sex marriage and allowing adoption right for same sex couple wa central to the reform  For him there are no invisible people with fewer right than others   said Akis Skertsos  a minister of state who ha overseen the law   Countries which succeed in sustaining a balance between economic prosperity and personal happiness are those that prioritise civil liberty and rule of law  Skertsos ha led the charge to persuade MPs about the measure s merit  although Mitsotakis say the decision ultimately lie with deputy and he will not enforce party discipline If  a expected  the bill is passed   with the support of other party including the main opposition Syriza headed by Stefanos Kasselakis  Greece s first out gay party leader   the Mediterranean nation will become the 21st in Europe  the 16th in the EU and the 37th country worldwide to legalise same sex marriage But the inflammatory rhetoric in the run up to the vote ha left little doubt that more is needed if Greeks   still prone to dismissing the idea that there were gay people in antiquity   are to embrace 21st century notion of the modern family accepted elsewhere in Europe  Homophobic attack have soared in recent week and gay support hotlines have been overwhelmed with call Stefanos Kasselakis  the political outsider hoping to revive the Greek leftRead moreAccusations of discrimination are not new to Greece  one of the last EU member to introduce civil union for same sex couple in 2015  Before Mitsotakis appointed the first out gay minister  and agay man  Alexis Patelis  a his chief economic adviser in 2019  gay people   at least those who were out   did not hold high office In the absence of visibility  the community remained on the margin of society  with the medium and church often blatantly homophobic  The first gay pride march in Athens were deemed so controversial that participant were pelted with egg   in sharp contrast to today s celebration attended by foreign ambassador and politician Few people know this better than the gallerist Rebecca Camhi  Long regarded a the queen of the Greek capital s contemporary art scene  the 58 year old ha never hidden her sexuality  In a docuseries about prominent Greek woman aired on state TV a few year ago  she raised more than a few eyebrow by talking about family life with her partner  Marina Comninos  and her daughter  Anatolia  now a student at Edinburgh University But on a hot summer s day last year Camhi went further  ensuring the issue got a hearing in polite society when the couple threw a party to celebrate the civil union they had entered into day earlier View image in fullscreenRebecca Camhi  left  and Marina Comninos during a party to mark their civil union  Photograph  supplied A lot of those present  open minded and civilised a they may be  would not naturally find themselves attending a gay event   Camhi said of scene that would go down a unprecedented in the Piraeus yacht club   And at some point in my speech I made a point of making it a point  shouting out to gay friend who were there in sheer joy because people really have no idea what we all went through back in the day  She said the bill before the parliament wa not only groundbreaking but critical for younger Greeks who might be struggling with their sexual orientation   It will have a huge ripple effect and give the message especially to young people who may be afraid to come out  to tell their parent for fear of being rejected  that there are others like you out there  you re not a pariah and you re not alone  I don t think member of the Greek parliament are quite aware how important it is  Until now  same sex couple have had to go abroad if they want to marry  While civil union have provided legal protection  practical difficulty have remained so fundamental that many living abroad simply ruled out ever returning View image in fullscreenKostas Androulakis  husband Michael and their son  Photograph  supplied The minute we land in Greece  our two boy lose one of their parent   said Kostas Androulakis  46  who is raising his adopted son in London with his husband  Michael   Right now  because they aren t recognised a our kid  they can t inherit from u  aren t entitled to free  state  healthcare in Greece or education or becoming Greek citizen  Androulakis is among those who have flown to Athens to witness the vote that could change his life and the life of so many others   It s going to be a historic day   said the management consultant  who left Greece back in the 1990s when it wa  all doom and gloom for gay people  and such legislation seemed nigh on impossible Kalfaki could not agree more   Yes there are shortcoming but you can t go from zero to 100 in one bill   she said   It s a start  a brilliant  brilliant start  and it s going to be a very good day   This article wa amended on 15 February  An earlier version said that  if the vote passed  Greece would be the first country in southern Europe to have legalised same sex marriage  this title: Greece vote legalising sex marriage first Orthodox Christian country
summary: As lawmaker debated the Bill for a second day  opinion poll suggest that most Greeks support the proposed reform by a narrow margin
source_text: Greece to vote on legalising same sex marriage in a first for an Orthodox Christian country As lawmaker debated the Bill for a second day  opinion poll suggest that most Greeks support the proposed reform by a narrow margin February 15  2024 09 44 pm   Updated 09 45 pm IST   ATHENS AP COMMents SHARE Copy link Email Facebook Twitter Telegram LinkedIn WhatsApp Reddit READ LATER Remove SEE ALL Supporters of the Bill which legalises same sex civil marriage gather in front of the Greek Parliament  ahead of the vote  in Athens  Greece  February 15  2024    Photo Credit  REUTERS Greece s Parliament is to vote on February 15 to legalise same sex civil marriage in a first for an Orthodox Christian country and despite opposition from the influential Greek Church As lawmaker debated the Bill for a second day  opinion poll suggest that most Greeks support the proposed reform by a narrow margin  The issue ha failed to trigger deep division in a country more worried about the high cost of living The landmark Bill drafted by Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis   centre right government is backed by four left wing party  including the main opposition Syriza That would secure it a comfortable majority in the 300 seat Parliament  Several majority and left wing lawmaker are expected to abstain or vote against the reform   but not enough to kill the Bill  Three small far right party and the Soviet inspired Communist Party have rejected the draft law Supporters and opponent of the Bill have announced plan to hold separate gathering outside Parliament later Thursday   People who have been invisible will finally be made visible around u  And with them  many child  will  finally find their rightful place   Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis told lawmaker ahead of the vote   Both parent of same sex couple do not yet have the same legal opportunity to provide their child with what they need   he added   To be able to pick them up from school  to be able to travel  to go to the doctor  or take them to the hospital      That is what we are fixing   The Bill would confer full parental right on married same sex partner with child  But it precludes gay couple from parenthood through surrogate mother in Greece   an option currently available to woman who can t have child for health reason Governing New Democracy lawmaker Maria Syrengela said the reform would redress a long standing injustice for same sex couple and their child  And let s reflect on what these people have been through  spending so many year in the shadow  entangled in bureaucratic procedure   she said Polls show that while most Greeks agree to same sex wedding they also reject extending parenthood through surrogacy to male couple  Same sex civil partnership have been allowed in Greece since 2015  But that only conferred legal guardianship to the biological parent of child in those relationship  leaving their partner in a bureaucratic limbo The main opposition to the new bill ha come from the traditionalist Church of Greece   which also disapproves of heterosexual civil marriage Church official have centered their criticism on the bill s implication for traditional family value  and argue that potential legal challenge could lead to a future extension of surrogacy right to gay couple The head of the Orthodox Church of Greece  Archbishop Ieronymos  suggested Wednesday that the ballot should be held by roll call  This would enable constituent to see exactly how their lawmaker voted That s going to happen anyway  following motion later in the day by far right party and   independently and for different reason   Syriza  The main opposition leader  Stefanos Kasselakis  who is gay  ha threatened disciplinary action against any Syriza lawmaker who doesn t back the bill Church supporter and conservative organisation have staged small protest against the proposed law  and member of far right group have called for a demonstration outside Parliament later Thursday  Politically  the same sex marriage law is not expected to harm Mr  Mitsotakis  government  which won easy re election last year after capturing much of the centrist

title: Greece Set Legalize Marriage  Adoption Sex Couples
summary: Greece s parliament wa set to legalise same sex marriage and adoption on Thursday  a landmark reform promoted by the conservative government over the opposition of the country s powerful Orthodox Church
source_text: CricketMOVIESFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHSWASTHTECHInfluencersGamesBig BonusSHOPPINGLive TV News Video Opinion Diaspora India Global  USPolls Asia Australia Europe UK US Greece Set To Legalize Marriage  Adoption By Same Sex CouplesSearchNewsWorld NewsGreece Set To Legalize Marriage  Adoption By Same Sex Couples Greece Set To Legalize Marriage  Adoption By Same Sex Couples Dozens of ruling New Democracy party legislator are expected to oppose the bill in a vote late Thursday  But support from opposition party mean it is certain to pas  World NewsAgence France PresseUpdated  February 15  2024 3 36 pm ISTChildren do not automatically inherit from their non biological parent Athens  Greece s parliament wa set to legalise same sex marriage and adoption on Thursday  a landmark reform promoted by the conservative government over the opposition of the country s powerful Orthodox Church Dozens of ruling New Democracy party legislator are expected to oppose the bill in a vote late Thursday  But support from opposition party mean it is certain to pas The vote ha been hailed a historic by LGBTQ association  who said same sex family face a labyrinth of administrative challenge amounting to discrimination under present family law When their child fall ill in Greece  non biological parent currently have no right to decide what medical procedure are necessary for them Children do not automatically inherit from their non biological parent If a child ha two father  they can only be registered with the civil registry and covered by social service by entering the name of the biological mother And if the biological parent dy  the state can take away child from the other parent   Church  totally opposed   Greece will become the first Orthodox Christian country  the 17th EU state and the 37th country in the world to legalise adoption by same sex family The bill is expected to split Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis s conservative New Democracy party  with dozen of the party s 158 lawmaker likely to oppose it or abstain However  the bill is sure to pas with the support of the main opposition leftist Syriza party  whose leader Stefanos Kasselakis is gay  the socialist Pasok party and other smaller party A simple majority in the 300 member parliament vote is needed for the bill to pas The Church of Greece    which ha close tie to many government MPs    ha said it is  totally opposed  to the reform  arguing that it  condemns  child to grow up in an  environment of confusion  The head of the church Archbishop Ieronymos slammed the proposed law a part of a bid to impose a  new reality that seek only to corrupt the homeland s social cohesion  Some 4 000 people demonstrated in Athens against the measure on Sunday Kasselakis  who married his partner in a US ceremony in October  ha been subjected to homophobic insult  most recently from a central Greece mayor and an island group governor Mitsotakis  who is personally championing the bill  wa careful to stress last month that the change would benefit just  a few child and couple  The conservative leader  who comfortably won re election in June  had promised to enact the reform during his second four year term He announced it in January  just day after Kasselakis said Syriza would submit their own proposal for equality in marriage    Day of joy   Greek LGBTQ family  who had maintained a low profile since the reform wa unveiled last month  have called for a celebratory gathering in Athens on Thursday  This is a day of joy   Rainbow Families Greece  an NGO helping LGBTQ family  said on Facebook  We will play with our child  and  clean off  all the mud we have sustained all these year regarding who we are   the group said Same sex couple will still not be able to use assisted reproduction or a surrogate mother  procedure reserved for single woman or heterosexual couple who have trouble conceiving Greece had been condemned for anti gay discrimination by the European Court of Human Rights in 2013  after gay couple were excluded from a 2008 civil uni Opinion poll indicate that a majority of Greeks support same sex marriage but oppose surrogacy Under the Greek constitution  single parent  regardless of gender  have been allowed to adopt since 1946    but until now the second partner in a same sex union wa left out of the process Under the previous Syriza government  Greece in 2015 legalised civil union for same sex couple  becoming one of the last country in the European Union to grant such approval That law had resolved property and inheritance issue DEREK GATOPOULOS Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print ATHENS  Greece  AP    Lawmakers in Greece opened a two day debate Wednesday on a landmark bill to legalize same sex marriage  It would be the first Orthodox Christian country to do so The Valentine s Day session in parliament follows vocal opposition and protest from the church but also a shift in public opinion which is narrowly supportive of the change Lawmaker Maria Syrengela with the governing New Democracy party called the bill  a small contribution towards the creation of a society without discrimination  during the debate Wednesday  If approved a expected  the bill would grant same sex couple full parental right but not allow male partner to seek child born in Greece through surrogacy  READ MORE Same sex marriage recognition follows decade of struggle for this right campaigner in Greece Hundreds of protester opposed to bill allowing same sex marriage rally in Greek capital Students block Athens street to protest private university possibly coming to Greece The vote on the same sex marriage bill is due Thursday  Here s a look at the bill and why it s happening now  THE SLOW ROAD TO CHANGEThe journey toward legalizing same sex civil marriage in Greece ha been long and contentious  with government in the past shying away from a confrontation with the Orthodox Church Civil partnership for gay couple were made legal in 2015  with conservative opposing the initiative  Promises to extend those right were repeatedly deferred a the country emerged from a severe financial crisis followed by the pandemic  Many same sex couple chose to tie the knot in one of more than a dozen other European Union country which already have marriage equality law  bypassing restriction at home Early in his second term  center right Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis is pushing through a series of difficult reform that also include tackling fan violence in sport and ending an official state monopoly on higher education WHY IS THE CHURCH STRONGLY OPPOSED The Greek church s opposition to the marriage bill ha been emphatic The governing Holy Synod of senior bishop sent letter to all lawmaker outlining it objection  A circular with similar wording wa read out during Sunday service at all Orthodox church in the country  and religious group have staged public protest against the proposal  The church regard same sex marriage a a threat to the traditional family model  arguing that support for that model could help address the declining birth rate in many European country Support for that view ha been expressed by other Orthodox country  significantly including the Ecumenical Patriarchate which is based in Istanbul  Turkey Orthodox majority country are all located in eastern and southern Europe  where public acceptance of gay right ha been broadly more apprehensive than in western Europe ADDITIONAL CHANGES SOUGHT Campaigners for LGBTQ  right are calling the bill a milestone reform  a same sex couple would for the first time be recognized a a family unit  Partners who are not the biological parent of the couple s child would have to seek guardianship through adoption  which is more time consuming than the process in many other European country Transgender activist say they are likely to remain in legal limbo and are seeking additional change to family law A RARE POLITICAL AGREEMENTThe political landscape surrounding same sex marriage is complicated  but it offer a rare moment of consensus at a time when politician across the EU are keen to mark out their difference ahead of bloc wide election in June Mitsotakis face dissent from inside his own New Democracy party and need opposition vote for the bill to pas Many from the opposition are keen to back it  Stefanos Kasselakis  the opposition leader  last year became the first openly gay leader of a major Greek political party  Left wing and centrist vote should provide a comfortable majority Political party on the far right are aligned with religious protest  They are unlikely to topple the bill but are seeking to draw support away from Mitsotakis  traditional LONDON   ENGLAND   SEPTEMBER 23  2016  A London Metropolitan Police officer talk to two woman on the street Photo  Shutterstock Four people have been arrested and one charged with attempted murder after an 18 year old transgender woman wa stabbed repeatedly in London over the weekend  The London Evening Standard report that the victim  who ha not been identified  wa attending a roller skating the hospital for treatment and ha since been discharged  Related  Remorseless teen who stabbed trans girl to death are going away for life They used transphobic language to talk about their victim but you LGBTQ  news from around the world  On Tuesday  one of the suspect appeared in court  Summer Betts Ramsey  19  wa charged with attempted murder and possession of an offensive weapon in public  according to The Standard  She will remain in custody until her plea hearing on March 12  While Betts Ramsey did not enter a plea this week  the court wa told she denies any involvement in the attack   We continue to appeal for anyone who may have been in the area or who belief they have further information to come forward and speak to u   said lead investigator Detective Inspector Nicola Hannant   We have increased police patrol in the area and would encourage people to approach these officer with any information or concern   The February 10 attack come almost exactly one year to the day after community    Just one year on from the murder of Brianna Ghey  we are still witnessing anti trans joke in Parliament  shocking comment across social medium platform  and newspaper headline that seek Navalny dy Election 2024 U S  News Nebraska GOP bill target college professor tenure and diversity  equity and inclusion By MARGERY A  BECK Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print Scores of people turned out Tuesday to testify well into the night on bill being considered by Nebraska lawmaker that target diversity initiative and higher education program  mirroring proposal by Republicans across the country The bill before the state Legislature s Education Committee included one that would ban diversity  equity and inclusion   known a DEI   program and office at state college and university  Another would eliminate tenure for college professor  Similar bill have been introduced in Republican led legislature across the country a the 2024 election year heat up Sen  Dave Murman  a south central Nebraska farmer who is chair of the Education Committee  introduced the anti DEI bill that ha garnered 13 cosigner who are among the most conservative in the body  Already this year  Republican lawmaker have proposed about 50 bill in 20 state that would restrict DEI initiative or require their public disclosure  Murman characterized DEI program a  a threat to academic freedom  by elevating diversity over meritocracy  READ MORE Diversity  equity and inclusion initiative limited at Kentucky college under Senate bill Republicans work to recruit female and minority candidate even a they criticize diversity program Republican lawmaker are backing dozen of bill targeting diversity effort on campus and elsewhere  Taxpayer funded university shouldn t be used for activism and social change   he said  The 12 people who testified in support of the bill echoed that sentiment  using phrase like  Marxist philosophy   a  you owe me mentality  and  promoting victimhood  Jess Lammers  of Holdrege  wa more blunt  saying DEI is  being inflicted on u by liberal   It excludes white people   he said  Opponents of the bill vastly outnumbered supporter  and dozen took to the mic to encourage lawmaker to reject it  Among them were several young people of color who grew up in the state or Nebraska college student who told lawmaker of the discrimination they ve faced That included Mia Perales  a University of Nebraska Lincoln engineering student who graduated at the top of her high school class  As a Latino woman in engineering  I have been overlooked by my peer countless time   she said Ricki Barber  the secretary of the Lincoln chapter of the NAACP  addressed lawmaker supporting the bill   several of whom are UNL graduate and Nebraska college football fan  The transfer portal is a real thing   Barber said   And our Black athlete are watching what happens here   Sen  Loren Lippincott defended his bill seeking to eliminate the tenure system a an idea that s gaining traction in other state legislature  He noted that similar measure have been or are actively being sought in at least half a dozen other state  including Iowa  Florida  North Dakota and Texas  Academic tenure is given to high performing professor   usually those who are long serving and have a catalog of published academic material  Tenure provides a raft of benefit  including higher pay and heightened job security  Advocates say tenure is crucial to protecting academic freedom Critics have long held that tenure protects poorly performing professor  Many conservative have come to see tenure a a system that protects professor who espouse left leaning ideal  A lot of these horse were pulling their weight in their youth   Lippincott said   But then those horse end up staying in the barn and just eating hay  Lippincott s bill would create a system that would set up annual performance evaluation of all faculty  along with a set of minimum standard of faculty performance and disciplinary action  It would also set up employment agreement that would lay out ground to fire faculty  including for just cause or for financial reason and program discontinuance by the school  A handful of supporter testified in favor of the bill  Most cited a belief that it would help protect the free expression of conservative view of student who are too often silenced by professor who hold power over them Opponents warned that eliminating tenure would make the already competitive nature of attracting top candidate for faculty job at Nebraska college and university even more difficult  Eliminating tenure would tie both behind our back right at a time we re trying to recruit and retain faculty   said Chris Kabourek  interim president of the University of Nebraska   No other Big Ten university is without tenure  We can t afford not to offer it  It s too early to know whether either measure ha the vote to advance Associated Press Published February 13  2024 5 18 PM Share on FacebookShare on Twitter Share on Linkedin By BRUCE SCHREINER Associated Press FRANKFORT  Ky   AP    A Republican backed measure to limit diversity  equity and inclusion practice at Kentucky s public university won approval from the state Senate on Tuesday after an emotional debate that delved into race relation and what the bill s sponsor portrayed a the liberal bent on college campus  The bill cleared the Senate on a 26 7 vote after a nearly two hour debate  sending the proposal to the House  The GOP ha supermajorities in both chamber  One Democratic lawmaker  predicting a legal challenge  said the final arbiter could be the court  Debates revolving around initiative on diversity  equity and inclusion   known a DEI   are playing out in statehouse across the country  So far this year  GOP lawmaker have proposed about 50 bill in 20 state that would restrict DEI initiative or require their public disclosure  according to an Associated Press analysis using the bill tracking software Plural  Meanwhile  Democrats have filed about two dozen bill in 11 state that would require or promote DEI initiative  In Kentucky  opponent warned the proposed restriction on campus could roll back gain in minority enrollment and stifle campus discussion on topic dealing with past discrimination  The legislation  among other thing  would bar public college and university from providing preferential treatment based on a person s political ideology  It would prohibit the school from requiring people to state specific ideology or belief when seeking admission  employment or promotion  Republican Sen  Mike Wilson said he filed the bill to counter a broader trend in higher education toward denying campus job or promotion to faculty refusing to espouse  liberal ideology fashionable in our public university   He said such practice have extended to student and staff a well   Diversity of thought should be welcomed in our university and higher education   Wilson said   But we ve seen a trend across the United States of forcing faculty  in order to remain employed  to formally endorse a set of belief that may be contrary to their own  all in violation of the First Amendment   Democratic Sen  Reginald Thomas said the proposed restriction would jeopardize success in expanding the number of minority student on Kentucky s university campus   The richness of our diversity and our difference  that s what make u strong   said Thomas  who is Black   We are like a quilt here in America   Wilson responded that there s nothing in the bill to prohibit college from supporting diversity initiative  a long a those effort don t include  discriminatory concept   The legislation set out a host of such concept that would be prohibited  among them that a person  based on their race or gender  bear responsibility for past action committed by other member of the same race or gender  Another is meant to keep people from feeling guilt or discomfort solely because of their race or gender  The state attorney general s office would be allowed to take legal action to compel a school s compliance  Other senator opposing the bill warned that it restriction could have a chilling effect on what s taught on college campus  They pointed to the woman s suffrage movement and the landmark Supreme Court ruling that outlawed segregation of public school a possible example of topic that could be excluded  In supporting the bill  GOP Sen  Phillip Wheeler said it s important for student to delve into the past and learn about the struggle of people  The bill attempt to  get to a balance  to where we re no longer looked at a the oppressor and the oppressees  that we are each judged on our own merit   he said   I think that some of the vitriol that occurs on the campus  some of the topic  have really done more to divide u than unite u   he added  The Supreme Court s June decision ending affirmative action at university ha created a new legal landscape around diversity program in the workplace and civil society  On Tuesday  one of the most emotional moment of the Kentucky Senate debate came when Republican Sen  Donald Douglas talked about his own life experience  recalling that some classmate believed he got into medical school because he wa a Black athlete  despite his academic achievement   You know how embarrassed I wa   Douglas said in supporting the bill   How embarrassed I wa to tell them I had an academic scholarship to medical school and I had to explain  a a Black man  how I got a scholarship to medical school   The change proposed in the bill will be painful for some people  Douglas acknowledged  But he predicted that most affected student will  succeed with vigor and they will succeed with a sense that they are responsible for their success and not just the system       The legislation is Senate Bill 6  Article Topic Follows  AP National News Jump to comment here   Sen  Loren Lippincott defended his bill seeking to eliminate the tenure system a an idea that s gaining traction in other state legislature  He noted that similar measure have been or are actively being sought in at least half a dozen other state  including Iowa  Florida  North Dakota and Texas  Academic tenure is given to high performing professor   usually those who are long serving and have a catalog of published academic material  Tenure provides a raft of benefit  including higher pay and heightened job security  Advocates say tenure is crucial to protecting academic freedom  Critics have long held that tenure protects poorly performing professor  Many conservative have come to see tenure a a system that protects professor who espouse left leaning ideal   A lot of these horse were pulling their weight in their youth   Lippincott said   But then those horse end up staying in the barn and just eating hay   Lippincott s bill would create a system that would set up annual performance evaluation of all faculty  along with a set of minimum standard of faculty performance and disciplinary action  It would also set up employment agreement that would lay out ground to fire faculty  including for just cause or for financial reason and program discontinuance by the school  A handful of supporter testified in favor of the bill  Most cited a belief that it would help protect the free expression of conservative view of student who are too often silenced by professor who hold power over them  Opponents warned that eliminating tenure would make the already competitive nature of attracting top candidate for faculty job at Nebraska college and university even more difficult   Eliminating tenure would tie both behind our back right at a time we re trying to recruit and retain faculty   said Chris Kabourek  interim president of the University of Nebraska   No other Big Ten university is without tenure  We can t afford not to offer it   It s too early to know whether either measure ha the vote to advance to the full Legislature  Article Topic Follows  AP National Jump to comment   Associated Press Related Articles Philadelphia traffic stop end in season  and film from top 10 distributor  28 5  of which include an LGBTQ character   Catering to an LGBTQ audience would be good for company  GLAAD argued  citing that queer gamers are 1 4 time more likely to buy or play a game with a character that match their gender  29  of all gamers wish there were more prominent LGBTQ storyline in game and 70  of LGBTQ gamers  a well a 46  of non LGBTQ gamers  are le likely to buy a game if it contains harmful trope or stereotype about the gay or transgender community  Art created for Riot Games  celebration of Pride Month Luz Danaee Riot Games Crucial Quote  Game company have avoided making more game with central LGBTQ character because they have assumed that the majority of the gaming audience would not be interested in or openly reject such game   the GLAAD study read   However  our research found that having game with central main LGBTQ character would make no difference to the majority of non LGBTQ gamers   Tangent Video game have also historically struggled with gender and racial representation  Of the 100 top selling and major game released between 2017 and 2021  80  had male main character and 61  of character in game are white  according to a Diamond Lobby study  When video game do feature woman in prominent role  they re often over sexualized or cast a the damsel in distress  trope that have been criticized in Blockbuster game like  Tomb Raider    Mortal Kombat  and  Grant Theft Auto   Key Background The Entertainment Software Association in July found that 65  of Americans play video game about 212 6 million weekly player  Of those people  slightly more than half  53   identify a men and 72  are white  The average gamer is 32 year old with 21 year of gaming experience under their belt  In a study the year before  the association found that nearly all Americans  97   say they re able to see the benefit of video game when it come to stress relief  cognitive skill improvement  social connection and increasing problem solving skill  Overall  the perception of video game and their impact on player  life have improved in the last 40 or so year  Historically  those who worry about the negative impact have expressed concern with desensitization to violence  inappropriate sexual theme  portrayal of religion and the reinforcement of sexist stereotype  Further ReadingGLAAD   GLAAD rewrite the Warren Houston Chronicle via AP  By MELISSA GOLDIN Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print CLAIM  The shooter who carried out an attack injuring two people at a Texas megachurch on Sunday ha been identified a transgender AP S ASSESSMENT  False  Houston police said on Monday that it investigation ha thus far determined that the shooter  Genesse Ivonne Moreno  identified a female despite using multiple alias  including the name Jeffery   or Jeffrey   Escalante  Multiple court record identify Moreno a female  most recently in 2022 THE FACTS  Amid the aftermath of Sunday s shooting at Lakewood Church  which is led by televangelist pastor Joel Osteen  social medium user spread false claim about Moreno s gender identity   BREAKING  Lakewood Church shooter identified a transgender  legal name Genesse Moreno but went by the name  Jeffrey    read one post on X  formerly Twitter  that had received approximately 9 100 like and 6 100 share a of Tuesday  READ MORE NOT REAL NEWS  A look at what didn t happen this week Posts share erroneous information about suspect identification in Kansas City mass shooting Tucker Carlson wa not put on a  kill list  in Ukraine for Putin interview Others claimed that Moreno  who wa fatally shot in an exchange of gunfire  had been born a Jeffery  but went by Genesse a part of her transition  Officials have not found any evidence that Moreno wa transgender  Police said she used male and female alias  but that investigator who looked at past police report determined she identified a female  We do have report she used multiple alias  including Jeffery Escalante   Houston Police Commander Chris Hassig said about 19 minute into a press conference on Monday   So she ha utilized both male and female name  but through all of our investigation to this point  talking with individual  interview  document  Houston Police Department report  she ha been identified this entire time a female  she  her  And so we are identifying her a Genesse Moreno  Hispanic female Records in Harris County  where Houston is located  show that Moreno  under the name Jeffery G  Escalante Moreno or Jeffery G  Escalante  wa charged in six criminal case from 2005 to 2011  She is identified a female in all of them  A case filed in nearby Katy County after Moreno s latest arrest in April 2022 also list her a female  but with the name Genesse Ivonne Moreno  William Capasso  an attorney in Houston who represented Moreno for a portion of her divorce proceeding in 2021 to 2022  told The Associated Press that she went by Jeffrey Moreno Carranza at the time  He said Carranza wa her married name and noted that at that time  there wa no indication that she wa transgender   It is my understanding that although her birth name wa Jeffrey Moreno  she wa born female and identified a a female   he wrote in an email   She did use Genesse and may have changed her name to Genesse Moreno after I represented her  Capasso added that Moreno used the name  Jeffrey Genesse Escalante Moreno  on her son s birth certificate  He said he withdrew a Moreno s attorney in the proceeding because he wa not able to communicate with her effectively Many social medium post used claim about Moreno s gender identity to advance a baseless narrative that there ha been a rise in transgender or nonbinary mass shooter in recent year  This narrative previously spread widely in March 2023  after an assailant who identified a transgender killed six people at a Nashville private school Gender and criminology expert told The Associated Press at the time that mass casualty shooting perpetrated by someone identifying a transgender or nonbinary are rare and that those group are far more likely to be the victim of violence Authorities said on Monday that Moreno used a legally purchased AR 15 style rifle to carry out the attack at Lakewood Church  one of the biggest megachurches in the U S  She wa shot and killed by two off duty officer working security at the building  Two other people were shot and wounded  including Moreno s young son  who she brought with her to the church    This is part of the AP and criminology expert told The Associated Press at the time that mass casualty shooting perpetrated by someone identifying a transgender or nonbinary are rare and that those group are far more likely to be the victim of violence  Authorities said on Monday that Moreno used a legally purchased AR 15 style rifle to carry out the attack at Lakewood Church  one of the biggest megachurches in the U S  She wa shot and killed by two off duty officer working security at the building  Two other people were shot and wounded  including Moreno s young son  who she brought with her to the church  Spectrum summary: A new Trevor Project report detail the challenge faced by Black LGBTQ  young people and how they differ within this population

cisgender queer peer  exclusive  Shutterstock A new Trevor Project report detail the challenge faced by Black LGBTQ  young people and how they differ within this population Trudy RingFebruary 13 2024 12 44 PM ESTFebruary 13 2024 12 44 PM ESTtrudestressBlack LGBTQ  young people are experiencing high rate of discrimination and victimization   and with that come a high suicide risk  especially among transgender  nonbinary  and questioning Black youth  say a new report from the Trevor Project Twenty one percent of Black trans  nonbinary  and questioning young people reported a suicide attempt in the past year  note the Trevor Project s research brief  titled  Discrimination Among Black LGBTQ  Young People and Suicide Risk   released Tuesday and based on data collected through the Trevor Project s 2023 U S  National Survey on the Mental Health of LGBTQ Young People  That compare to just 8 percent of Black cisgender LGBQ youth The difference is  not surprising  but  telling   say Derrick Matthews  director of research science at the Trevor Project and lead author of the brief  No single factor or experience definitively cause someone to have higher odds of considering or attempting suicide   he tell The Advocate via email   However  these data show that experience of gender discrimination were associated with higher odds of suicide risk for Black transgender  nonbinary  and questioning young people  Intersecting identity are imperative to analyze when we talk about experience of discrimination because  simply put  the more marginalized identity a person hold  the more opportunity they have to be discriminated against   This signal a greater need for ally  advocate  family  and friend to better support and affirm the gender expansive Black LGBTQ  young people in their life   in a way that may vary from how we might show up for cisgender Black LGBQ youth   Matthews note Demonstrating the pervasiveness of discrimination  70 percent of Black ci LGBQ youth reported experiencing discrimination based on their race  sexual orientation  or gender identity or expression in the past year  while the proportion wa even greater   83 percent   among Black trans  nonbinary  or questioning youth  The majority reported experiencing two or more form of discrimination  Discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity or expression were both associated with a heightened risk of suicide  But many who d experienced this discrimination also reported receiving support from someone in their life  such a a friend  a romantic partner  a therapist  or a sibling Shutterstock Although these result can be dispiriting  we encourage all LGBTQ  youth facing people to use these finding to bolster effort to both end discrimination and address it effect head on   the report say   Black LGBTQ  young people themselves have not only acknowledged the role of intersectional discrimination in their own life  but have shaped their activism to be intersectional to combat it a well  Adults working with Black LBGTQ  young people should ensure that they are prepared to support all aspect of Black LGBTQ  young people s identity a they navigate the combined effect of racism  anti LGBTQ bigotry  and other form of bias   While there will always be a role for providing service to help Black LGBTQ  young people cope with the effect of living in a discriminatory social environment  we must also not lose sight that the goal must always be to reduce exposure to discrimination in the first place   the brief continues   We should celebrate the resilience of Black LGBTQ  young people for thriving  but that cannot absolve u of a collective responsibility to move closer to a world where that resilience is not a necessary part of survival  Matthews noted that Black LGBTQ  young people aren t inherently proned to a higher risk of suicide   Rather  they are placed at higher risk because of how they are mistreated and stigmatized by others   he explained   These finding are difficult  But they should serve a a call to action for ally  advocate  youth serving professional  and adult everywhere  It s time to step up our effort to let Black trans and nonbinary young people know that we are here for them by working to reduce their experience of discrimination   and reminding them that this world really is a better place because they are in it  If you are having thought of suicide or are concerned that someone you know may be  resource are available to help  The 988 Suicide   Crisis Lifeline at 988 is for people of all age and identity  Trans Lifeline  designed for transgender or gender nonconforming people  can be reached at  877  565 8860  The lifeline also provides resource to help with other crisis  such a domestic violence situation  The Trevor Project Lifeline  for LGBTQ  youth  age 24 and younger   can be reached at  866  488 7386  Users can also access chat service at TheTrevorProject org Help or text START title: Greece brink legalising sex marriage
summary: A bill would allow gay couple to marry and adopt  but it face opposition from the Orthodox Church
source_text: brink of legalising same sex marriagePublished3 day agoShareclose panelShare pageCopy linkAbout sharingImage caption  Christina and Victoria say legalising same sex marriage would be a big step for GreeceBy Mark LowenSouthern Europe Correspondent  AthensIn her garden in northern Athens  four year old Niovi play make believe  selling cake from her imaginary shop  For her two mum  Christina Leimoni and Victoria Kalfaki  their dream may soon become real  a Greece stand on the brink of legalising same sex marriage Parliament will vote on the bill  introduced by Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis  on Thursday  Facing dissent from member of his own centre right party  he will need to rely on support from the left wing opposition to get it through Christina and Victoria will be there inside the chamber  willing it to pas  Two year ago  they returned to Greece from the UK  where they had moved for work   and to live their relationship freely They married in the UK and Niovi wa born there  If the law pass  they plan to have their marriage recognised under Greek law  I have no say After Niovi s birth in London  they tried to register her at the Greek embassy  but were rebuffed   The commentary wa   You should have thought before having her    Christina recall  It wa awful  I cried in the car for 45 minute  I couldn t stop   it still brings bad memory   Victoria say  welling up with tear   It s like being rejected by your country  Image caption  Niovi wa born in the UK and is now four year oldWithout legal recognition for their marriage in Greece  only Victoria  who gave birth to Niovi  is accepted a her mother  even though the egg wa from Christina At school  she ha no say over decision and when Niovi ha been admitted to hospital  Christina ha been barred from entering her room  My biggest fear is that if anything really bad happens to Victoria and she dy  our child instantly go to social service  who then see if any of Victoria s relative want to adopt her   she say  If they don t  she go into an institution  I have no say  So the child wouldn t just lose one mother  she d lose both of u  Opposition by the ChurchFifteen of the European Union s 27 member have already legalised same sex marriage  It is permitted in 35 country worldwide  Greece ha lagged behind European neighbour largely because of opposition from it powerful church  If the law pass this week  it would become the first Christian Orthodox majority country  and the first in Europe s southeast  to have marriage equality Same sex couple would also be legally allowed to adopt child but not to have a baby through a surrogate   a recourse that is only legal here for heterosexual couple who have a medical need for assisted reproduction  Greece geographically is in the southeast  but culturally and politically it belongs to the West   say Alex Patelis  the prime minister s chief economic advisor and a member of the committee that drafted the marriage bill Image caption  Equal right fit the centre right government s ideology  say PM s advisor Alex PatelisMr Mitsotakis  recently storming to re election  face a weak opposition that ha left him the space to tread onto their political turf without jeopardising his own position Mr Patelis say the bill is a cornerstone of the prime minister s belief   It s often thought that human right and equality are the purview of the party of the left  This is coming from a centre right party   and it s important to recognise that equality under law and individual right are also the ideology of the right  But Greek society is split  A recent poll for Proto Thema newspaper found 55  in favour of same sex marriage and an even slimmer majority backing adoption Up to 50 of Mr Mitsotakis s 158 MPs are expected either to vote against the bill or to be conveniently absent from the chamber  meaning they can duck the vote A letter by the Church of Greece opposing the move wa read out in morning mass across the country earlier this month  condemning what it said would  promote the abolition of fatherhood and motherhood  and put the sexual choice of homosexual adult above the interest of future child  Image caption  Greece s powerful Orthodox Church ha galvanised protest against same sex marriageOne of the most outspoken prelate ha been Bishop Seraphim of Piraeus  At the city s Agii Anargiri Church  we watch a he lead a packed service  with worshipper in their Sunday best kissing icon and bowing head He recently warned that he would block MPs who back the bill from his church  adding it would be preferable if they had not been born  And  he said  he would refuse to baptise child of same sex couple  to help them understand that what their guardian are doing is a sin  Outside parliament on Syntagma Square  opponent gather to protest against the bill  beneath banner reading  No child for pervert  and chanting  Take your hand off our kid  A video show image including religious icon and  oddly  Bill Gates  Conspiracy theory about a new global order being imposed on Greece have blended with pious Greeks who believe their tradition are being destroyed  The Bible say

valid email addressSIGN UPI would like to be emailed about offer  event and update from The Independent  Read our privacy notice Years before starting a family of her own  Stella Belia wa already waging a tireless campaign for legal recognition  Her fight may finally be over this week   a few month shy of her twin boy  17th birthday Greek lawmaker are expected to legalize same sex marriage in a parliament vote Thursday  with a rare display of cross party collaboration Approval would make Greece the first Orthodox Christian country to take that step  clearing multiple legal hurdle for gay couple who already have or want to have child  I ve been fighting for this ever since I figured out who I wa   say Belia  a 57 year old drama teacher with a gruff voice and an easy laugh  And it s a great relief to say we ve finally made it   she said   But it is tiresome  very tiresome to fight for something that s an obvious right   to suffer for something that other people are just handed   and have to fight so hard to get it   Belia split with her female partner when her son were aged 11 but she considers her to be the boy  other mother Although civil partnership were extended to gay couple in Greece nearly a decade ago  only the biological parent of child in those relationship are currently recognized a legal guardian The issue of child s right  including the publicized plight of cancer survivor in a same sex relationship  helped nudge public opinion toward narrowly favoring the bill that wa sponsored by Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis  conservative government But it also triggered a strong reaction from the country s Orthodox Church  Representing Greece s dominant faith  the Church argues the marriage bill would confuse parental role and weaken the traditional family The Church petitioned lawmaker to reconsider in a public appeal also read out at Sunday service Several prominent bishop have taken a tougher line  warning that they will refuse to baptize the child of gay couple  They allied with far right political party and traditionalist group to stage public demonstration Protester Chara Giannakantonaki said she felt compelled to attend a rally held in front of parliament last Sunday   Every minority already ha it right guaranteed  There is no issue  They don t need  same sex  marriage  They just want to desecrate whatever ha remained sacred in Greece  Our Church  our family and our child   she said   But child are a red line and we will never accept this  The Mitsotakis government is facing dissent among conservative over the bill and will need support from the centrist and left wing opposition to secure the 151 vote minimum in the 300 member parliament Dimitris Mavros  managing director of the market research firm MRB Hellas  said the timing of the bill appeared to be carefully calculated  Backing a measure that prop up Mitsotakis  centrist credential but with the controversy likely to blow over before the European Union wide election in June Greeks in 2024  Mavros said  have shown a sharp rise in financial anxiety  their worry reflected in recent strike and ongoing farmer  protest  I think the farmer   protest  and high price   and issue that hurt people s pocket   are going to overshadow the same sex couple issue   he said   We re probably going to get past this calmly  Chrysa Gkotsopoulou and Elena Kotsifi  both engineer  for year told their family and colleague they were roommate and only came out a a couple after moving to England for work in 2015 They now have a young daughter  Ariadne  and all three travel to Greece using their U K  passport   We quickly realized that England offered u prospect a a couple that we had never previously imagined   Kotsifi  38  said   We could be ourselves  They flew to Athens at the weekend to celebrate the bill s expected approval  and said that for the first time in nearly a decade  they now view returning home a a possibility They hope to join the activist Belia and others Thursday night in the public gallery in parliament and celebration set to follow  If there s room for u  in parliament   we d like to go   Gkotsopoulou said   We feel joy  joy and pride that Greece is moving to the right side of history  More aboutAPGreeceAthensKyriakos MitsotakisGreekGreeksChurchOrthodox ChurchEnglandEuropean Union1 1For right campaigner in Greece  same sex title: Transgender immigrant open fire inside Texas megachurch
summary: In a press conference held on Sunday afternoon  Houston Police Chief Troy Finner detailed that Moreno  dressed in a trench coat and carrying a backpack  entered the church shortly before 2 p m  and began firing
source_text: Transgender immigrant open fire inside Texas megachurch In a press conference held on Sunday afternoon  Houston Police Chief Troy Finner detailed that Moreno  dressed in a trench coat and carrying a backpack  entered the church shortly before 2 p m  and began firing  By Ian Miles Cheong   February 13  2024   News Home Latest Transgender immigrant open fire inside Texas megachurch KTRK TV ABC13 via AP E transfer  Canada   email protected    password RebelNews if required Cheques made out to Rebel News Rebel News Network Ltd PO Box 61056 Eglinton Dufferin ROToronto  ON M6E 5B2 Crypto Remove Ads On Sunday afternoon  a shooting unfolded at a renowned megachurch in Texas when Genesee Ivonne Moreno  a 36 year old woman armed with a long firearm and accompanied by her 7 year old son  initiated gunfire  The confrontation ended when law enforcement officer at the scene fatally shot Moreno  The shooting resulted in critical injury to her son and wounded another individual  a confirmed by authority  per CNN  Moreno  who wa transgender and used the name  Jeffrey   who wa originally a migrant from El Salvador and had an extensive criminal history    BREAKING  Lakewood Church shooter identified a a transgender  legal name Genesse Moreno but went by the name  Jeffrey     pic twitter com 0gmgybgOLC  Sara Gonzales   SaraGonzalesTX  February 12  2024 The investigation is currently focused on Lakewood Church  led by televangelist Joel Osteen and situated approximately 6 mile from downtown Houston  Fox News reported  The preliminary reporting also indicated that the message  Free Palestine  wa written on the rifle  investigator said later it wa just  Palestine   Moreno  36  had a criminal history including conviction for assaulting a police officer in 2009 and forgery in 2010  Members of the FBI  the Texas Rangers  the Montgomery County Sheriff s Office and the Conroe and Houston Police Departments were investigating a property Monday in Conroe  north of Houston  that wa believed to be Moreno s residence  KPRC reported  In a press conference held on Sunday afternoon  Houston Police Chief Troy Finner detailed that Moreno  dressed in a trench coat and carrying a backpack  entered the church shortly before 2 p m  and began firing  According to a search warrant issued by the Montgomery County District Attorney s Office on Monday  officer  shot and killed her in self defense  when she aimed her firearm at them  The police chief reported that her son sustained a gunshot wound to the head amidst the gunfire and  a of Monday  is still hospitalized in critical condition  A man who wa injured and shot in the leg  received medical attention at a hospital and ha since been discharged  according to Finner s statement on Monday  He ha been identified in the search warrant a Tom George Thomas   We don t understand why all these thing happened  but we know God s in control   Osteen said following the shooting  Spread the Word  United States

title: Transgender people killed alarming rate  especially South
summary: New finding reveal a disturbing increase in violence against transgender individual  spotlighting the South s lax gun law and discriminatory policy

VoicesPoliticsTransgenderVideoShopScroll To TopBy continuing to use our site  you agree to our Private Policy and Terms of Use  Accept Crime Transgender people are being killed at an alarming rate  especially in the South  exclusive  Shutterstock New finding reveal a disturbing increase in violence against transgender individual  spotlighting the South s lax gun law and discriminatory policy Christopher WigginsFebruary 13 2024 8 00 AM ESTFebruary 13 2024 8 49 AM ESTCwnewserIn a revealing new report by Everytown for Gun Safety  a disturbing trend ha been highlighted  showcasing a rise in homicide of transgender people across the United States  with a troubling concentration in the Southern state  This comprehensive analysis  running from 2017 through 2023  shed light on the urgent need for awareness and action against the violence that disproportionately affect the transgender community Keep up with the latest in LGBTQ  news and politics  Sign up for The Advocate s email newsletter In an in depth interview with The Advocate  Sarah Burd Sharps  senior director of research at Everytown for Gun Safety  shared insight into the finding and the pressing implication of this data  She emphasized the dire connection between firearm and the murder of transgender people amid a challenging landscape where a lot of data wasn t readily available  We started tracking the homicide of transgender and gender expansive people in 2017 because there wa very little understanding of the link between gun violence and violence against the transgender community   Burd Sharps said The report document 263 homicide over the seven year  with an alarming increase in incident  particularly in 2023  With approximately three quarter of these homicide involving a gun  the report underscore the critical nature of addressing gun violence a a key factor in these tragic death  A stark revelation from the study is the disproportionate impact on Black transgender woman  who represent a substantial majority of the victim  further magnified by the prevalence of firearm use in these crime Related  Trans People Continue to Be Murdered at Extreme Rates a Republicans Push Transphobic LawsBurd Sharps pointed out the correlation between the surge in anti transgender sentiment  particularly in the South  and the rising instance of violence  Nearly half of these incident involving gun are in the south  in southern state   she said  explaining that trans people in the South face specific danger She attributed this trend to a combination of lax gun law and discriminatory legislation  Burd Sharps drew a direct line between policy decision and the safety of marginalized community  suggesting that legislative action   or inaction   ha real  tangible consequence for the life of transgender individual  It s a combination of weak legislation on hate crime and the kind of new  anti LGBTQ   legislation that state government are considering and passing that target transgender people for unequal treatment   Burd Sharps said  She called for stronger legislative action across the country  advocating for the enactment of hate crime misdemeanor prohibitors and extreme risk  or red flag  law a critical step toward mitigating this violence  Such measure would significantly impact the safety of transgender individual by restricting access to firearm for those with hate crime conviction and allowing for the temporary removal of gun from individual posing a threat to themselves or others  she said This toxic mix of discriminatory law and lax gun regulation creates a perilous environment for transgender individual  particularly in state like Texas  which lack prohibition against firearm possession for individual with hate crime conviction  If Texas would adopt a hate crime misdemeanor prohibitor  like half of U S  state  it would right away make a difference   Burd Sharps explained  Such legal measure would prevent individual convicted of hate crime from legally owning firearm  a step she view a crucial for reducing violence against transgender people Related  Gun violence  is always going to sit with me   Grief  trauma  and the rising threat of firearm in AmericaAddressing the broader societal implication  Burd Sharps urged a collective understanding and response to gun violence  emphasizing that it affect entire community  not just the transgender population   Hate crime and hateful action in our community  no matter who it s against  affect all of u   she said  calling for a united front to protect vulnerable group and foster a safer environment for everyone The conversation also explored the broader social implication of transgender homicide  with Burd Sharps emphasizing the role of stigma and discrimination in pushing transgender individual to the margin of society  This marginalization  she noted  often force transgender people into vulnerable situation that increase their risk of becoming victim of violence   One of the root cause is the challenge to finding employment  the challenge to being discriminated against  push you towards occupation that can expose you to more risk and higher rate of crime   she said These social determinant of health and safety  combined with legislative hostility  create a precarious existence for many transgender people Burd Sharps said transgender homicide should matter to everyone  not just those within the LGBTQ  community  She framed this violence a an issue that impact entire community   We live in community  we live in neighborhood  and I m not just saying that you could take a bullet because you happen to be in proximity of it  but you are part of a community where these crime are occurring   she said From Your title: Fox News GOP politician falsely claim Lakewood Church shooter wa transgender
summary: The suspected shooter wa a 36 year old who police identified a the mother of a 7 year old boy who wa shot in the incident
source_text: News Fox News and GOP politician falsely claim Lakewood Church shooter wa transgender  church  Shutterstock   mugshot  Texas Department of Public Safety The suspected shooter wa a 36 year old who police identified a the mother of a 7 year old boy who wa shot in the incident Christopher WigginsFebruary 12 2024 4 14 PM ESTFebruary 13 2024 5 06 PM ESTCwnewserSoon after news broke that a person had entered Joel Osteen s Lakewood Church in Houston  Texas  on Sunday and opened fire  right wing influencers  Republican politician  and right wing medium outlet  including Fox News  pushed a false narrative that the suspected shooter wa transgender  Related  No  transgender and nonbinary people are not frequently mass shootersDuring a Monday afternoon press conference  Houston official  including Police Chief Troy Finner and Democratic Mayor John Whitmire  provided update on the investigation The incident  which unfolded just before the church s Spanish language service on Sunday afternoon  involved a 36 year old woman opening fire inside the megachurch premise  She wa accompanied by a 7 year old boy  who wa critically wounded in the ensuing shootout with police  official said  A 57 year old man  not believed to be directly involved in the initial incident  also suffered gunshot wound but is in stable condition  The shooter wa subsequently shot and killed by two off duty officer working security at the church  authority confirmed The shooter wa armed with an AR 15 and a 22 caliber rifle  police official said  She had a long gun  and it could ve been a lot worse   Finner remarked  The chief also addressed the critical condition of the injured child  emphasizing the shooter s responsibility for endangering the child if the police gunfire had led to his injury  It s unclear who shot the child Whitmire focused on reassurance and the ongoing priority of public safety  stating   It is our highest priority to have total transparency   and emphasizing the city s dedication to addressing mental health issue and ensuring the safety of all place of worship Commander Christopher Hassig of HPD s homicide division clarified the shooter s identity  Our shooter is identified by a driver s license a Genesee Moreno  36 year old  Hispanic female   Hassig said   She ha utilized both male and female name  but through all of our investigation to this point she ha been identified this entire time a female  Finner later clarified   It s the biological mother   referring to the critically injured 7 year old boy who wa shot in the head The incident ha also been a magnet for misinformation  notably propagated by far right figure on social medium  U S  Rep  Marjorie Taylor Greene  a Republican from Georgia  contributed to the confusion with a post on X  formerly Twitter  making unfounded claim about the shooter s identity and motivation   Not only wa the shooter a trans from El Salvador  she also had a gun engraved with  Free Palestine   but investigator can t say if she wa politically motivated or not  When this country start being truthful  regardless of who s feeling get hurt  we will solve many problem   Greene wrote  casting aspersion without evidence        Hassig disclosed that the buttstock of the AR 15 the shooter used had a single sticker that read  Palestine         Chaya Raichik of Libs of TikTok further fueled the misinformation  erroneously writing   BREAKING  The Lakewood Church shooter wa transgender  He went by the name  Genesse  and previously  Jeffrey   Another act of trans terrorism  We need to have a national conversation about the LGBTQ movement turning youth into violent extremist   based solely on the suspect s criminal history listing a male name a an alias  There are some discrepancy   Hassig said  noting   We do have report she used multiple alias  including Jeffrey Escalante   but that based on police record and interview  the shooter wa identified a female throughout        Republican Missouri U S  Senator Josh Hawley also perpetuated the falsehood that the shooter wa trans  So the Lakewood church shooter wa a transgender  pro Palestine radical  We need a full hate crime investigation  including the influence on the shooter s motivation  plan   thinking   he wrote According to a Reuters fact check  the vast majority of mass shooter are cisgender white men So the Lakewood church shooter wa a transgender  pro Palestine radical  We need a full hate crime investigation  including the influence on the shooter u2019s motivation  plan   thinking  n nhttps   t co TwFlaQcRfe       Fox News also ran a false story with the headline   Lakewood church shooting suspect identified a transgender woman   Free Palestine  written on gun   before changing it  without adding an editor s note  to  Lakewood church shooter identified a Genesse Ivonne Moreno   Palstine  written on gun   The article s author did insert within the body of the piece a sentence that claimed that  Preliminary reporting indicated the shooter wa transgender   which is also false Oh no you don t Fox News  you don t get to make incendiary claim without evidence and then stealth edit your article without a full retraction and correction        In response to these misleading narrative  Alejandra Caraballo  a transgender attorney and Harvard Law School instructor  criticized the rush to spread falsehood She wrote   Far right extremist account like Libs of Tiktok rushed to call the shooter at Joel Osteen s church a transgender woman  The police have just confirmed that is not the case and she wa the biological mother of the child who wa shot  They won t apologize or retract their lie  GLAAD s president and CEO Sara Kate Ellis told The Advocate in a statement   It is unbelievably tragic and unfortunately all too predictable to see another community reeling from gun violence  and social medium extremist trying to dictate coverage with repulsive and irresponsible lie  Smearing transgender people is inaccurate and harmful  and it distracts from what should be the focus in every mass shooting  the pain in shattered community  how gun violence is the number one killer of child  and how easy access to weapon of war continues to endanger every community  She added   Social medium extremist who ob over transgender people and new way to target them are not assignment editor  They are extremist whose disinformation campaign lead to bomb threat against child s hospital  elementary school  library and church  Their lie are dangerous and have consequence  Every reporter and voter must ask their local leader what they are doing to end gun violence  Every American must reject rhetoric from politician and extremist medium that prioritizes unhinged obsession over public safety  From Your Site ArticlesRight wing influencers seem happy that Iowa school shooter might be LGBTQ   Far Right Rep  Paul Gosar Tweets Lie That Texas Shooter Was Trans title: Trans woman arrested bathroom use  N C  gubernatorial candidate say
summary: Lt  Gov  Mark Robinson  R  said that trans woman  will be arrested  for using woman s restroom and should instead  find a corner outside somewhere
source_text: Trans woman should be arrested over bathroom use  N C  gubernatorial candidate saysLt  Gov  Mark Robinson said that if trans woman are confused about which bathroom to use  they should  find a corner outside somewhere By Jonathan EdwardsFebruary 12  2024 at 5 30 p m  ESTNorth Carolina Lt  Gov  Mark Robinson  R  delivers remark at an event in Washington in June   Sarah Silbinger for The Washington Post Listen4 minShareCommentAdd to your saved storiesSaveNorth Carolina s lieutenant governor  a leading candidate in this year s gubernatorial election  said this month that transgender woman who use woman s restroom  will be arrested  and suggested they instead  find a corner outside somewhere  Cut through the 2024 election noise  Get The Campaign Moment newsletter  We re going to defend woman in this state   Lt  Gov  Mark Robinson  R  said at a campaign event   That mean if you re a man on Friday night  and all of a sudden Saturday you feel like a woman and you want to go in the woman s bathroom in the hall  you will be arrested   or whatever we got to do to you  At another campaign stop that same day  he told the crowd that  if you are confused  about which bathroom to use   find a corner outside somewhere  I m sorry  we re not tearing society down because of this  Robinson s campaign did not immediately respond Monday to request for comment from The Washington Post AdvertisementThe remark  which were received with cheer and laughter  drew comparison to the infamous  bathroom bill  North Carolina lawmaker passed in 2016  Polls suggest Robinson is the leading candidate for the Republican nomination for governor in a state where national controversy erupted over legislation requiring transgender people to use public bathroom matching the gender on their birth certificate Robinson wa catapulted into the spotlight in 2018  when he spoke about gun right during a town hall style meeting of the Greensboro City Council  His speech wa shared by a North Carolina state representative and went viral  He wa elected North Carolina s first Black lieutenant governor in 2020  and in April 2023 announced he wa running for governor Former president Donald Trump endorsed Robinson in June  and poll indicate he s ahead of his two GOP rival competing for the nomination   Incumbent Gov  Roy Cooper  D  is term limited and unable to seek reelection  five Democrats are seeking their party s nomination  AdvertisementRobinson s comment on the campaign trail this month are the most recent in a controversial record that stretch back year  He called the Holocaust  hogwash  in a past Facebook post that he later said wa  poorly worded   WRAL reported  In June 2021  Robinson called the LGBTQ community  filth   When video of the comment surfaced in October of that year  North Carolina Democrats pressed him to resign  one calling him a  disgrace  and  an embarrassment  to the state  Robinson rebuffed the pressure  saying that he wa referring to sexually explicit LGBTQ book he claimed were circulating in North Carolina public school Share this articleShareRobinson entered the political arena in the aftermath of the demise of House Bill 2  the so called bathroom bill  After a year of fierce blowback that included economic boycott  job loss and public criticism  lawmaker repealed the law in a deal that prohibited local government from passing measure to protect LGBTQ people Since then  gender identity and transgender right have only grown a a political flash point in the culture war  becoming favorite target of conservative at a national level  Between 2018 and 2022  the number of anti trans law across the country skyrocketed AdvertisementAlex Baltzegar  a spokesman for Bill Graham  one of the candidate competing against Robinson for the GOP nomination  told The Post that Robinson s  demeaning comment  about woman will not only hobble Republicans  chance to take over the state s executive branch but also their effort to rally support for the party s eventual presidential nominee  His comment about the Holocaust being hogwash along with his demeaning comment about woman will wreck GOP chance for regaining the White House and the governorship here in North Carolina   Baltzegar said Robinson s other Republican rival  State Treasurer Dale Folwell  told The Post that he belief  that only girl should be in girl bathroom  but criticized Robinson for what he described a fearmongering to enrage people and whip up vote  Mark Robinson is history s latest example of someone trying to rise to power through hate
