National News Vancouver Lunar New Year parade revers decision to bar progressive  LGBTQ  group VANCOUVER   Organizers of the Vancouver Chinatown Lunar New Year parade have changed course and rescinded their rejection of two progressive and LGBTQ  group that they previously barred from participating  Chuck Chiang  The Canadian Press Feb 10  2024 1 00 AM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Progressive and LGBTQ  group say they ve been excluded from Vancouver s Lunar New Year parade in Chinatown  with one organizer saying they were ousted for  political affiliation   Performers carry a dragon a people gather to celebrate Lunar New Year celebration in Victoria  B C   Sunday  Jan  29  2023  THE CANADIAN PRESS Chad Hipolito Listen to this article 00 05 41 VANCOUVER   Organizers of the Vancouver Chinatown Lunar New Year parade have changed course and rescinded their rejection of two progressive and LGBTQ  group that they previously barred from participating  Organizing committee spokesman Frank Huang said letter had been sent to the group Chinatown Together and Lunar New Year For All  approving their participation in Sunday s parade  Huang didn t give any reason for the reversal in a brief interview in Mandarin late Friday  Chinatown Together s organizer  Melody Ma  said in a statement that neither group had received a formally signed invitation from the parade organizing committee  Chinatown Together and Lunar New Year For All released a joint letter Friday night addressed to the group organizing the parade  saying they were looking for a public apology for harm caused to the LGBTQ  community  and the youth and elder in Chinatown   In the last week  despite being initially invited to apply for the Chinatown Spring Festival Parade  your committee ha chosen to place our group through a series of turbulence  disappointment  public humiliation  character assassination  and harmful stigmatization stemming from your committee s dissemination of baseless  unprovoked accusation in the public sphere after rejecting u from participating in the parade   the letter said  In addition to the public apology  the two group wrote that they were also looking for a  commitment to transparent communication regarding the qualification for participation in future parade for all group   In previous letter and statement  the parade s committee had told Chinatown Together that it couldn t march because of a ban on  political activism   while it rejected another group it didn t identify because of  the potential for disruption and protest   Sunday s Spring Festival Parade in Vancouver is celebrating it 50th anniversary and mark the year of the dragon  which start on Saturday  The event is organized by a consortium of six group   the Chinese Benevolent Association of Vancouver  the Chinese Cultural Centre of Greater Vancouver  the Vancouver Chinatown Merchants Association  the Chinese Freemasons Vancouver Branch  the Shon Yee Benevolent Association of Canada and social service agency SUCCESS  Ma is a community activist and vocal critic of gentrification in Chinatown  She ha opposed project such a a residential tower at 105 Keefer Street  which wa approved by Vancouver s permit board last June after year of dispute  On Tuesday  she posted a letter from the parade s organizing committee on the social medium platform X  formerly known a Twitter  which said Chinatown Together s participation in the march had been rejected because  political activism find no place within the spirit of the event   The letter dated Feb  3 said the parade is  dedicated to a sense of unity  and is intentionally distanced from religious or political affiliation  It told Ma  your passion for advocacy ha been recognized   In an interview before the committee changed it mind  Ma said the group wanted to participate in the parade  despite the fact the organizer were pro Chinatown gentrification because we wanted to put that all aside    What s ironic is that by rejecting and citing political activism   whatever that mean to them in this case   they are inherently politicizing the event and the decision   she had said  Pearl Wong  co organizer of Lunar New Year For All  said in an interview before the decision s reversal that they weren t told why they were banned   Our thought process wa  hey  it would be really cool if we could form a group that is dedicated for queer and trans folk of Asian descent   Wong said   We don t really understand why it ha to be this hard because I don t think it s very hard to be inclusive and welcoming   The organizing committee had said in a statement late Thursday that it accepted or rejected application based on  promoting community  collaboration and tolerance  and ensuring the parade is  safe and inclusive  for participant and spectator  Then on Friday it released another statement saying that  we welcome member of the 2SLGBTQ  community to walk alongside u   But it said  a group did not meet our expectation because of the potential for disruption and protest at the parade that were not related to the 2SLGBTQ  community   It said the committee hope to  work through these issue  with the group  which it didn t name  so it can take part next year  Jordan Eng  president of the Vancouver Chinatown Business Improvement Association  said the situation highlighted the complexity of Chinatowns and their social and economic fault line   Chinatown is like a city in itself   with strong opposing view on issue such a gentrification  Eng said before the committee s reversal   On 105 Keefer  even within those legacy organization  that wa a really hard decision   Eng said  noting many group changed position over time to support the project   Our view don t necessarily align with the legacy organization  and the last go around for 105  Keefer   most of those organization did not support it a well   Eng s group supported the project  He said this year s parade  celebrating both the year of the dragon and the event s 50th anniversary  would play a crucial role in the revitalization of the neighbourhood after the pandemic   This is really a time for u to showcase Chinatown in a very positive light  in a unified light   he said   We need good news story  We don t need people trying to bring u down   Extra police officer will be deployed to the parade and celebration  but Vancouver police say there are no specific public safety risk and the move is aimed at managing the large crowd  This report by The previously come under investigation for inflammatory comment about LGBTQ  student  singled out the Salt Lake City athlete in a since deleted Facebook post that falsely insinuated the girl wa transgender  Cline later apologized for provoking a firestorm of vulgar comment after she learned that the girl wa not in fact trans But the school board member defended her initial suspicion  saying that a national push to normalize transgender identity make it  normal to pause and wonder if people are what they say they are   Many Republican politician have successfully spread fear about transgender individual to garner support for athletic ban and bathroom restriction that threaten to push trans people out of community space  The sponsor say such policy are needed to protect woman and girl  But a law banning trans girl from girl  sport have spread across Republican led state  false accusation such a this have threatened the safety of both trans and non trans youth  READ MORE Faced with wave of hostile bill  transgender right leader are playing  a defense game  Kansas  AG is telling school they must out trans kid to parent  even with no specific law South Dakota ha apologized and must pay  300K to transgender advocate In a joint rebuke with Republican Lt  Gov  Deidre Henderson  Gov  Spencer Cox said Cline ha  embarrassed the state  by dogpiling on a child she thought to be trans  The public reprimand from the state s executive leader come a few week after Cox signed legislation making Utah the latest state to limit bathroom access for transgender people   We were stunned to learn of the unconscionable behavior of board member Cline and others toward a high school student today   Cox and Henderson said in their joint statement late Wednesday   The last thing our child need is an elected official harassing them on social medium  Cox ha toed the line on transgender restriction during his three year a governor  He vetoed a transgender athlete ban but approved legislation like the new bathroom law that critic say ha given people such a Cline license to scrutinize others in public and direct vitriol at anyone whose gender expression give them pause  A 2022 state law banning trans girl from playing on girl  sport team  which wa enacted over Cox s opposition  ha been temporarily blocked by a judge while a legal challenge move through court Troy Williams  executive director of the LGBTQ  advocacy group Equality Utah  said Cline s post triggered a modern day witch hunt in which adult tried to police the body of a child to determine if she wa feminine enough  Now that new bathroom legislation ha passed the Utah Legislature and been signed by Governor Cox  we are deeply concerned these gender witch hunt will escalate and harm not only transgender Utahns  but any Utahn who doe not conform to Natalie Cline s narrow view of gender   he said Cox s brand of socially conscious conservatism ha led to past sparring match with Republican legislative leader and ha sometimes placed him at odds with the national party a it ha shifted further right and zeroed in on transgender people  He is up for reelection this year and face some prominent Republican challenger Democratic state lawmaker have called for Cline s resignation and say they re working with attorney to initiate impeachment proceeding against her  Republican legislative leader have not signaled whether they would support impeachment  but Senate President Stuart Adams said Thursday he wa  looking at all option  to address Cline s  reprehensible  behavior  The governor and lieutenant governor  meanwhile  have asked the school board to  hold her accountable   The State Board of Education condemned Cline s action in a statement Thursday but said it ha no power or authority to unseat her  The elected 15 member body is looking into whether disciplinary action is warranted  Board Leadership is very concerned about this post and the harm it ha caused to student and family in Utah   the panel said   We are deeply saddened by the event that have taken place and will be taking prompt action  Cline ha given no indication that she plan to resign  Her term end in November  and she ha filed to run for reelection  Lt  Gov  Henderson said she made a donation this week to the campaign of Cline s Republican opponent  Jordan School District administrator Amanda Bollinger  and encouraged her social medium follower to do the same The Granite School Board will hold a special meeting Friday to discus a resolution condemning Cline for targeting one of it recognition of gender change wa unconstitutional  Photograph  Alexey Panferov AlamyJapanJapan court let transgender man change official status without sterilisation in legal firstRuling come month after supreme court ruled that requiring sterilisation before a change of gender in official record wa unconstitutionalAssociated PressWed 7 Feb 2024 20 24 ESTLast modified on Fri 9 Feb 2024 12 52 ESTA court in western Japan ha approved a transgender man s request to have his gender changed in official record without undergoing sterilisation surgery  the first known ruling of it kind since the country s top court struck down a surgery requirement for such record change Tacaquito Usui  50  could get the gender listed for him in his family registry updated to male  the Okayama family court s Tsuyama branch ruled on Wednesday  Usui s original application for the revision wa rejected five year ago  It s like I m standing at the start line of my new life   he said during a televised news conference after the ruling came out   I m so excited  Japan court rule mandatory sterilisation of people officially changing gender unconstitutionalRead moreJapan s supreme court ruled in October that a provision of a 20 year old law that made the removal of reproductive organ a precondition for the legal recognition of gender change wa unconstitutional  The ruling  however  applied only to the sterilisation provision and did not address the constitutionality of requiring other procedure The Okayama court found that the hormone therapy Usui received made him eligible for gender affirmation  Usui welcomed the recognition  saying he thought the law in Japan might be evolving faster than public awareness Many LGBTQ  people in Japan still hide their sexual orientation and gender identity due to fear of discrimination at work and school  The country remains the only Group of Seven member state that doe not allow same sex marriage Activists have pressed for greater right and changed  according to court document from a separate court case  A court in central Japan noted in last year s case that sterilisation surgery wa not required in most of the approximately 50 European title: Japan court approves transgender man request legal recognition without needing surgery
summary: A court in western Japan ha approved a transgender man s request to have his gender changed in official record without undergoing sterilization surgery
source_text: Japan court approves a transgender man s request for legal recognition without needing surgery By MARI YAMAGUCHI Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print TOKYO  AP    A court in western Japan on Wednesday approved a transgender man s request to have his gender changed in official record without undergoing sterilization surgery  the first known ruling of it kind since the country s top court struck down a surgery requirement for such record change  The Okayama Family Court s Tsuyama Branch said Tacaquito Usui  50  could get the gender listed for him in his family registry updated to male  Usui original application for the revision wa rejected five year ago  It s like I m standing at the start line of my new life   he said during a televised news conference after Wednesday s ruling came out   I m so excited   Japan s Supreme Court ruled in October that a provision of a 20 year old law that made the removal of reproductive organ a precondition for the legal recognition of gender change wa unconstitutional  The ruling  however  only applied to the sterilization provision and did not address the constitutionality of requiring other procedure  READ MORE New York appeal court hears argument over the fate of the state s ethic panel Top UN court reject South African request for urgent measure to safeguard Rafah Brian Wilson need to be put in conservatorship after death of wife  court petition say The Okayama court found that the hormone therapy Usui received made him eligible for gender affirmation  Usui welcomed the recognition  saying he think the law in Japan might be evolving faster than the public awareness  Many LGBTQ  people in Japan still hide their sexual orientation and gender identity due to fear of discrimination at work and school  The country remains the only Group of Seven member that doe not allow same sex marriage Activists have pressed for greater right and protection  But change ha come slowly in a country of conformity with a conservative government that stick to traditional paternalistic value and is reluctant to accept gender  sexual and family diversity  The law that the Supreme Court addressed in it ruling took effect in 2004  It stated that individual who wanted to register a gender change needed to have reproductive organ  including testis or ovary  removed  They also were required to have a body that  appears to have part that resemble the genital organ  of their expressed gender More than 10 000 Japanese have since had their gender officially changed  according to court document from another court case  A court in central Japan noted in last year s case that sterilization

New York on 26 June 2022  Photograph  Erik McGregor LightRocket via Getty ImagesUS newsBiggest ever survey of trans Americans find 94  happier after transitionThe 2022 US Trans Survey of 92 000 transgender adult find continued discrimination  harassment and even violence at workJessica Glenza JessicaGlenzaWed 7 Feb 2024 11 56 ESTLast modified on Wed 7 Feb 2024 13 28 ESTThe largest survey of transgender Americans ever conducted ha found trans people continue to suffer discrimination  harassment and even violence at work  in medicine and at school   but that people who transition have much higher satisfaction in life  and many have supportive family This is the first report to document transgender experience en masse in eight year  and come amid sustained political attack on trans right from conservative Wishes come true for trans youth thanks to Transanta donor  goodwillRead more There s still a drought of information available to lawmaker  the medium and advocate regarding our experience and our need   Rodrigo Heng Lehtinen  executive director of the National Coalition for Transgender Equality  NCTE   said  according to NBC News  At best  we re working in a vacuum of information  At worst  we re combating dangerous misinformation being spread by anti trans extremist   he continued   Without question  the misinformation and lack of understanding is underpinning these escalating legislative attack against our community  The report  called the 2022 US Trans Survey  present an early look at finding from a survey of more than 92 000 people who identify a binary or nonbinary transgender adult  It is the first such report since the NCTE produced a survey of more than 28 000 individual in 2015  Individuals were asked a variety of more than 600 possible question  No respondent received all question Importantly  the transgender survey is large but is not random  Although surveyor weighted the response to try to account for bias  people who took the survey might still be unrepresentative of transgender people living in the US a a whole The report found that 94  of transgender individual who live at least part of the time in a gender different from the one they were assigned at birth   in other word  who  transitioned    were either  a lot   79   or  a little more satisfied   15   with their life  Nearly 98  of respondent were receiving some kind of hormone replacement therapy  which made them  a lot   84   or  a little   14   more satisfied with their life  Obtaining hormone therapy through the informed consent model and having access to surgery ha definitely changed my life for the better   one survey respondent  named Taylor  said   It certainly didn t fix all of my problem instantly  but it fixed a lot of problem that my dysphoria caused  Now that I ve been on HRT and had surgery  I can live my day to day life without pain  dissociation  and misery  Conversely  the sustained political attack on transgender individual  almost entirely from the right wing  made about half of trans respondent  47   consider moving location  At least 10 state force trans individual to use public bathroom that correspond to their gender assigned at birth in at least some situation  a opposed to a choice aligned with the gender they identify a  22 state ban gender affirming care for transgender youth  24 ban transgender youth sport participation Transgender individual also continue to suffer discrimination  harassment and even violence  More than a third were experiencing poverty  34  compared with 12  of the US population   More than one in 10  11   said they had been forced out of a job because of their gender identity  and about 18  were unemployed  compared with 3 5  of the US population in December 2022  Further  nearly one third  30   said they were verbally harassed in the last 12 month and 39  said they were harassed online  About one in 10  9   said they were offered unequal treatment  Three per cent said they were physically attacked in the last 12 month These experience contrasted sharply with the support many trans individual received from family  support that tended to increase with age  Forty three per cent of trans individual aged 16 17 said their family were supportive  all the way up to 63  of individual older than 65 who felt their family were supportive  My whole life ha been affected by the fact that my family wa very accepting of me   said Amanda  who is older than 50   I m not exactly sure why  but both of my parent always supported my gender and sexual expression even before it wa popular to do so  They would intervene at school and in the neighborhood  so I never had the problem that most people had growing up  Explore more on these topicsUS newsTransgenderLGBTQ  rightsnewsReuse this title: Survey 90 000 trans people show vast improvement life satisfaction transition
summary: The U S  Transgender Survey  measure response from over 92 000 transgender people across the country
source_text: Survey of over 90 000 trans people show vast improvement in life satisfaction after transition By Kerry Breen February 7  2024   3 27 PM EST   CBS News How gender  race could shape 2024 campaign How gender and race could shape 2024 campaign 05 11 A survey of more than 92 000 transgender people in the United States found that the vast majority reported more life satisfaction after transitioning  despite facing discrimination in healthcare and the workplace setting  Early insight from the survey   which aim to broadly examine the experience of transgender people in the United States   were released on Thursday  The finding show that people who transitioned were largely happier with their life after the process  though many people who identify a transgender or non binary said they dealt with discrimination in the workplace or in healthcare setting  Some respondent said that they were even considering moving across state line to avoid discriminatory legislation   Those of u who provide gender affirming care find that nearly all of our patient are very satisfied with their medical care but are anxious because of hostility in some part of society   said Dr  Joshua Safer  the executive director of the Center for Transgender Medicine and Surgery in New York s Mount Sinai Health System  Survey find increased satisfaction after transitioning When asked how they felt about life after transitioning to their preferred gender identity  more than three quarter of respondent said they were  a lot more satisfied  with their life  while 15  were  a little more satisfied   Three percent of respondent said their satisfaction with life did not change with transitioning  A similar percentage were le satisfied   1  of people were  a little le satisfied   and 2  of people were  a lot le satisfied  with life  Safer said the result of the survey  mirror what we practitioner believe we are seeing in practice   calling the statistic around gender affirming hormone treatment  especially striking   People who were taking hormone treatment overwhelmingly reported being more satisfied with their life  84  of people said that taking hormone to match their gender identity made them  a lot more satisfied   and another 14  of people were  a little more satisfied  while on hormone  CBS Reports explores law restricting gender affirming care for transgender minor 04 36 People who had surgery to match their gender identity were even more likely to be satisfied with their life  the survey found  with 88  of people who had at least one form of surgery to match their gender identity reporting that they were  a lot more satisfied  with their life  Another 9  of respondent were  a little more satisfied   One percent of people said that surgery had no impact  while le than 2  of people said they were a little or a lot le satisfied after undergoing gender affirming surgery   If we want to see improvement in the well being of transgender people who seek medical care  the biggest opportunity for improvement are earlier engagement with care and more support by society in general   Safer said  Despite stride  respondent still struggle with healthcare and workplace mistreatmentWhen it come to healthcare  almost a quarter of respondent said they did not see a doctor when they needed to in the past year because they were afraid of mistreatment  Of those who did see a healthcare provider in the past year  about half said they had  at least one negative experience because they were transgender   Health provider used hard or abusive language and were physically rough or abusive  In some case patient were misgendered or refused care In the workplace  more than one in ten people who took the survey said they had been fired  forced to resign  or otherwise lost their job because of their gender identity or expression  The unemployment rate among survey respondent wa 18   Meanwhile  about a third of respondent said they were experiencing poverty  and 30  said they had experienced homelessness at some point in their life  People who responded to the survey said that generally  they experienced harassment and violence because of their gender identity  with nearly one in ten respondent saying that they were denied equal treatment or service in the past year because of their identity or expression  Nearly a third of respondent said they were verbally harassed  while 39  of people said they experienced online harassment  Three percent of people said they were physically attacked in the last year  Four percent of people said they were denied access to a restroom in a public place  at work or in school because of their gender identity in the past year  while 6  of respondent said they had been verbally harassed  physically attacked or experienced unwanted sexual contact when accessing or using a restroom  Candles and portrait of people from the transgender community are pictured during a ceremony to support the transgender community and raise awareness on the issue that transgender people face in the country  HILDEGARD TITUS AFP via Getty Images Respondents say they experience harassment  discrimination   and move across state line to avoid it Many respondent said they dealt with some form of discrimination and nearly half said that they had considered moving out of their home state because of proposed or passed legislation targeting transgender people  The data make it clear that gender affirming care help trans people feel more satisfied with their life   said Rodrigo Heng Lehtinen  executive director of the National Center for Transgender Equality  in an email to CBS News   And still  we see discriminatory policy in state all around the country that cause real harm by creating barrier to such care   Nearly half of respondent said they had thought about moving to another state because the government in their home state had  considered or passed law that target transgender people for unequal treatment   including banning access to bathroom  health care or sport  Five percent of respondent  or one in 20 people  said they had actually moved because of such legislation  The survey found that the top 10 state that respondent had moved from because of law targeting transgender people are Alabama  Arizona  Florida  Georgia  Missouri  North Carolina  Ohio  Tennessee  Texas and Virginia  Those state were listed in the survey in alphabetical order  not by how many people had moved from them Forty percent of respondent said they had thought about moving to another area because of discrimination or unequal treatment where they lived  while 10  of respondent had actually moved because of this Over 92 000 transgender and non binary people 16 and older in the U S   U S  territory and on U S  military base overseas were surveyed  and the insight were based on data collected by the National Center for Transgender Equality over six week in 2022  Transgender Rights title: Survey 90 000 trans people show vast improvement life satisfaction transition
summary: The largest ever nationwide survey of trans people found workplace and medical discrimination continues  and that many report increased life satisfaction post transition
source_text: 90 000 trans people show vast improvement in life satisfaction after transitionThe National Center for Transgender Equality released early insight from it 2022 U S  Transgender Survey  the largest survey of trans people in U S  history Get more newsonPrintFeb  7  2024  5 01 AM UTCBy Jo YurcabaA survey of more than 90 000 transgender people in the U S    the largest nationwide survey of the community ever   found that trans people continue to experience workplace and medical discrimination  However  the overwhelming majority of them still report more life satisfaction after having transitioned  The National Center for Transgender Equality  or NCTE  one of the country s largest trans right organization  released it 2022 U S  Transgender Survey Early Insights report Wednesday after a yearslong delay due  in part  to the pandemic  The survey  the most comprehensive look to date at life for transgender people in the U S   come a hundred of bill in the last three year have attempted to roll back trans right  most often by restricting trans people s access to transition related health care and trans student  ability to play school sport  There s still a drought of information available to lawmaker  the medium and advocate regarding our experience and our need   NCTE Executive Director Rodrigo Heng Lehtinen said at a news conference Tuesday   At best  we re working in a vacuum of information  At worst  we re combating dangerous misinformation being spread by anti trans extremist  Without question  the misinformation and lack of understanding is underpinning these escalating legislative attack against our community  A woman attends a rally in support of trans youth in school on June 26  2023  outside the Fayette County Public Schools central office in Lexington  Ky Ryan C  Hermens   Lexington Herald Leader via Getty Images fileThe organization s 2015 U S  Transgender Survey had been the largest survey of trans people in the country  with nearly 28 000 respondent 18 and older  and it ha been widely cited  including by Congress and the Supreme Court  Josie Caballero  the director of the survey  said the 2022 iteration more than tripled the number of respondent   with a total of 92 329 from every state and many U S  territory   and wa improved in a number of other way  For example  it included 605 possible question  though no respondent received all possible question   up from 324 in the 2015 survey  and it included more than 8 000 respondent who were 16 and 17  However  study author note that respondent who participated in the online survey were not drawn from a random sample and that though the sample is large  the finding might not be representative of all trans people  Of the 84 170 adult respondent  38  identified a nonbinary  35  identified a transgender woman  25  identified a transgender men and 2  identified a cross dresser  Continued discrimination and mistreatmentAmong the key finding released Wednesday  the survey found that trans people continue to report experiencing discrimination and mistreatment because of their gender identity and or expression More than one third of adult respondent  or 34   were experiencing poverty at the time of the survey  and 18  were unemployed  More than 1 in 10  or 11   of respondent who had ever held job said they had been fired or forced to resign or had lost job or been laid off because of their gender identity or expression  And  in line with previous survey finding  30  of respondent had experienced homelessness in their lifetime  Of adult respondent who saw health care provider in the previous 12 month  48  reported having had at least one negative experience because they were transgender  including being refused health care  having staff member use the incorrect pronoun for them or having provider use abusive language or be physically rough or abusive while treating them  Fear of mistreatment prevented 24  of respondent from seeing doctor when they needed it in the 12 month before the survey  Many respondent also reported past mistreatment in school  Of adult respondent  80  who were out or perceived a trans in K 12 experienced one or more form of mistreatment  including verbal harassment  physical attack  online bullying or being denied use of the restroom or locker room that matched their gender identity  Of the 8 159 respondent who were 16 and 17  60  reported such mistreatment Higher life satisfaction after transitionDespite those negative experience  the vast majority of adult respondent  79   who lived at least some of the time in different gender from the one they were assigned at birth reported that they were  a lot more satisfied  with their life  An additional 15  reported they were  a little more satisfied   Respondents who received transition related medical care reported similarly high rate of satisfaction  Of respondent who were currently receiving hormone treatment  84  said receiving such treatment for their gender identity transition made them  a lot more satisfied  with their life  and 14  said it made them  a little more satisfied   Just 1  said hormone treatment made them neither more nor le satisfied  and le than 1  said hormone treatment made them a lot le satisfied Of respondent who underwent at least one form of gender affirming surgery  88  said it made them  a lot more satisfied   and 9  said it made them a little more satisfied  Less than 2  total said surgery made them a little le or a lot le satisfied   That might seem obvious to some of u that of course if you re transgender and you need transition related health care  of course your life is better off when you get that health care   Heng Lehtinen said Tuesday   But it s really important to have actually asked people and found out objectively what is their experience  because transition related health care is otherwise so under attack in state legislature around the country  Effects of anti trans legislationIn the last three year  23 state have restricted gender affirming health care   including puberty blocker  hormone therapy and surgery   for minor and  in a few case  adult  according to the Movement Advancement Project  an LGBTQ think tank  Half of state have banned trans student athlete from playing school sport on the team that align with their gender identity rather than their assigned sex at birth  while 10 state have passed law restricting what bathroom trans people can use in school  college and or government owned building Nearly half of respondent to the latest U S  Transgender Survey said they had thought about moving to other state because their state government considered or passed such law that target transgender people  and 5    about 4 600 people   said they had actually moved to other state because of such legislation  The top 10 state where trans respondent most often reported moving from were  in alphabetical order  Alabama  Arizona  Florida  Georgia  Missouri  North Carolina  Ohio  Tennessee  Texas and Virginia Related story From drag ban to sport restriction  75 anti LGBTQ bill became law in 2023 Transgender bathroom bill are back  Does the nation care  Oklahoma bill would ban state agency from celebrating Pride Month Florida GOP proposes sex affidavit and  grooming  ban in slate of anti LGBTQ bill Majority report having supportive familiesThe state of trans right across the country doe not necessarily reflect what trans people are experiencing at home with their family  Of adult respondent  67  reported that their immediate family were either supportive or very supportive  while 22  reported they were neither supportive nor unsupportive and 12  reported they were either unsupportive or very unsupportive  Of 16  and 17 year old respondent  44  reported that their family were either supportive or very supportive  while 28  reported that they were neither supportive nor unsupportive and 29  reported they were unsupportive or very unsupportive   It s important to see that many trans

title: Largest ever survey transgender Americans show high satisfaction gender transition
summary: The research team behind the 2022 U S  Trans Survey  USTS  released a report of it early finding on Wednesday  presenting the largest single sampling of transgender people by any survey  with over 92 000 respondent
source_text: Largest ever survey of transgender Americans show high satisfaction with gender transition by  Cora Neas Posted  Feb 9  2024   03 21 PM CST Updated  Feb 9  2024   05 58 PM CST by  Cora Neas Posted  Feb 9  2024   03 21 PM CST Updated  Feb 9  2024   05 58 PM CST SHARE AUSTIN  KXAN    The research team behind the 2022 U S  Trans Survey  USTS  released a report of it early finding on Wednesday  presenting the largest single sampling of transgender people by any survey  with over 92 000 respondent  The survey follows up on the National Center for Transgender Equality s  NCTE  2015 survey  which had nearly 28 000 response  The 2022 survey also permitted response from 16 and 17 year old  NCTE s Director of the USTS  Josie Caballero  spoke with KXAN in 2022 about the survey s launch   It fill in some of the large gap in research about trans people  and it provides a critical tool for researcher  policymakers and advocate seeking to better understand the need of trans people   said Caballero in 2022  2022  U S  Trans Survey seek accurate picture of transgender life in America According to early result from the 2022 survey  94  of respondent said they were more satisfied with life after gender transitioning  and 3  reported decreased satisfaction  For transgender people receiving hormone replacement therapy  HRT   98  reported higher life satisfaction  for those who had received transition related surgery  97   KXAN followed up with Caballero about the early result on Friday   I believe that  life satisfaction  is probably the most important finding because it just validates the fact that transitional care improves trans life   Caballero said   We hope for detailed analysis to grow our continued knowledge of the gap in research that we have experienced   Despite increased life satisfaction  transgender people report negative experience in public life  48  reported a negative experience or were refused service by a health care provider  34  reported they were experiencing poverty  U S  average 11 5    and 30  had experienced homelessness  18  were unemployed  U S  average 3 7    and 11  reported losing a job because they came out  and  60  of 16  and 17 year old respondent said school staff  teacher and peer had mistreated them due to their gender identity  2022  Homeless Transgender people face higher violence  fewer resource in Austin It save life  it improves the quality of life when people feel accepted and encouraged to be themselves  Josie Caballero  U S  Trans Survey Director Texas wa named by the report a one of ten state that respondent reported leaving because of state law targeting them   Trans people are pretty much distributed exactly like the actual population of the American public across the country via the census   Caballero said   This wa before 2023 when we saw 500  piece of legislation that were targeting trans and queer people across the country  currently  we are tracking over 300 bill just this year  So we can only assume that the problem is getting worse and more people are actually following through with the migration   OutLaw  A Half Century Criminalizing LGBTQ  Texans The survey team plan to make a more comprehensive report and state specific report available later this year   We hope with the extra data  researcher are going to be able to actually dig in deeper  to find better question to ask   Caballero said   We re also hoping that our data set will be a better educational tool for policymakers  that they re able to cite this information a hard evidence to show the title: Almost trans people satisfied life transition  study show
summary: The overwhelming majority of trans people are more satisfied with their life after transition  new research ha revealed
source_text: About UsAdvertiseJobs boardWork with u Login Sign up My profile Saved Articles Logout LatestNews View allUKUSWorldHealthPoliticsSportTransUkraineCulture View boardVideo Support LGBTQ  right Toggle menu Account My Profile Saved Articles Logout Sign up Login US Almost all trans people more satisfied with life after transition  study show Feb 08 Written by Eleanor Noyce Share Save for later Listen An overwhelming majority of trans people are more satisfied with their life after transition  Image  Vera Vita  The overwhelming majority of trans people are more satisfied with their life after transition  new research ha revealed  Released on Wednesday  8 February   the National Center for Transgender Equality s  NCTE  2022 US Transgender Survey compiled data from 92 329 trans people from all 50 state  a well a overseas territory and dependency and military personnel serving outside the country   making it one of the largest study ever conducted  Asking people about healthcare  family  education  gender identity and transition  it found that almost all respondent  94 per cent  who lived  at least some of the time in a different gender than the one they were assigned at birth  reported that they were either  a lot more satisfied   79 per cent   or  a little more satisfied   15 per cent  with life  Meanwhile  98 per cent reported that receiving hormone treatment made them either  a lot more satisfied   84 per cent  or  a little more satisfied   14 per cent   Family support wa also fairly prevalent  with about two third of transgender adult saying family member were either  supportive  or  highly supportive  of their trans identity  Only eight per cent said immediate family wa unsupportive and just four cent reported  very unsupportive  family  The survey also showed the real life impact of transphobia in the US  however  47 per cent of respondent had considered moving to another state because their local government considered passing  or had passed  law that target transgender people for unequal treatment  such a banning access to toilet  healthcare and sport  Five per cent of those who replied had already relocated to escape such law  You may like to watch The top 10 state from which respondent moved away from were Alabama  Arizona  Florida  Georgia  Missouri  North Carolina  Ohio  Tennessee  Texas and Virginia  In addition  47 per cent of respondent reported that they would feel  very uncomfortable  asking the police for help if they needed it  with only eight per cent feeling  very comfortable   The number of  very uncomfortable  or  somewhat uncomfortable  respondent rose to 62 per cent if the issue wa about their trans identity  Advertisement Remove ad The survey co ordinators believe the study can be used to improve support for transgender people  Co principal investigator and lead researcher Sandy E James said   It s impactful to see so many trans people report life satisfaction when they live according to their gender identity and get the health care they need  but we also see that trans people face substantial barrier to living full  healthy and authentic life   As the most comprehensive source of data about trans people in the US  these finding fill an important gap in our knowledge and serve a a critical resource for understanding and addressing the need of trans people   And Rodrigo Heng Lehtinen  an executive director at NCTE  said   Everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and fairness  We need law at federal and state level that make sure all people   including trans people   are treated fairly   No one should ever face discrimination in employment  housing  health care  education  or  other area of life just because of who they are   Dec title: 94  trans people happier following transition according totally legit online survey sponsored trans advocacy group
summary: For the trans activist who have watched in dismay a their narrative ha crumbled before their eye  here come the cavalry to the rescue
source_text: Social Takes Shop Discover Join Join Login Social Podcasts Shop Discover 94  of trans people happier following their transition according to totally legit online survey sponsored by trans advocacy group    Feb 11  2024   NottheBee com For the trans activist who have watched in dismay a their narrative ha crumbled before their eye  here come the cavalry to the rescue Too bad for them it s F Troop No matter  the medium power were all too eager to fall in line and report on the survey a if it were a legitimate study sponsored by dispassionate researcher interested in pursuing the truth and not a marketing piece sponsored by The National Center for Transgender Equality  NCTE  a self proclaimed advocacy group interested in pursuing a narrative It had to be legit  right  Why  it wa the  biggest survey ever  The Guardian clearly can t get enough of this having published a different survey last year which showed only 78  were happier Why  trans people are getting happier by the minute Interestingly  that older survey wa made up of nearly two third of people who called themselves  trans non binary  or  trans gender nonconforming  meaning    what  You transitioned to not a gender  Is that a half trans  What if you trans from non binary to gender nonconforming  Are you transtrans Don t worry  they are a confused a you are Moreover  le than a third were on hormone therapy and half that had had surgery  meaning the vast majority of respondent were playing dress up more than anything else No matter  this latest super scientific survey ups the ante in the endless race to be the most supportive How super scientific wa it It employed that gold standard of all survey The celebrity endorsement And not just any celebrity endorsement  but endorsement from celebrity with an enormous pro trans following The US Trans Survey is LIVE  If you are a trans person over the age of 16  go to ustranssurvey org and take the survey now When it come to data integrity  you can keep your random probability sampling  give me an Instagram post targeting people who already agree with you any day And yes  16 is the cutoff  two year younger than the last NCTE survey The study included individual aged 16 and older at the time of survey completion The smart money say it will be even lower the next time I downloaded the preliminary result available via PDF The survey wa supported by a number of trans advocacy group all divided and categorized by race because if you aren t practicing overt segregation  you re doing intersectionality wrong And you re a racist  but that s assumed They were careful to reach out to a broad array of group representing everybody from those who support the cause wholeheartedly  to those who support the cause even more wholeheartedly The outreach period began approximately one year before the survey launch  and the outreach team used various strategy to connect with transgender people through multiple point of access  such a through transgender   or LGBTQ    support group  health center  and online community The people hanging around the group that explicitly support the trans industrial complex are probably not the one who either regret their transition or have already detransitioned It would be like running a survey about abortion targeting Planned Parenthood member or a poll on putting pineapple on pizza by only asking psychopath You re going to get the result you wanted Throughout the outreach period  the team conducted a survey pledge campaign  which wa among the most important method for engaging and communicating with potential respondent Just to be crystal clear  They recruited the most committed advocate to pledge fealty to the cause and recruit the like minded This wasn t a study  This wa a pep rally The campaign invited potential participant and ally to pledge to take the survey and or spread the word about the survey And ally  Hold that thought for just a second The survey wa anonymous  and maintaining privacy and confidentiality in the collection and maintenance of survey data wa an important component of preserving participant  anonymity Anonymous  So     anyone could take the survey  including  ally  eager to support the cause I swear  could this survey get any more legitimate  All it need now is a sweepstakes As an incentive to complete the survey  participant were offered the opportunity to enter into a random drawing for one of three cash prize upon completion of the survey  including one  500 cash prize and two  250 cash prize The report didn t mention what percentage were taking hormone  had surgery  or unhappy childhood  that last one wa 46  in the Washington Post survey   Not to worry A detailed description of the methodology will be included in the full report of the 2022 U S  Transgender Survey After the headline  attention  and scrutiny die down I have no idea what percentage of trans people are happier following their transition  and this survey certainly doesn t tell me either  It is comically bad and corrupt from the start  That our alleged watchdog in the medium would slavishly report on it a if it wa anything other than a slickly produced advertising brochure tell you everything you need to know about them Look  if you re going to gaslight me  at least show me some respect and make it look half believable  P S  Now check out our latest video   Keep up with our mother  Esther Ghey  wa in the public gallery Brianna  who wa transgender  wa lured to a park in Cheshire and murdered by two teenager in February last year  Starmer welcomed Esther Ghey to the Commons on Wednesday and praised her  unwavering bravery  before asking Sunak a question about NHS waiting list In response the prime minister listed what he called broken Labour promise  telling the Commons   I think I counted almost 30 in the last year  pension  planning  peerage  public sector pay  tuition fee  childcare  second referendum  defining a woman   although in fairness that wa only 99  of a U turn  The jibe drew cry of  shame  from opposition MPs  who called for Sunak to apologise  A visibly angry Starmer responded   Of all the week to say that  when Brianna s mother is in the chamber  Brianna s father  Peter Spooner  said Sunak s remark wa  absolutely dehumanising  and called for him to apologise   For the prime minister of our country to come out with degrading comment like he did  regardless of them being in relation to discussion in parliament  they are absolutely dehumanising   he told Sky News Facing question about the controversy on Thursday morning  Philp declined six time on BBC Breakfast to say whether he thought Sunak s jibe wa appropriate or respectful Asked whether he wa suggesting that Brianna s father had misunderstood the prime minister s remark  Philp said he wa  very sad  to read Spooner s response and added   I have got every respect for  obviously  the view and feeling of a bereaved father  He insisted that the prime minister wa making a political point about Labour and that Starmer wa  actually wrong  to bring up Brianna after Sunak s remark  It is of course important to conduct public debate respectfully   Philp told the BBC Radio 4 Today programme   That is why I think it wa actually wrong of Keir Starmer to introduce Brianna a a subject in the next question  because Rishi Sunak had not made any reference to any individual  Sunak ha offered to meet Esther Ghey but no meeting ha been publicly confirmed Although some Conservative MPs have criticised Sunak s remark  the equality minister  Kemi Badenoch  accused Starmer of trying to use Brianna s murder for  political point scoring  Philp told Times Radio   The point the prime minister wa making wa about flip flop and U turn  and he listed about 10 different flip flop and U turn that Keir Starmer s made   he s making another one  I understand  later on today  on this  28bn that seems to be vanishing or is being U turned  or they re saying they can do the policy without it costing anything  or some similar nonsense   So  the PM wa trying to highlight Keir Starmer s flip flop and U turn  and that I think wa an understandable thing to do   As a more general point  when talking about difficult and sensitive issue  it is obviously important for everyone in public life  all of u   journalist  politician  everybody   just to use measured and title: Rip Curl wipeout show fed Americans winning
summary: If Americans want to know who s winning the war with corporate bully  look no further   RipCurl  boycott  BudLight  transgender  Woke  LGBT  trans  SashaLowerson  BethanyHamilton  surfing  RipCurlbacklash

financial dependency How to keep your sanity in a crazy election yearIsrael need to stop denying citizenship to Messianic JewsEngaging view and analysis from outside contributor on the issue affecting society and faith today CP VOICES do not necessarily reflect the view of The Christian Post  Opinions expressed are solely those of the author s  HomeOpinionRip Curl s wipeout show that fed up Americans are winning By Suzanne Bowdey  Op ed contributor Thursday  February 08  2024iStock Daniel GoldinIt s been a week to forget for surf company Rip Curl  the latest brand to risk consumer  wrath with a pro transgender marketing campaign  Their January post urging people to meet  waterwoman  Sasha Lowerson  a biological man in a bikini  lit a literal fire under fan  who took to the internet to burn everything from surf booty to board Days after deleting the reel  with international outrage at a peak  headquarters decided to do something that Bud Light still hasn t  apologize In a revealing move  management issued a mea culpa late Wednesday night  just five day into the dustup   Our recent post ha landed u in the divisive space around transgender participation in competitive sport   a spokesman told Shop Eat Surf late Wednesday night   We want to promote surfing for everyone in a respectful way  but recognize we upset a lot of people with our post and for that  we are sorry  To clarify  the surfer featured ha not replaced anyone on the Rip Curl team and is not a sponsored athlete  If Americans want to know who s winning the war with corporate bully  look no further  A reversal like this is majorly significant   not only because of how intense the backlash wa  but how quickly executive responded  If anything  the wave of corporate pushback that wa sparked by Bud Light ha only intensified over time  In fact  it s so powerful that even the medium is starting to admit that the grassroots may actually be winning this fight   Big corporates may finally be learning that  Go woke  go broke  is real   commentator Nicolle Flint pointed out      T he once iconic Australian surf brand is living proof that woman are finally fighting back against company using transgender woman to promote product for woman and girl   she wrote   What is most significant about the Rip Curl campaign featuring Sasha Lowerson that wa removed from Instagram just five day after being posted  is that this is the first time a major brand ha responded to female backlash   Whether the company  woke up  soon enough to the fact that the backlash from woman wa serious and potentially financially damaging remains to be seen  That s a blow to the company s relatively new CEO  who  pre Bud Light  told The Sydney Morning Herald when she wa hired in 2021 that her goal wa to drift left   You still want to be cool enough to recruit that next generation   Brooke Farris said   but I think by approaching it from a place of inclusivity  people will be attracted to that  Turns out  people were not attracted to that   and willing to sink her brand to prove it  Meanwhile  Bethany Hamilton  the courageous face of Rip Curl from 1999 to 2023  is surely looking on with satisfaction  A year into her renewed contract with the company  the two side abruptly parted way last year  almost certainly because of Hamilton s opposition to the new rule allowing biological men to compete in woman s surfing  The devoted Christian and shark attack survivor  whose comeback story inspired the world  reiterated her stand at the height of the Rip Curl controversy  posting   Male bodied athlete should not be competing in woman s sport  Period  Amazingly  those mainstream view have still made Hamilton a public target  Most recently  a mob of LGBT activist tried   and failed   to have Bethany disinvited from a speaking engagement at a Wisconsin fundraiser for underserved girl  In a three page missive signed by 200 trans ally  they demand that the Women s Fund of the Oshkosh Area Community Foundation take  all possible step to remove and replace Bethany Hamilton a  Power of the Purse  keynote speaker  lest she creates more  discrimination  distrust  division  and harm  In another sign that activist are fighting a losing battle  the Foundation refused to be intimidated  Leaders released a statement to local outlet WHBY insisting the event will go on a planned   Over the year  the Women s Fund Power of the Purse event ha hosted a wide range of powerful speaker from all background whose diverse experience and perspective have imparted impactful lesson of hope  and perseverance   and Bethany Hamilton is no different  Both a world renowned athlete and survivor  Ms  Hamilton will share her own story with our community of overcoming obstacle  facing fear and triumphing a an individual  Although her scheduled appearance ha been met with some criticism due to her reported personal view on transgender athlete   we still very much believe her inspirational message of determination and resilience can transcend our difference  For a corporate culture used to flaunting it extremism without consequence  Rip Curl s regret prof one thing  there are choppy water ahead for woke business Originally published at The Washington Stand  Suzanne Bowdey serf a editorial director and senior writer for The Washington Stand  In her role  she draft commentary on topic such a life  consumer activism  medium and entertainment  sexuality  education  religious freedom  and other issue that affect the institution of marriage and family  Over the past 20 year at FRC  her op ed have been featured in publication ranging from the Washington Times to The Christian Post  Suzanne is a graduate of Taylor University in Upland  Ind   with major in both English Writing title: Brianna Ghey father demand apology Sunak transgender remark
summary: Peter Spooner describes comment  made in an exchange at prime minister s question  a being  absolutely dehumanising The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey ha demanded Rishi Sunak apologise after the prime minister made a jibe at the expense of transgender people just after being told Brianna s mother wa watching him in the House of Commons After the exchange  at prime minister s question  Brianna s father  Peter Spooner  called Suna
source_text: Sunak at prime minister s question  He made a jibe about Labour s policy on trans right and  defining a woman  shortly after being told Brianna Ghey s mother wa in the Commons  Photograph  UK parliament Maria Unger ReutersView image in fullscreenSunak at prime minister s question  He made a jibe about Labour s policy on trans right and  defining a woman  shortly after being told Brianna Ghey s mother wa in the Commons  Photograph  UK parliament Maria Unger ReutersRishi SunakBrianna Ghey s father demand apology from Sunak over transgender remarkPeter Spooner describes comment made in an exchange at prime minister s question a  absolutely dehumanising Peter Walker Deputy political editor peterwalker99Wed 7 Feb 2024 14 38 ESTLast modified on Thu 8 Feb 2024 00 08 ESTThe father of the murdered teenager Brianna Ghey ha demanded Rishi Sunak apologise after the prime minister made a jibe at the expense of transgender people just after being told Brianna s mother wa watching him in the House of Commons After the exchange  at prime minister s question  Brianna s father  Peter Spooner  called Sunak s comment  absolutely dehumanising   For the prime minister of our country to come out with degrading comment like he did  regardless of them being in relation to discussion in parliament  they are absolutely dehumanising   he told Sky News   Identities of people should not be used in that manner  and I personally feel shocked by his comment and feel he should apologise for his remark  A series of Conservative MPs also rounded on Sunak for insensitivity after he pressed ahead with an apparently prepared attack line about transgender people  just after being told by Keir Starmer that Esther Ghey wa in the public gallery Listing what he called broken Labour promise  the prime minister said   I think I counted almost 30 in the last year  pension  planning  peerage  public sector pay  tuition fee  childcare  second referendum  defining a woman   although in fairness that wa only 99  of a U turn  The final example  seemingly a reference to a Labour policy reversal on self identification and Starmer s comment that  99 9   of woman do not have penis  prompted a furious response from several MPs A clearly angry Starmer replied   Of all the week to say that  when Brianna s mother is in the chamber  Shame  Parading a a man of integrity  when he s got absolutely no responsibility  View image in fullscreenPeter Spooner said   Identities of people should not be used in that manner   Photograph  Phil Noble ReutersSunak ignored several demand from MPs in the Commons that he apologise  saying only that Esther Ghey represented  the very best of humanity in the face of seeing the very worst of humanity  and she deserves all our admiration and praise  No 10 defended his word  saying it wa  legitimate  to note U turn by the opposition It is understood that while Sunak made the comment after being told that Ghey wa watching  she actually arrived in chamber slightly late and so missed that initial exchange 00 01 27Starmer condemns Sunak comment on trans people a Brianna Ghey s mother watch in gallery   videoBrianna  16  wa lured to a park in Cheshire and murdered in February last year  Last Friday  Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe  both 16  were jailed for at least 22 and 20 year respectively  Ratcliffe wa found to have been partly motivated by hostility to Brianna s transgender identity It emerged later that No 10 wa trying to arrange a meeting between Sunak and Brianna s family  at a time to suit them  to discus online safety among young people  one of several issue that have come to the fore from her murder While some colleague leapt to Sunak s defence   the business secretary  Kemi Badenoch  tweeted that it wa  shameful of Starmer to link his own inability to be clear on the matter of sex and gender directly to her grief    several Tory MPs expressed disquiet The former minister Jackie Doyle Price said that while she wa an advocate of balancing transgender right with the protection of single sex space  Sunak s comment  trivialises something that s very important  and wa  frankly very ill judged  She told Times Radio   I suspect that when he say that line  he doesn t think about it like that because it s being given to him a a line  Let s just bring it down to it lowest level   you know  boy like talking about penis  Dehenna Davison  another former minister  tweeted that it wa  disappointing to hear joke being made at the trans community s expense   adding   Our word in the house resonate right across our society and we all need to remember that  She wrote   Given some of the terrible incidence of transphobia we have seen lately  this need for respect feel more crucial than ever  View image in fullscreenBrianna Ghey  16  wa murdered by two teenager last year  at least one of whom wa found to have been partly motivated by her transgender identity Jamie Wallis  the Conservative backbencher who in 2022 became the UK s first publicly trans MP  also expressed disappointment at Sunak s word He said in a statement   I know that from my own interaction with the prime minister that today s display of insensitivity must have been inadvertent  Today ha been a tough day for me  but all I can think about right now is Brianna s mother  Let u all think of her a we choose how to progress with this debate  While Downing Street clearly hope the row will die down  it ha the potential to create more difficulty  with the chancellor  Jeremy Hunt  enduring some awkward exchange in TV interview intended to be devoted to a Treasury analysis of Labour s green prosperity plan Asked repeatedly why Sunak had made a joke at the expense of trans people  the chancellor told the BBC this wa  taking these comment out of context   before eventually refusing to engage with question about whether the prime minister should apologise A Labour spokesperson said   We don t think that the country want or deserves a prime minister that is happy to use minority a a punchbag  The comment were really deeply offensive to trans people and he should reflect on his response there and apologise  Starmer held a meeting with Esther Ghey in parliament after PMQs  He later tweeted   I am utterly in awe of her strength and bravery in the face of such unimaginable grief  a she campaign to make sure no parent ha to go through what she did  Sunak and his minister routinely attack Labour s position on transgender right  Last year the party changed it policy on a self identification system that would have let summary: Brianna Ghey s father ha slammed Rishi Sunak following a remark made in the House of Commons today during Prime Minister Questions   but his office called it a  legitimate  criticism of Sir Keir Starmer

the House of Commons today during Prime Minister Questions   but his office called it a  legitimate  criticism of Sir Keir StarmerTrans teen Brianna Ghey wa murdered  Image  Cheshire Police   SWNS ByBradley JollyNews ReporterAshley CowburnPolitical Correspondent18 38  7 Feb 2024Updated09 31  8 Feb 2024Brianna Ghey s father ha demanded Rishi Sunak apologise after the Prime Minister made a disparaging remark about transgender people  During his weekly showdown with MPs and the leader of the opposition in the House of Commons  Mr Sunak said  said   We are bringing the waiting list down for the longest waiter and making progress  but it is a bit rich to hear about promise from someone who ha broken every single promise he wa elected on   I think I have counted almost 30 in the last year  Pensions  planning  peerage  public sector pay  tuition fee  childcare  second referendum  defining a woman   although in fairness that wa only 99  of a U turn   The dad of murdered trans girl Brianna  Peter Spooner  said Mr Sunak s remark during PMQs  which the girl s mother Esther Ghey attended  were  degrading  and  absolutely dehumanising   Mr Spooner said   As the prime minister for our country to come out with degrading comment like he did  regardless of them being in relation to discussion in parliament  they are absolutely dehumanising  Identities of people should not be used in that manner  and I personally feel shocked by his comment and feel he should apologise for his remark   The dad told Sky News the PM should  apologise for his remark   regardless of them  being in relation to discussion in Parliament   Campaigners also accused Mr Sunak of being  callous  a he refused to apologise and Downing Street insisted his remark were  legitimate   If you can t see the poll  click here At a briefing for journalist  No10 six time refused to apologise  Mr Sunak s Press Secretary insisted it wa  legitimate  to point out Mr Starmer s  U turn   Sir Keir Starmer ha previously said that 99 9  of woman  haven t got a penis   Brianna s family ha now been invited to meet with Mr Sunak and Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan about online safety  it is understood  No10 refuse six time to apologise for Rishi Sunak s trans joke a Brianna Ghey s mum visit Commons Brianna Ghey is pictured with her mother  Esther  who wa at PMQs today Ms Ghey is campaigning for new rule on social medium for kid following the murder of 16 year old Brianna and met MPs today  At the beginning of Prime Minister s Questions  Sir Keir praised her  unwavering bravery  just day after two teenager were locked up for the murder of her daughter last year  But just minute later  Mr Sunak accused the Labour leader of failing to stand by his commitment and U turning on  defining a woman   In response  Sir Keir said   Of all the week to say that when Brianna s mother is in this chamber   shame  Parading a a man of integrity when he s got absolutely no responsibility   Other MPs also shouted  shame  while one could be heard saying   Disgusting   Ms Ghey who had been due to watch PMQs arrived in the gallery of the House of Commons chamber shortly after the exchange  Labour MP Liz Twist later asked the PM whether he  could consider apologising  to Brianna s mother for his  insensitive comment   but he declined  Keir Starmer later met Ms Ghey in his Commons office and said he wa  in awe of her strength   Rishi Sunak face criticism over his remark about transgender people   Image  UK PARLIAMENT AFP via Getty Imag  It come just day after Mr Sunak wa criticised for being  callous  after agreeing to a  1 000 bet with Piers Morgan he would deport asylum seeker to Rwanda before the election  A spokesman for the Labour leader added   We don t think the country want or deserves a Prime Minister who is happy to use minority a a punch bag  His comment were deeply offensive to trans people and he should reflect on his response and apologise   TV presenter Carol Vorderman said   Rishi Sunak should immediately resign for his sick joke mocking trans people when he knew that Brianna Ghey s mother wa in the Houses of Parliament  The fact that the Tory bench sat laughing like a pack of hyena tell you everything you need to know about this party   The LGBT  charity Stonewall said   We call on the Prime Minister to apologise unreservedly for his comment  and for him to reflect on how careless word from those in power can and do result in harm   Liberal Democrat Deputy Leader Daisy Cooper MP added   Every day  Sunak just sink lower and lower  His behaviour is appalling and deeply disturbing  but it s hard to be shocked by this lack of empathy from a man who bet on asylum seeker  life   People are not a punchline   and it s long overdue that the Prime Minister learns that  The British public  and Brianna s mother  deserve so much more than this   Speaking to Sky News  in response to the criticism  Mr Sunak s press secretary said   If you look back on what the prime minister wa saying  there wa a long list of U turn that the leader of the opposition had been making   I don t think those U turn are a joke  it is quite serious change in public policy  I think it is totally legitimate for the prime minister to point those out   Keir Starmer  pictured with Esther Ghey in the House of Commons today  praised the mum s bravery   Image  Getty Images  Since the court case finished last week  Ms Ghey ha received plaudit for her campaign work and is calling for a law to ensure phone are  suitable  for kid  She is urging MPs to adopt a ban on social medium apps on smartphones for under 16 and also want software to alert parent when their child are searching harmful content online  Scarlett Jenkinson  who wa locked up for life last week alongside Eddie Ratcliffe  had viewed extreme violence on the  dark web  before murdering Brianna  On Wednesday Ms Ghey also attended a Westminster Hall debate on mindfulness in school alongside her local MP for Warrington North  Charlotte Nichols  Last year  Ms Ghey set up the Peace of Mind campaign to help raise cash to train teacher in mindfulness technique and help kid deal with negative emotion  She ha previously said creating the campaign helped her  focus on something positive  and ha meant  something good ha come out of the tragic situation  Most Read Don t Miss Rishi Sunak after he made a  dehumanising  transgender remark in the Commons while the victim s mother visited Parliament  Peter Spooner said he wa  shocked  by the comment made during Prime Minister s Questions  in which the PM accused Sir Keir Starmer of having difficulty in  defining a woman   The remark have prompted an immediate backlash  but Mr Sunak ha refused to apologise  with Downing Street later insisting the comment were  totally legitimate  and denying they were transphobic  Try MEN Premium now for FREE    just click here to give it a go Mr Spooner told Sky News   As the Prime Minister for our country to come out with degrading comment like he did  regardless of them being in relation to discussion in Parliament  they are absolutely dehumanising  Identities of people should not be used in that manner  and I personally feel shocked by his comment and feel he should apologise for his remark   In response to his call for an apology  Government minister Laura Trott denied the remark had been a  joke  and insisted they had  absolutely nothing to do with this appalling tragedy   However  it is understood Brianna s family ha now been invited to a meeting about online safety   which her mother  Esther Ghey  is campaigning to improve   with the Prime Minister and Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan  In an exchange with the Leader of the Opposition  Mr Sunak said   We are bringing the waiting list down for the longest waiter and making progress  but it is a bit rich to hear about promise from someone who ha broken every single promise he wa elected on   I think I have counted almost 30 in the last year  Pensions  planning  peerage  public sector pay  tuition fee  childcare  second referendum  defining a woman   although in fairness  that wa only 99  of a U turn   Sir Keir  who met Brianna s mother  Esther Ghey  on Wednesday  condemned the Prime Minister s remark  with a chorus of opposition backbencher calling out   Shame    Of all the week to say that  when Brianna s mother is in this chamber  Shame   Sir Keir said   Parading a a man of integrity when he s got absolutely no responsibility   Number 10 declined repeatedly to apologise for Mr Sunak s language and said it wa part of a  legitimate  criticism of Labour  Mr Sunak s press secretary said   If you look back on what the Prime Minister wa saying  there wa a long list of U turn that the leader of the opposition had been making  I don t think those U turn are a joke  it is quite serious change in public policy  I think it is totally legitimate for the Prime Minister to point those out    It is clearly part of what happens in the chamber  at Prime Minister s Questions  to point out the U turn an opposition leader ha made   she added  Within the session  Mr Sunak also faced call to apologise from Labour MP Liz Twist  to which he did not directly respond  But  concluding Prime Minister s Questions  he said   If I could just say also to Brianna Ghey s mother who is here  a I said earlier this week  what happened wa an unspeakable and shocking tragedy  Brianna Ghey s father  Peter Spooner  ha demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak  Image  Manchester Evening News   As I said earlier this week  in the face of that  for her mother to demonstrate the compassion and empathy that she did last weekend  I thought demonstrated the very best of humanity in the face of seeing the very worst of humanity  She deserves all our admiration and praise for that   Mr Sunak faced some criticism even from within his party rank over the comment  Former Tory business minister  Jackie Doyle Price  said it wa  careless  and  very ill judged  for him to use the joke  in that context   but also accused critic of having  weaponised  it   I find this pre rehearsed line on this issue really trivialises something that s very important so I ve become more uncomfortable with that   she told Times Radio   To say it in that context wa just  frankly  very ill judged  but I wa equally uncomfortable with the way that it wa weaponised   And I just think what an ugly situation all around  because  you know  there is a dead child here who s been murdered in the most appalling circumstance  And for that to be the exchange in the in the chamber of the House of Commons  it s just not my proudest moment to be a Member of Parliament I must say   Former junior minister Dehenna Davison  in a post on X  formerly Twitter  said it wa  disappointing to hear joke being made at the trans community s expense  and warned that  our word in the House resonate right across our society   The Bishop Auckland MP  who wa not in the chamber on Wednesday  said   As politician  it s our job to take the heat out of such debate and focus on finding sensible way forward  whilst ensuring those involved are treated with respect  Given some of the terrible incidence of transphobia we have seen lately  this need for respect feel more crucial than ever   Cabinet minister defended their party leader in the wake of the exchange  with Business Secretary Kemi Badenoch accusing Labour of trying to  weaponise  the issue  Ms Badenoch  who is also Equalities Minister  said on X   Every murder is a tragedy  None should be trivialised by political point scoring  As a mother  I can imagine the trauma that Esther Ghey ha endured  It wa shameful of Starmer to link his own inability to be clear on the matter of sex and gender directly to her grief   Chancellor Jeremy Hunt also told ITV News   It wa the most appalling tragedy and I think everyone ha been incredibly struck by the courage and resolve of Brianna s mother  Esther  throughout the whole of this terrible  terrible story   And we should also be clear  the Prime Minister wa not talking about that  he wa talking about the fact that Keir Starmer ha changed his position on that  a on many other issue   This is not the first time the Prime Minister ha attacked Labour over the issue of gender identity policy  which have been a frequent subject of debate in Westminster in recent year  LGBT  campaigner have condemned some of the language used by politician to discus transgender people  with the issue often drawn into the so called  culture war  by right winger  In his Tory conference speech last year  Mr Sunak told Conservative delegate in Manchester   We shouldn t get bullied into believing that people can be any sex they want to be  They can t   a man is a man and a woman is a woman   A Labour spokeswoman called on Mr Sunak to apologise   We don t think the country want or deserves a Prime Minister that is happy to use minority a a punchbag   she said  LGBT  charity Stonewall called Mr Sunak s word  cheap  callous and crass   A spokesperson said   The disrespect and dehumanisation of trans people that we see played out daily in the medium and in our political discourse ha real life consequence and it ha to stop  We call on the Prime Minister to apologise unreservedly for his comment  and for him to reflect on how careless word from those in power can and do result in harm  Story SavedYou can find this story in My Bookmarks Or by navigating to the user icon in the top right Follow Manchester
