title: Brianna Ghey father demand apology Sunak transgender jibe
summary: The father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey ha demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a  dehumanising  transgender joke in the Commons while the victim s mother visited Parliament
source_text: Ghey s father demand apology from Sunak over transgender jibePeter Spooner said he wa  disgusted  by the joke made during Prime Minister s Questions Published Feb 7Last updated Feb 7Prime Minister Rishi SunakThe father of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey ha demanded an apology from Rishi Sunak after he made a  dehumanising  transgender joke in the Commons while the victim s mother visited Parliament Peter Spooner said he wa  shocked  by the jibe made during Prime Minister s Questions  in which the PM accused Sir Keir Starmer of having difficulty in  defining a woman  The remark have prompted an immediate backlash but Mr Sunak ha so far refused to apologise  with Downing Street later insisting the comment were  totally legitimate  and not transphobic Mr Spooner told Sky News   As the Prime Minister for our country to come out with degrading comment like he did  regardless of them being in relation to discussion in Parliament  they are absolutely dehumanising  Identities of people should not be used in that manner and I personally feel shocked by his comment and feel he should apologise for his remark  In response to his call for an apology  Government minister Laura Trott denied the remark had been a  joke  and insisted they had  absolutely nothing to do with this appalling tragedy  However  it is understood Brianna s family ha now been invited to a meeting about online safety   which her mother  Esther Ghey  is campaigning to improve   with the Prime Minister and Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan In an exchange with the Leader of the Opposition  Mr Sunak said   We are bringing the waiting list down for the longest waiter and making progress  but it is a bit rich to hear about promise from someone who ha broken every single promise he wa elected on  I think I have counted almost 30 in the last year  Pensions  planning  peerage  public sector pay  tuition fee  childcare  second referendum  defining a woman   although in fairness  that wa only 99  of a U turn  Brianna Ghey wa murdered a year ago in Culcheth  near Warrington  Cheshire Police PA Sir Keir  who met Ms Ghey on Wednesday  condemned the Prime Minister s remark  with a chorus of opposition backbencher calling out   Shame   Of all the week to say that  when Brianna s mother is in this chamber  Shame   the Labour leader said  Parading a a man of integrity when he s got absolutely no responsibility  Number 10 repeatedly declined to apologise for Mr Sunak s language  suggesting it wa part of  legitimate  criticism of Labour Mr Sunak s press secretary said   If you look back on what the Prime Minister wa saying  there wa a long list of U turn that the leader of the opposition had been making  I don t think those U turn are a joke  it is quite serious change in public policy  I think it is totally legitimate for the Prime Minister to point those out   It is clearly part of what happens in the chamber  at Prime Minister s Questions  to point out the U turn an opposition leader ha made   she added Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer rebuked the Prime Minister for his remark  House of Commons UK Parliament PA Within the session  Mr Sunak also faced call to apologise from Labour MP Liz Twist  to which he did not directly respond But  concluding Prime Minister s Questions  he said   If I could just say also to Brianna Ghey s mother who is here  a I said earlier this week  what happened wa an unspeakable and shocking tragedy  As I said earlier this week  in the face of that  for her mother to demonstrate the compassion and empathy that she did last weekend  I thought demonstrated the very best of humanity in the face of seeing the very worst of humanity  She deserves all our admiration and praise for that  Esther Ghey wa in the gallery of the House of Commons when the comment wa made  Peter Byrne PA Mr Sunak faced some criticism even from within his party rank over the jibe Former business minister Jackie Doyle Price told Times Radio it wa  careless  and  very ill judged  for him to use the joke  in that context  but also accused critic of having  weaponised  it Former junior minister Dehenna Davison said it wa  disappointing to hear joke being made at the trans community s expense  and warned that  our word in the House resonate right across our society  Brianna wa murdered by teenager Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe  who stabbed her to death in a Cheshire park last February During their sentencing earlier this month  the judge said the  exceptionally brutal  killing had element of both sadism from Jenkinson and transphobic hate on the part of Ratcliffe Cabinet minister defended their party leader over the exchange  with Business Secretary Kemi Badenoch accusing Labour of trying to  weaponise  the issue  It wa shameful of Starmer to link his own inability to be clear on the matter of sex and gender directly to her grief   she said Chief Secretary to the Treasury Laura Trott told LBC   I want to be really  really clear that this wasn t a joke  It ha absolutely nothing to do with this appalling tragedy  Chancellor Jeremy Hunt insisted that the PM  could not have been clearer about the enormous respect he ha for Brianna Ghey s mother  and that his point had been about Labour  flip flopping on important issue  This is not the first time the Prime Minister ha attacked Labour over the issue of gender identity policy  which have been a frequent subject of debate in Westminster in recent year LGBT  campaigner have condemned some of the language used by politician to discus trans people  with the issue often drawn into the so called  culture war  by right winger In his Tory conference speech last year  Mr Sunak told Conservative delegate in Manchester   We shouldn t get bullied into believing that people can be any sex they want to be  They can t   a man is a man and a woman is a woman  A Labour spokeswoman called on Mr Sunak to apologise  We don t think the country want or deserves a Prime Minister that is happy to use minority a a punchbag   she said LGBT  charity Stonewall called Mr Sunak s word  cheap  callous and crass  A spokesperson said   We call on the Prime Minister to apologise unreservedly for his comment  and for him to reflect on how careless word from those in power can and do result in harm  Sorry  we are not accepting comment on this article Similar title: Transgender policy discussion Red Deer town hall get heated
summary: Alberta Pension Plan and overdose prevention site also discussed
source_text: Transgender policy discussion at Red Deer town hall get heated Alberta Pension Plan and overdose prevention site also discussed Paul Cowley Feb 7  2024 10 00 PM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Red Deer South MLA Jason Stephan speaks during a town hall meeting on Wednesday evening   Photo by Paul Cowley Advocate staff  Emotions occasionally ran high at a Red Deer town hall meeting a Red Deer South MLA Jason Stephan defended Premier Danielle Smith s proposed controversial transgender policy  The town hall at the Alberta Sports Hall of Fame wa also billed a an opportunity to discus the proposed Alberta Pension Plan and many question in the question and answer session revolved around the in and out of that proposal  But Stephan s presentation on the province s proposed  parental right policy  generated the most push back  with audience member interrupting the MLA several time  Stephan had only just begun walking the crowd through his presentation on the 10 point of the plan  pointing out it would not allow gender reassignment surgery for minor   Which doesn t happen   shouted out at least two people  Stephan said those kind of surgery have happened and asked audience member to remain respectful  a request he would make a number of time  Another part of the policy will require all third party resource material or presentation related to gender identity  sexual orientation or human sexuality to be pre approved by the Ministry of Education  Parents are the principle educator for their child and are equipped to make the best decision for them and the government want to make sure they are involved in their education  a comment that drew loud applause a did a number of his other point   We want to make sure we stay in our lane and focus on the fundamental in the education of our child   he said   How s that staying in your lane   someone shouted out  He also defended the policy that say parent must consent for their child under age 15 to change their name or pronoun in school and that parent be notified of change if the student is 16 or 17   We don t want school keeping secret from parent   In the Alberta Pension Plan segment that kicked off the town hall  a presentation wa given by Gord Tulk  a director with Libertas Alberta  which bill itself a a grassroots  non partisan  registered society dedicated to promoting policy proposal that lead to freer market  le government and expanded individual freedom  Tulk said Alberta  with it young population and high wage earner ha been subsidizing the pension plan for much of Canada   The other province should have been paying way more than they were   he said  Meanwhile  the Canada Pension Plan is unwieldy  expensive  is focused too heavily on non liquid asset such a real estate and infrastructure and lack transparency  Stephan said an APP would lower premium for business making them more competitive and provide higher benefit for retiree  Stephan also stated his support for moving the  drug consumption site  out of Red Deer  saying it ha boosted crime  vandalism and hurt local business  Next month  another town hall is scheduled to discus the hospital expansion  he said  News tipsLike u on Facebook and follow u on Twitter See a typo mistake  Have a story tip  This ha been shared 0 time 0 Shares Share by title: Ohio back proposed restriction gender affirming care adult
summary: Ohio Gov  Mike DeWine s administration on Wednesday backed off it plan to impose rule that advocate feared would have restricted gender affirming medical treatment for adult in a way no other
source_text: Ohio back off proposed restriction on gender affirming care for adult FILE   Mike DeWine speaks  Jan  14  2019  in Cedarville  Ohio  Ohio s Health Department ha backed off proposed rule that would have restricted gender affirming care for adult  The new proposal Wednesday  Feb  7  2024 come after gathering public comment on a proposal released last month  Transgender people and their healthcare provider feared the original rule would have left thousand of patient scrambling to find care   and facing health risk in the meantime  The proposed rule are also relaxed for requirement for treatment for minor  some of which wa banned by a law adopted last month when the Legislature overrode Gov  Mike DeWine s earlier veto   AP Photo John Minchillo  Pool  By GEOFF MULVIHILL and HANNAH SCHOENBAUM Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print Ohio Gov  Mike DeWine s administration on Wednesday backed off it plan to impose rule that advocate feared would have restricted gender affirming medical treatment for adult in a way no other state ha The rule proposed by two state department would have required the psychiatrist  endocrinologist and medial ethicist to have role in creating gender affirming care plan for clinic and hospital  And patient under 21 would have been required to receive at least six month of counseling before starting hormone treatment or receiving gender affirming surgery The Department of Health and Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services both issued revised proposal Wednesday after gathering public comment  Both said in memo that they were swayed by what they had learned a transgender people and care provider weighed in  The Health Department said it received 3 900 comment  In the new version  the rule would apply only to the care of minor  not adult  Over the last few year  21 state have adopted law banning at least some aspect of gender affirming care for minor  Some are so new they haven t taken effect yet  and a ban in Arkansas wa struck down in court  But so far  only Florida ha restricted care for adult  READ MORE Proposed question on sexual orientation and gender identity for the Census Bureau s biggest survey The Census Bureau is considering how to ask about gender identity  People have their opinion West Virginia bill defining gender is transphobic and  political rubbish   Democrats say The department said the rule will now advance to the next step of review before being implemented  The draft rule would still require that patient under 18 receive at least six month of mental health counseling before they can receive gender affirming medication or surgery  The revision made Wednesday also expand the list of mental health professional qualified to provide the required counseling  adding clinical nurse  social worker  school psychologist and some physician Further  a medical ethicist would no longer be required to have a role in developing facility wide treatment plan for the care  In a memo  the Health Department said that change wa made partly because institution already use medical ethic professional to develop policy In a statement  Siobhan Boyd Nelson  co interim executive director of the LGBTQ  advocacy group Equality Ohio  said the change  will be a massive relief to thousand of transgender people receiving care in Ohio who have spent the last few week scrambling to make contingency plan in case their care is cut off   But she said major concern remain about the remaining provision and that it title: Biden State Department Funds Program Create Army 2 500  LGBTQI  Allies
summary: President Joe Biden s State Department paid a public university to train a cohort of  master trainer  in India who will then go on to train more than two thousand people to become  LGBTQI  ally   according to a government spending database
source_text: My Account News Politics US World Entertainment Sports Business Education Outdoors Satire Opinion Opinion Two Sides Big Tent Ideas Featured Partners Newsletters Documentaries RIGGED  Death of the American Voter Stream Documentaries Patriots Premium Articles Subscribe Daily Caller Merchandise SUBSCRIBE Log In World Biden State Department Funds Program To Create Army Of 2 500  LGBTQI  Allies   Photo by ANGELA WEISS AFP via Getty Images  Robert Schmad Contributor February 06  2024 12 38 PM ET Font Size  President Joe Biden s State Department paid a public university to train a cohort of  master trainer  in India who will then go on to train more than two thousand people to become  LGBTQI  ally   according to a government spending database  Washington State University received  WSU   15 000 from the State Department in July 2023 to hold a three day workshop aimed at training 30 individual with the goal of them eventually training 2 500 people to become  LGBTQI  ally  and to develop a  better understanding of diversity and inclusion   according to a federal spending database  The training took place in India between Sept  25 and Sept  27  according to the university website The State Department offered the grant under a program intended to  support the achievement of U S  foreign policy goal and objective  advance national interest and enhance national security   according to a federal spending database  The training sought to  increase the comfort level of all participant regarding issue faced by member of the LGBTQI  community   the university website read   RELATED  Biden Admin Has Made Exporting  LGBT Ideology  A Key Foreign Policy Priority  Report Says  Individuals participating in the training were instructed on how to properly use  LGBTQI  language   taught about the intersection of LGBTQI  identity and faith  instructed on LGBTQ  history and put through hour of allyship training  according to the workshop schedule   LGBTQI  person across the globe deserve to live in society free from targeted violence and discrimination   a State Department spokesperson told the Daily Caller News Foundation   As all G7 leader reiterated this year in Hiroshima  we work with all segment of society to ensure full  equal  and meaningful participation of LGBTQI  person in politics  economics  education  and all other sphere of society   The State Department s program advance LGBTQI  right and seek to promote the acceptance of marginalized community  the spokesperson said  United States Secretary of State Antony Blinken  Photo by Johannes Simon Getty Images  The State Department ha distributed several grant under the Biden administration promoting LGBTQI  ideology across the world  It disbursed  4 6 million to group in 55 different country to fund LGBTQI  activism a of June 30  according to the Washington Free Beacon  State Department grant have included supporting  queer  Muslim writer in India  providing class for transgender  makeup entrepreneur  in Nepal and funding a LGBTQ  film festival in Portugal that featured pedophilic and incestuous content  Conservative group including the Heritage Foundation and the Family Research Council have argued that exporting LGBTQI  ideology ha been a priority at the State Department since Biden took office   Attempting to export contentious current viewpoint held by slim and temporary political majority doe not advance U S  national interest abroad and might very well induce opposition to them   the report from the Heritage Foundation read  Washington State University Business Subscribe More Podcast Shop About Advertise with Us Search Politics  Daniel James Unsplash  State Department Funds Training for  LGBTQI  Allies  By Sarah Wagner February 8  2024 FacebookTwitterEmailPrintTelegram The State Department paid Washington State University to train  master trainer  in India to teach 2 000 people to become  LGBTQI  ally   according to a report from The Daily Caller  The university received  15 000 from the government in July 2023 to hold a workshop designed to train individual to become  ally  of LGBTQI identifying individual  According to a government spending database  the grant will also promote a  better understanding of diversity and inclusion   The objective of the grant  along with similar program  wa to  support the achievement of U S  foreign policy goal and objective  advance national interest  and enhance national security by informing and influencing foreign public and by expanding and strengthening the relationship between the people and government of the United States and citizen of the rest of the world   The grant wa awarded on July 1  2023  and run through June 30  2024  American Faith previously reported that the State Department provided funding for an India based Queer Muslim group  According to a description of the grant   The Queer Muslim Project will provide a platform to a group of young LGBTQIA writer from underrepresented community in South Asia to showcase their work at a leading Mumbai literature festival alongside writer from the Iowa Writing Program   The State Department is also funding a dancing program to  uplift transgender and gender diverse  people in Peru   Ballroom Saves Lives  Resiliency and Wellness in Peru Ballroom  is a winner of the Citizen Diplomacy Action Fund  CDAF   a title: anti trans legislation proliferates 2024  community fear erasure public view
summary: As lawmaker continue to push bill targeting the LGBTQ community  and specifically transgender people  some fear for safety and their future
source_text: U S  Elections Sports Entertainment Life Money Tech Travel OpinionONLY AT USA TODAY Newsletters For Subscribers From the Archives Crossword eNewspaper Magazines Investigations Weather Forecast Podcasts Video Humankind Just Curious Best selling BooklistPets Food Reviewed Coupons Homefront Blueprint Best Auto Insurance Best Pet Insurance Best Travel Insurance Best Credit Cards Best CD Rates Best Personal Loans Home Internet NATIONLGBTQ IssuesAdd TopicAs anti trans legislation proliferates in 2024  community fear erasure from public view Marc RamirezUSA TODAYCorrections   Clarifications  Lana Moore served on GLAAD s board of director from 2013 until 2020 As a third generation firefighter and then fire captain  Lana Moore served the city of Columbus  Ohio  for 35 year  In 2008  she came out to her crew a transgender While some in the department grumbled  Moore said both her chief and union president were fully supportive  and two year after she retired in 2016  she wa inducted into the city s hall of fame That s why it pain her to know Ohio lawmaker   for whom  she said  she would have laid down her life a a firefighter   last month overrode Gov  Mike DeWine s veto of HB 68  a bill banning gender affirming care for young people and preventing transgender girl and woman from competing in female high school and college sport  And they re still mulling a slate of bill that would restrict transgender right and visibility  It s frightening   Moore said   It feel like I ve been betrayed  They ve identified a small minority of people they can stereotype and scapegoat  I m not a historian  but I paid attention in history class  and it s not hard to recognize what s happening here  As Republican lawmaker nationwide continue to introduce bill targeting the LGBTQ  community   and specifically transgender people   at rate on par with last year s record number  Moore and community advocate fear a rising tide of hostile rhetoric is designed to ultimately erase them from public life This week  Florida official revoked transgender resident  ability to update gender marker on driver s license and ID card  Utah passed a bill banning transgender people from bathroom corresponding to their gender identity  and Texas  attorney general pressed a clinic in Georgia for medical record of transgender young people who used telehealth to obtain gender affirming care there  It ha progressively gotten worse The Human Rights Campaign  among the country s largest LGBTQ  civil right group  said 130 bill targeting transgender right had been filed nationwide in 2024  compared with roughly 225 last year  Overall  the group said  325 anti LGBTQ  bill had been proposed in 2024 a of Jan  25  compared with 503 in all of 2023  For year  transgender people have warned of radical anti LGBTQ  force  true aim  to abuse governmental power to take away our freedom and drive trans people out of public society   said Kelley Robinson  the organization s president  in a statement decrying what she called a  sinister agenda   They want to humiliate  harass and use policy to eliminate transgender people from public life   she said Last week  Michigan news outlet Mlive com reported Republicans in the Michigan and Ohio legislature described banning access to gender affirming care for adult a well a young people a the  endgame  in a conversation on the social medium platform X Siobhan Boyd Nelson  co interim executive director of Equality Ohio  said the group wa  profoundly disappointed  in Ohio  lawmaker  unwillingness to listen to medical professional  young people and their family      There s absolutely no reason for government overreach into the personal medical decision of Ohioans   It ha progressively gotten worse  and we know that Ohio is not alone   Boyd Nelson said   We re seeing it happen across the country  and we think people should be very concerned about what appears to be an obsession with marginalizing and harming an already marginalized community  Anti equality bill outnumber those in supportWhen Moore grew up in the 1970s  she didn t know the term  transgender   not until she saw transgender actress and activist Christine Jorgensen on a talk show did she realize she wasn t the only person who felt a she did  I took an oath a a civil servant  and I took it seriously   Moore said   That didn t end when I retired  But it look like they ve  Republican lawmaker  taken an oath to a political party  According to health policy research organization KFF  23 state have enacted law or policy limiting youth access to gender affirming care a of Jan  31  while 21 state have law or policy imposing professional or legal penalty on health care practitioner who provide minor with such care Gender affirming care includes using hormone to delay puberty and support physical development aligning with a youth s identity  and ha been endorsed by major health group  including the American Medical Association and the American Academy of Pediatrics  Proponents of law prohibiting such care say the ban are intended to protect youth from making life altering decision at a young age  Families should never fear losing custody of their child for not consenting to superstitious gender ideology   Ohio state Rep  Gary Click  sponsor of HB 68  in a news release In his veto of that bill  Gov  DeWine said that should the bill become law   Ohio would be saying that the state  that the government know better what is medically best for a child than the two people who love that child the most  their parent  According to the Human Rights Campaign s 2023 State Equality Index  more than 253 pro equality bill were introduced nationwide last year  50 of them were signed into law In contrast  the campaign tallied 571 anti equality bill in 2023  with 77 of them becoming law The campaign gave 20 state and Washington it highest rating   working toward innovative equality    and another five were characterized a  solidifying equality   the index s next highest ranking But 23 other state  most of them in the South  were deemed  high priority to achieve basic equality   the list s lowest rating  States are trying to rewrite law to exclude LGBTQ  people from sex based protection  and they are continuing to try to erase LGBTQ  people from history  from the classroom  from artistic performance  and from sport   the report read  Other people are defining u Florida is among the state in the campaign s lowest rated category  In addition to revoking the ability of transgender people to change the listed gender on their driver s license  the state ha passed law restricting transgender people from using bathroom corresponding to their gender identity in public school and place  transgender youth participation in sport  gender affirming care for transgender young people and inclusion of LGBTQ  topic in school  The DeSantis administration s obsession with scapegoating transgender Floridians ha escalated into an outrageous attack that further erodes freedom and liberty in our state   said Nadine Smith  executive director of Equality Florida  in a statement   These reckless and hateful policy are intended to make the transgender community feel unsafe and unwelcome in Florida and to bully them out of public life entirely   Alaina Kupec  president of transgender advocacy group Gender Research Advisory Council   Education  or GRACE  said transgender people provide a  politically opportunistic  group for candidate to prey on  She started the organization out of exasperation over the rhetoric influencing public perception of the trans community  Nobody wa really changing the narrative being put out by hate group telling outright lie about transgender people and our life and the care that we get   Kupec said   I thought  maybe I should be challenging these five alarm fire we re seeing across the country    Other people are defining u instead of u defining ourselves  Through GRACE  Kupec help trans advocacy group around the country get their message out while providing them with research and data on issue like gender affirming care  We have a world where the left is shouting at the right and the right is shouting at the left   she said   We want to find that movable middle and appeal to their value and not have them see u a the enemy or the woke left  People have tried to portray these issue a partisan  and they re not  Climate prompt fear for personal safetyKupec and others say some politician have seized on transgender issue a a mean of distraction  trying to make up for lost vote over abortion right  This is purely political theater designed to capture attention   she said  noting a federal judge last year struck down a 2021 Arkansas law banning gender affirming care for trans youth  calling it unconstitutional and motivated by ideology   At the end of the day  the court are going to knock these thing down  because the medical evidence is overwhelming  Boyd Nelson  of Equality Ohio  said that while some politician might fixate on these issue to score point with their constituency  she wonder at what cost  Lives are at stake  and that s title: Largest survey transgender people US reveals key insight time trans right attack
summary: Results from the largest survey of transgender people in the United States were released Wednesday  revealing key insight into their life and experience at a time when trans right have increasingly come under attack

transgender people in the US reveals key insight at a time when trans right are under attack By Chandelis Duster  CNN 4 minute read Updated 2 47 PM EST  Wed February 7  2024 Link Copied  Follow  LGBTQ issue See all topic The 2022 US Transgender Survey offer insight into the life and experience of transgender Americans  Demetrius Freeman Reuters Story highlight Majority of those who transitioned said they were satisfied with life Some reported moving state because of law targeting transgender people Still  jobless rate among respondent wa nearly 5 time national average Nearly a quarter said they avoided seeing a doctor out of fear of mistreatment CNN   Results from the largest survey of transgender people in the United States were released Wednesday  revealing key insight into their life and experience at a time when trans right have increasingly come under attack  The 2022 US Transgender Survey Early Insights report  conducted by the National Center for Transgender Equality  polled an  unprecedented  92 329 binary and nonbinary transgender people age 16 and older living in the US  it territory or military base  according to the report  Respondents were surveyed on issue including their family life  health care  employment  education  housing and public accommodation  While many transgender people surveyed who have transitioned said they were satisfied with their life  the report also noted transgender people continue to face disparity and discrimination across the country  Rodrigo Heng Lehtinen  executive director of NCTE  said there should be state and federal law to ensure that everyone   including transgender people   is treated fairly   So often  transgender people are talked about  like we re a political football  or mysterious   he said   Now  we finally have concrete fact  we actually have some data to show what being transgender in America is really like and that is essential because these attack against our community are coming from misinformation and a lack of understanding of who we really are   Life after transitioning The survey found the majority of people who transitioned gender said they were satisfied with their life  Ninety four percent of respondent who lived at least some of the time in a different gender than the one they were assigned at birth reported being  a lot more satisfied  or  a little more satisfied  with their life  with 79  expressing the highest level of satisfaction   according to the report  Only three percent of people surveyed indicated they were  a little le satisfied   1   or  a lot le satisfied   2    the report found  What s more   nearly all  respondent who said they were receiving hormone treatment at the time of the survey   98    said receiving hormone for their gender identity transition increased satisfaction with their life  Eighty four percent of respondent said they were  a lot more satisfied  while receiving hormone treatment and 14  of respondent said they were  a little more satisfied   Less than 1  of people surveyed said receiving the hormone made them le satisfied with their life  Discrimination and mistreatment The report s finding come a multiple state have passed law restricting or banning gender affirming care  Forty percent of people surveyed said they considered moving because they experienced discrimination or unequal treatment where they were living  and 10  said they had already moved because of discrimination  Maya Stanton  12  and her mother Lisa are photographed at their Colorado home on January 26  2024  Laura Oliverio CNN Related article Anguish lingers a transgender kid  family seek medical care outside Texas   and fight a state ban Respondents also reported moving from state like Florida  Virginia  Texas  and North Carolina because of law targeting transgender people for unequal treatment  More than a third  39   of respondent said they were harassed online because of their gender expression or identity in the previous 12 month  and 30  reported being verbally harassed during the same time frame  The report also revealed finding that suggest the ongoing culture war over transgender right ha impacted student  Nearly 60  of respondent age 16 to 17 who are out or perceived a transgender in grade K 12 said they experienced mistreatment or a negative experience  including verbal harassment  physical attack  online bullying  being denied the ability to dress according to their gender identity expression  teacher or staff refusing to use chosen name or pronoun  or being denied the use of restroom or locker room matching their gender identity   A majority of respondent of all age  62   also said they were  very uncomfortable  or  somewhat uncomfortable  asking police for help when needed because of their gender expression or identity   This data is crucial to really show an accurate picture of transgender people s experience   Heng Lehtinen said   There are rising attack against transgender people these day  both in term of hostile policy  meaning anti transgender bill moving through state legislature  and in term of physical attack   people actually being hurt and even killed because they happen to be transgender   Health and safety When asked about their health care experience  nearly half of respondent  48   who had seen a provider in the past 12 month said they had at least one negative experience because they were transgender  according to the report  Texas state Attorney General Ken Paxton ha made request in at least two state for the private medical record of transgender youth  Eric Gay AP FILE Related article Texas attorney general target Georgia clinic in another attempt to obtain private medical record of transgender youth Some of those experience reported included   being refused health care  being misgendered  having a provider use harsh or abusive language when treating them  or having a provider be physically rough or abusive when treating them   Nearly a quarter of respondent said they avoided seeing a doctor in the previous year when they needed to out of fear of mistreatment  while 28  said they did not go to the doctor during that timeframe because of cost  The report also found that the unemployment rate among respondent wa nearly five time the national average  18   The 2022 US Trans Survey is a follow up to the 2015 US Trans Survey  which included more than 27 700 respondent across the US  it territory and it military base  The 2022 survey wa conducted online in Spanish and English by the NCTE in conjunction with the Black Trans Advocacy Coalition  National Queer Asian Pacific Islander Alliance  and TransLatin  Coalition  Participants were surveyed from October 19 through December 5  2022  and the majority of respondent   84 170   were age 18 and older  CNN s Scottie Andrew and Nicole Chavez contributed to this report  Related Ad Feedback Ad Feedback Ad Feedback Ad Feedback Search Log In My Account Settings Topics You title: Rishi Sunak face call apologise trans jibe PMQs
summary: The PM ridiculed Sir Keir Starmer s  definition of a woman  a Brianna Ghey s wa visiting Parliament
source_text: Sunak face call to apologise over trans jibe to Starmer at PMQsBy Sam Francis   Henry ZeffmanBBC PoliticsWatch  Sunak make trans jibe to Starmer at PMQsRishi Sunak is facing call to apologise after joking about Labour s position on trans people when the mum of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey   who wa transgender   wa in Parliament  During Prime Minister s Questions  Mr Sunak ridiculed Sir Keir Starmer for U turning on  defining a woman  No 10 said it wa  legitimate  to question the Labour leader s position But Brianna s father  who is among those calling for an apology  said the PM s comment wa  degrading  Teach mindfulness in school  say Brianna s mumMP back Brianna Ghey mum s social medium callHer father  Peter Spooner  told Sky News   As the prime minister for our country to come out with degrading comment like he did  regardless of them being in relation to discussion in Parliament  they are absolutely dehumanising  Identities of people should not be used in that manner  and I personally feel shocked by his comment and feel he should apologise for his remark  Brianna s family are being invited to a meeting about online safety with the prime minister and Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan  the BBC ha been told At PMQs  Mr Sunak listed what he described a a number of Labour U turn  accusing Sir Keir of changing his position on  defining a woman    Although in fairness  that wa only 99  of a U turn   he added  Sir Keir hit back  saying   Of all the week to say that  when Brianna s mother is in this chamber  Shame  Parading a a man of integrity when he s got absolutely no responsibility  Brianna s mother Esther wa not in the public gallery for the exchange but entered shortly afterwards Later  Mr Sunak ignored a call from Labour MP Liz Twist to  apologise to Brianna Ghey s mother  But at the end of the session the prime minister said Ms Ghey represented  the very best of humanity  for the  compassion  she showed after her 16 year old daughter wa murdered by two teenager who had a fascination with violence He added that the murder  wa an unspeakable and shocking tragedy  A spokeswoman for Sir Keir said   We don t think the country want or deserves a prime minister who is happy to use minority a a punch bag  The comment were deeply offensive to trans people  He should reflect on his response there and apologise  Chancellor questioned on whether PM made trans joke at PMQsMinister for Women and Equalities Kemi Badenoch said it wa  shameful  of Sir Keir  to link his own inability to be clear on the matter of sex and gender  to Ms Ghey s grief   Every murder is a tragedy  None should be trivialised by political point scoring   the Tory MP wrote on X  Chancellor Jeremy Hunt denied Mr Sunak had made a minority group  a punchline for a joke  and declined to say whether he thought the PM should apologise   The prime minister could not have been clearer about the enormous respect that he ha for Brianna Ghey s mother   he told the BBC   What he wa saying is that on the really important issue of the day Labour and Sir Keir Starmer simply cannot make up  their  mind  However  some Conservative MPs criticised the prime minister s comment  Dehenna Davison said it wa  disappointing to hear joke being made at the trans community s expense    As politician  it s our job to take the heat out of such debate and focus on finding sensible way forward  whilst ensuring those involved are treated with respect   the MP for Bishop Auckland wrote on X  Jamie Wallis  who wa the first MP to say publicly that he had gender dysphoria and is in the process of transitioning  said   I know from from my own interaction with the prime minister that today s display of insensitivity must have been inadvertent   Today ha been a tough day for me  but all I can think about right now is Brianna s mother  Let u all think of her a we choose how to progress with this debate  Another Tory MP  Elliot Colburn  said what happened during PMQs wa  disappointing    I d rather every politician stopped using trans issue a an electoral issue   he told BBC Radio 4 s PM programme    Trans people  have never asked to be part of this very toxic conversation  so we need to stop it  Family handoutBrianna Ghey s mother Esther is calling for mindfulness to be part of the school curriculum to teach child to be more empatheticMs Ghey wa in the Houses of Parliament to attend a debate on mindfulness in school  organised by her local MP Charlotte Nichols She also met Sir Keir after Prime Minister s Questions  Mr Sunak had been told Ms Ghey wa in the public gallery watching

title: Pierre Poilievre say minor access puberty blocker
summary: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Wednesday he doe not support trans kid taking puberty blocker   medicine that are used to pause puberty before a possible gender transition or other intervention  like hormone therapy
source_text: Pierre Poilievre say minor should not have access to puberty blocker   CBC News LoadedPoliticsPierre Poilievre say minor should not have access to puberty blockersConservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Wednesday he doe not support trans kid taking puberty blocker   medicine that are used to pause puberty before a possible gender transition or other intervention  like hormone therapy  I think we should protect child   Conservative leader saysJohn Paul Tasker   CBC News   Posted  Feb 07  2024 11 47 AM EST   Last Updated  February 13Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre arrives to a caucus meeting on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Wednesday  Feb  7  2024   Sean Kilpatrick Canadian Press Social SharingConservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Wednesday he doe not support trans kid taking puberty blocker   medicine that are used to pause puberty before a possible gender transition or other intervention  like hormone therapy Speaking to reporter on Parliament Hill before a Conservative caucus meeting  Poilievre said the decision to pursue transgender treatment should be reserved to adult alone  Puberty blocker for minor  I think we should protect child and their ability to make adult decision when they re adult   Poilievre said  I think we should protect the right of parent to make their own decision with regard to their child  Asked to state definitively if he s opposed to puberty blocker for people under the age of 18  Poilievre said he is Pierre Poilievre defends Alberta Premier Smith on transgender policiesThat s a step further than what Alberta Premier Danielle Smith ha proposed in her province Smith  who announced a series of transgender policy last week  ha pitched restriction on puberty blocker and hormone therapy for child 15 and under Prime Minister Justin Trudeau ha condemned what he describes a Smith s  anti LGBT  policy  which he said could lead to mental health trouble and an increase in suicidal thought among teen  The fact that Premier Smith and Pierre Poilievre want government to take away the option for parent and their vulnerable youth   in consultation with their doctor   to make the right decision for them is anchored in ideology and is not about protecting the most vulnerable   Trudeau told reporter Wednesday Puberty blocker   hormone suppressing agent that pause the progression of puberty   are typically prescribed to people in the early stage of puberty to halt unwanted physical change  such a breast development or facial hair They are prescribed to child only after consultation with a doctor They may sometimes be combined with hormone therapy  which can have long term  irreversible effect WATCH   Poilievre say he s against puberty blocker for transgender child Poilievre opposes puberty blocker for people people under 189 day agoDuration 2 04Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre say he doe not support puberty blocker for minor  His comment come after Alberta s government proposed restricting the medical treatment for child under 15 The Canadian Pediatric Society  CPS  ha said that  gender affirming medical intervention may be an important component of comprehensive care  for some transgender or gender diverse adolescent The CPS  citing scientific research  ha said access to puberty blocker  ha been associated with lower odds of suicidal ideation over the life course  It ha said these drug should not be prescribed before the onset of puberty for medical reason   and also because the puberty process is  an important experience through which young people may develop clearer understanding of their gender identity  Cross sex hormone therapy is a treatment used by trans people to transition and to look physically more like the gender with which they identify Trans men  for example  can take testosterone to help deepen their voice  increase muscle mass and promote body and facial hair Trans woman sometimes use estrogen to increase breast size  reduce male pattern baldness and reduce testicle size The CPS say hormone therapy produce both reversible and irreversible change and should only be provided to young people who  demonstrate the capacity to understand and appreciate both the benefit and risk of these medication  given their profound effect  Poilievre said he think adult with gender dysphoria should  have the freedom to make any decision they want about their body  While the national conversation about trans care wa prompted by Smith s policy announcement  Poilievre said Trudeau is to blame for whipping up the public and the medium Danielle Smith  Liberals trade shot over transgender policy during her trip to OttawaFederal justice minister accuses Alberta Premier Danielle Smith of  demonizing  trans kidsPoilievre called trans health care  a divisive wedge  that s being used by the Liberal government to  distract from doubling housing cost and quadrupling carbon tax   Justin Trudeau is puffing out his chest  trying to divide Canadians and attack parent who are trying to protect their kid   he said Employment  Workforce Development and Official Languages Minister Randy Boissonnault listens to a question a he speaks with reporter in the Foyer of the House of Commons  Monday  February 5  2024 in Ottawa   Adrian Wyld Canadian Press Employment Minister Randy Boissonnault  a gay man who ha become a vocal critic of Smith s plan  ha spoken out about Alberta s push to demand that some trans kid get parental consent before using their preferred name and pronoun at school Boissonnault told reporter Wednesday that neither Poilievre nor Smith should have a say in who should have access to certain treatment  That s a conversation that should take place between a young person and their doctor   he said   I don t see MD after Pierre Poilievre s name or Danielle Smith s  so  it s  not their business  NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh accused Poilievre and Smith of  attacking vulnerable community   It should be a decision between a person and their health care provider     not based on the opinion of Pierre Poilievre   Singh told reporter Wednesday ABOUT THE AUTHORJohn Paul TaskerSenior reporterJ P  Tasker is Poilievre came out against treating young people with puberty blocker   a position that prompted a broadside from Prime Minister Justin Trudeau  Stephanie Taylor  The Canadian Press Feb 7  2024 4 15 PM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre talk to medium at a party caucus meeting on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Wednesday  Feb 7  2024  THE CANADIAN PRESS Sean Kilpatrick OTTAWA   The political battle line over gender identity came into sharper focus Wednesday a Pierre Poilievre came out against treating young people with puberty blocker   a position that prompted a broadside from Prime Minister Justin Trudeau  The Conservative leader want to take away the right of parent and kid alike  Trudeau said after Poilievre finally clarified his stance on the controversial course of gender affirming therapy  Transgender child are much more likely to attempt suicide  Trudeau said  and government should not be contemplating way to take away their medical option  The prime minister also took a swipe at Alberta Premier Danielle Smith  who announced plan last week to ban puberty blocker and hormone therapy for child 15 and younger who have not already begun such treatment  Taking those option away from family and their doctor  is anchored in ideology and is not about protecting the most vulnerable   Trudeau said before question period   Our government will do whatever it take to protect the most vulnerable   Puberty blocker  a they re known  are used to prevent the body from producing the sex hormone that fuel both male and female development  The Alberta Medical Association ha released statement voicing concern over Smith s policy  saying transgender and gender diverse youth who lack access to such care face an increased risk of depression and suicide  Smith also proposes rule that would require parental consent for kid 15 and under who want to go by a different name or pronoun at school  Teens aged 16 and 17 would be able to make such change without permission  but school would have to notify their guardian  The proposal have spurred protest in Alberta and Ottawa and drawn condemnation from Liberal politician including Trudeau  who accuse Smith of pushing an anti LGBTQ  agenda  The proposition also triggered a barrage of medium question for Poilievre this week about his view on gender affirming medical treatment for transgender youth  Asked directly on Wednesday whether he opposes the use of puberty blocker for gender diverse youth under the age of 18  Poilevre said   Yes    We should protect child and their ability to make adult decision when they re adult   he said  For month  the federal Conservative leader ha said he support the right of parent to raise their child a they wish  and urged Trudeau to  butt out  of provincial decision about school and hospital  New Brunswick Premier Blaine Higgs wa the first provincial leader to change the notification policy in school for gender diverse child wishing to go by a different name or pronoun  Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe followed his lead last fall  Poilievre said it s the prime minister who is attacking family who are trying to protect their kid   He will  in the end  back down on this   he said   I think we should protect the right of parent to make their own decision with regard to their child  and I believe that adult should have the freedom to make any decision they want about their body   Liberal cabinet minister Randy Boissonnault  an openly gay MP who represents an Edmonton riding  paused before the party s weekly caucus meeting Wednesday to deride Poilievre s position  The decision to use puberty blocker should be based on a conversation between a young person and their doctor  Boissonnault said   I don t see M D  after Pierre Poilievre s name or Danielle Smith s   he said   So  not their business   NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh struck a similar tone  saying health care decision should involve an individual and their doctor   Based on evidence  based on science  based on best practice and not based on the opinion of Pierre Poilievre   The Canadian Paediatric Society recommended in a position statement last summer that health care provider should adopt an affirming approach to care for all child and youth and advocate for  timely access to specialized gender related care   The recommendation included ensuring that provider be sufficiently familiar with gender affirming hormone therapy to discus benefit and risk of that kind of intervention or ensure timely referral to people who can offer that advice  The executive director of Egale Canada  an LGBTQ  advocacy organization  said Poilievre and Smith are  playing politics with some of the most vulnerable member of our society   Helen Kennedy said in a written statement that the policy position run counter to expert guidance  violate the constitutional right of LGBTQ  people and  will lead to irreparable harm and suffering   Since becoming leader  Poilievre ha tried to keep his party focused on cost of living issue and crime   two area the party see a core to a winning strategy  Some of his supporter  however  have pressed him to veer further into the debate around how school handle issue of gender diversity and sexual orientation among their student  At last year s policy convention title: Students stage walkout oppose Alberta gender identity policy child youth
summary: Hundreds of student staged classroom walkout on Wednesday morning to protest the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth
source_text: Students stage walkout to oppose Alberta s gender identity policy for child and youth   CBC News LoadedEdmontonStudents stage walkout to oppose Alberta s gender identity policy for child and youthHundreds of student staged classroom walkout on Wednesday morning to protest the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth Young people walked out of class in Edmonton  Leduc Wednesday morningWallis Snowdon   for CBC News   Posted  Feb 07  2024 12 20 PM EST   Last Updated  February 7Students across the province staged walkout Wednesday morning to protest against proposed change to a swath of gender identity policy in Alberta   Rick Bremness CBC Social SharingHundreds of Alberta student staged classroom walkout Wednesday to protest the provincial government s planned policy around transgender youth At 10 a m   student left their classroom and staged demonstration calling for the province to reverse course on sweeping gender identity policy announced last week by Premier Danielle Smith About 200 student walked out of class at Victoria School in central Edmonton and stood in protest outside the entry door  Outside the south side Strathcona High School  another 60 student gathered  the crowd dotted with sign and Pride flag Achilles Chinery  17  who helped organize the walkout at Victoria School  said it wa heartwarming to see the protest and to know that student at other Alberta school were staging their own protest He said he is skeptical that government will listen to the concern of protester but hope the walkout show transgender youth they have strong ally  I honestly don t how much of a difference it will make to Danielle Smith but I do know it will make a difference to the people who are scared and worried right now   he said Achilles Chinery  17  who helped organize the walkout at Victoria School  said the walkout were meant to send a message to government   Rick Bremness CBC The walkout are the latest in a string of demonstration decrying the proposed policy  Smith s announcement ha spurred several protest   both at the grassroots level and from group like the Alberta Medical Association Smith say her United Conservative Party government will introduce legislation this fall to bring in new rule  including restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school and getting hormone therapy or gender affirming surgery Danielle Smith unveils sweeping change to Alberta s student gender identity  sport and surgery policiesFederal justice minister accuses Alberta Premier Danielle Smith of  demonizing  trans kidsShe say the policy are to ensure child are  fully informed  about the decision they are making because they might regret them later in life Rae Canavan Lebeuf  who helped organize the Strathcona School demonstration  said she fear what the policy will mean for the future of all 2SLGBTQ  Albertans  Not only is this bill going to affect trans kid  it s going to affect everyone   she said   If it s passed  it open a gateway to more bill and more right being restricted  It s frustrating to have to fight for right that we already have  Coral Boivin went to the demonstration at Victoria School to support her three child   Rick Bremness CBC Sixteen year old Aspen Cervo  a student at Leduc Composite High School in Leduc  35 kilometre south of Edmonton  said he began thinking about planning a student walkout right after Smith announced the policy last week The Grade 10 student said his 13 year old brother is transgender and the demonstration are meant to show him and others they re supported  About 30 student from Leduc Composite took part in the protest  I m lucky to grow up in a household where it s safe to be whoever I want to be  but not all kid are lucky like that   Cervo said  Some get rejected or kicked out  and it really hurt you when your own parent basically tell you you re not their kid anymore  Alberta premier say legislation on gender policy for child  youth coming this fallAnalysisDanielle Smith bid to transcend politics with Canada s toughest trans youth rulesCervo say he used to be transgender but now considers himself gender fluid  He say he go by  he   mostly  but it sometimes change Asked whether his fluidity could support argument that youth who receive gender affirming care could later change their mind  Cervo pointed out that no one in Alberta is getting genital reconstruction surgery before 18 because it s such a big change Other type of gender affirming care  such a hormone therapy that his brother ha been waiting for to change his voice  are decision that Cervo feel his brother and others his age are old enough to make for themselves  He s been waiting for gender affirming care for two year now and these policy are going to have to make him wait until he s at least 16   Cervo said  He s been waiting for so long and now he s going to have to wait longer  High school student Aspen Cervo say he began thinking about a student walkout over the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth right after Premier Danielle Smith announced them last week  Cervo  16  pose for a portrait at Leduc Composite High School  in Leduc  Alta   Jason Franson The Canadian Press Smith ha said gender affirming surgery would be banned for those 17 and under  And there would be no puberty blocker or hormone therapy for the purpose of gender affirmation for anyone 15 and under  unless they ve already begun such treatment Parental consent would be required for student 15 and under who want to change their name or pronoun at school  Students 16 and 17 would not need consent  but their parent would have to be notified WATCH   Hundreds of transgender ally gather to protest  Hundreds protest Alberta s new gender identity policies12 day agoDuration 2 09Hundreds of people gathered outside Alberta s legislature to push back against recently announced plan to make sweeping change to some of the province s policy around transgender youth Smith  in defending her proposal during a trip to Ottawa on Monday  said there is no  single voice  that can speak on behalf of the entire transgender community  She said she ha spoken to some transgender people who expressed concern about the ability of child to transition at a young age  We had to have a conversation about what is the appropriate age to be able to make those life altering decision   she said Coral Boivin attended the walkout at Victoria School in support of her three child  who took part in the demonstration She said it s important for Alberta s youth to speak out  and for the government to listen  The kid here are all really passionate about LGBTQ right and ensuring that this world is going to be a safe place for them when they grow up   she said   I think that it s really important for youth to take a stand against what the province is deciding  The more walkout there are  it s going to show that kid have an opinion too  and that it matter  and that they re our future  Transgender ally gather in Calgary and Edmonton to rally against proposed government policiesPierre Poilievre defends Alberta Premier Smith on transgender title: Teens plan class walkout Wednesday oppose Alberta gender identity policy
summary: LEDUC  Alta    Sixteen year old Aspen Cervo say he began thinking about a student walkout over the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth right after Premier Danielle Smith announced them last week
source_text: Alberta News  Worried for the safety of youth   Teens stage walkout over Alberta gender policy Sixteen year old Aspen Cervo say he began thinking about a student walkout over the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth right after Premier Danielle Smith announced them last week  Rob Drinkwater and Colette Derworiz  The Canadian Press Feb 7  2024 11 31 AM Share by around transgender youth right after Premier Danielle Smith announced them last week  Cervo  16  pose for a portrait at Leduc Composite High School  in Leduc  Alta   Tuesday  Feb  6  2024  THE CANADIAN PRESS Jason Franson Sixteen year old Aspen Cervo say he began thinking about a student walkout over the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth right after Premier Danielle Smith announced them last week  The Grade 10 student at Leduc Composite High School said earlier this week that his 13 year old brother is transgender and that Wednesday s walkout wa meant to show him and others they re supported   I m lucky to grow up in a household where it s safe to be whoever I want to be  but not all kid are lucky like that   Cervo told The Canadian Press in an interview  adding he know some others who aren t a fortunate   Some get rejected or kicked out  and it really hurt you when your own parent basically tell you you re not their kid anymore   Smith said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring new rule  including restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school  a well a on hormone treatment and surgery for gender affirmation  She said the goal of the policy is to ensure child are  fully informed  about the decision they are making because they might regret them later in life  The policy spurred a week of protest   both at the grassroots level and from group like the Alberta Medical Association  Students at high school in Edmonton and Calgary also walked out Wednesday  In Calgary  several dozen student from Western Canada High School carried sign with message such a  Our Outrage Does Not Fit on a Poster  and  Protect Trans Black Female Disabled Immigrant Queer Indigenous Refugee Youth   Yomade Akapo  16  said Smith s government is  taking away right from people who haven t done anything wrong   It s just a violation of human right  It s absolutely disgusting that that s something she could to do to thousand of trans kid  I don t think she understands how she s affecting these kid  how she s affecting their mental health   Fletcher Morrison  a transgender boy in Grade 11  said it s important that his and others  right are respected at their school   I just want everyone to feel safe in school   said the 16 year old who transitioned three year ago with the support of his friend and family  Morrison said he s been seeing a lot more anti transgender argument in the past week   I can see it getting worse   he said   I just am worried for the safety of youth   A few people stopped on the street in front of the high school to support the student  Kathryn Smith  a non binary trans and queer adult  work with a lot of transgender youth   I wanted to come out and show the kid there are adult who support and love them   Smith said   It s very hard to see what s happening   Back in Leduc  Cervo said he used to be transgender but now considers himself gender fluid  He said he mostly go by  he   but it sometimes change  When asked whether his fluidity could support argument that youth who receive gender affirming care could later change their mind  Cervo said that no one in Alberta is getting genital reconstruction surgery before 18 because it s such a big change  Other type of gender affirming care  such a hormone therapy that his brother ha been waiting for to change his voice  are decision that Cervo felt his brother and others his age are old enough to make for themselves   He s been waiting for gender affirming care for two year now and these policy are going to have to make him wait until he s at least 16   Cervo said   He s been waiting for so long and now he s going to have to wait longer   Smith said gender affirmation surgery would be banned for those 17 and under  And there would be no puberty blocker or hormone therapy for the purpose of gender affirmation for anyone 15 and under  unless they ve already begun such treatment  Parental consent would be required for student 15 and under who want to change their name or pronoun at school  Students 16 and 17 would not need consent  but their parent would have to be notified  Smith  in defending her proposal during a trip to Ottawa on Monday  said there is no  single voice  that can speak on behalf of the entire transgender community  She said she ha spoken to some transgender people who expressed concern about the ability of child to transition at a young age   We had to have a conversation about what is the appropriate age to be able to make those life altering decision   This report by The Canadian trans kid  I don t think she understands how she s affecting these kid  how she s affecting their mental health   Fletcher Morrison  a transgender boy in Grade 11  said it s important that his and others  right are respected at their school   I just want everyone to feel safe in school   said the 16 year old who transitioned three year ago with the support of his friend and family  Morrison said he s been seeing a lot more anti transgender argument in the past week   I can see it getting worse   he said   I just am worried for the safety of youth   A few people stopped on the street in front of the high school to support the student  Kathryn Smith  a non binary trans and queer adult  work with a lot of transgender youth   I wanted to come out and show the kid there are adult who support and love them   Smith said   It s very hard to see what s happening   Back in Leduc  Cervo said he used to be transgender but now considers himself gender fluid  He said he mostly go by  he   but it sometimes change  When asked whether his fluidity could support argument that youth who receive gender affirming care could later change their mind  Cervo said that no one in Alberta is getting genital reconstruction surgery before 18 because it s such a big change  Other type of gender affirming care  such a hormone therapy that his brother ha been waiting for to change his voice  are decision that Cervo felt his brother and others his age are old enough to make for themselves   He s been waiting for gender affirming care for two year now and these policy are going to have to make him wait until he s at least 16   Cervo said   He s been waiting for so long and now he s going to have to wait longer   Smith said gender affirmation surgery would be banned for those 17 and under  And there would be no puberty blocker or hormone therapy for the purpose of gender affirmation for anyone 15 and under  unless they ve already begun such treatment  Parental consent would be required for student 15 and under who want to change their name or pronoun at school  Students 16 and 17 would not need consent  but their parent would have to be notified  Smith  in defending her proposal during a trip to Ottawa on Monday  said there is no  single voice  that can speak on behalf of the entire transgender community  She said she ha spoken to some transgender people who expressed concern about the ability of child to transition at a young age   We had to have a conversation about what is the appropriate age to be able to make those life altering decision   This report by The Canadian title: Alberta minister say gender policy need consultation 2SLGBTQ  group
summary: An Alberta cabinet minister met with 2SLGBTQ  stakeholder in Edmonton Tuesday for the first time since Premier Danielle Smith announced a slate of policy and guideline around gender identity  gender affirmation surgery and transgender woman in sport
source_text: ContentSkip to Main ContentAccessibility HelpMenuWhen search suggestion are available use up and down arrow to review and enter to select SearchSearchSign InQuick LinksNewsSportsRadioMusicListen LiveTVWatchnewsTop StoriesLocalClimateWorldCanadaPoliticsIndigenousBusinessThe NationalHealthEntertainmentScienceCBC News InvestigatesGo PublicAbout CBC NewsBeing Black in CanadaMore Alberta minister say gender policy need more consultation with 2SLGBTQ  group   CBC News LoadedEdmontonAlberta minister say gender policy need more consultation with 2SLGBTQ  groupsAn Alberta cabinet minister met with 2SLGBTQ  stakeholder in Edmonton Tuesday for the first time since Premier Danielle Smith announced a slate of policy and guideline around gender identity  gender affirmation surgery and transgender woman in sport  I want to continue the dialogue   Tanya Fir saysAaron Sousa   CBC News   Posted  Feb 06  2024 8 49 PM EST   Last Updated  February 7Tanya Fir  Alberta s minister of art  culture and status of woman  there need to be more consultation with stakeholder from the 2SLGBTQ  community regarding Premier Danielle Smith s plan to reduce youth access to gender affirming care   Jason Franson  The Canadian Press Social SharingThere need to be more consultation with stakeholder from the 2SLGBTQ  community regarding Premier Danielle Smith s policy change affecting transgender and non binary youth  an Alberta cabinet minister said Tuesday Tanya Fir  Alberta s minister of art  culture and status of woman  met with 2SLGBTQ  community group in Edmonton on Tuesday to discus gender policy affecting transgender and non binary youth It wa the first time someone from the government had met with Edmonton stakeholder since Smith announced her government would implement a slate of policy and guideline around gender identity  gender affirmation surgery and new rule for transgender woman athlete Danielle Smith unveils sweeping change to Alberta s student gender identity  sport and surgery policiesAlberta premier say legislation on gender policy for child  youth coming this fallSpeaking to reporter Tuesday  Fir said meeting with stakeholder in Edmonton wa important  There need to be further consultation   she said   I want to continue the consultation and I want to continue the dialogue  Smith s policy proposal have drawn criticism from 2SLGBTQ  advocate  Alberta s Official Opposition and the federal Liberal government  but have been defended by parent group and federal Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre Trudeau say Premier Smith s new transgender policy target  vulnerable  youthPierre Poilievre defends Alberta Premier Smith on transgender policiesUnder the proposed guideline  gender affirming surgery would be banned for minor aged 17 and under  Puberty blocker and hormone therapy also would not be permitted for child aged 15 and under Parental notification and consent would be required for school to alter the name or pronoun of any child under age 15  Parents also would have to  opt in  their child when teacher plan to teach about gender identity  sexual orientation or sexuality Transgender woman will be banned from competing in woman s sport league Fir  who told stakeholder she support Smith s policy proposal  said the meeting had been delayed until after Smith s announcement so stakeholder in Edmonton could learn about the policy first before sharing their thought Alberta to put limit on gender affirming care for trans youth16 day agoDuration 2 07Alberta Premier Danielle Smith announced policy change that would put minimum legal age limit on surgery and hormone therapy for transgender youth  It will also require parental notification   and permission  depending on the student s age   if a student want to change their name or pronoun at school Fir said the policy and guideline are compassionate and balanced  noting Smith s commitment to bringing in counselling for family and trans youth  and recruiting medical professional skilled in gender affirming surgery to practice in Alberta  When we talk about these decision  some of these are life altering  irreversible decision that can affect reproductive health going forward   she said Fir said there would be further consultation with the ministry of health  education and sport CBC News requested comment from the province to ask what consultation would be happening and with whom In an emailed statement  Sam Blackett  press secretary for the premier s office  said the province is still in the early development stage of these policy  He said official need to engage with various stakeholder to determine exactly how they would be implemented  More information will be shared when it s available   Blackett said Premier Smith defends proposed new gender policy during Ottawa visit11 day agoDuration 2 58Alberta Premier Danielle Smith  visiting Ottawa to open a new provincial office  say her planned policy change on gender identity are part of  a debate that we have to have  Kevin Lee  press secretary for the minister of Tourism and Sport  said in an email to CBC News some policy implementation will require consultation and feedback from various stakeholder  including provincial sport organization  Minister  Joseph  Schow will work through this process  together with the premier and his cabinet colleague  with the goal of having these policy fully implemented by the end of the year   he said Advocates who participated in Tuesday s meeting  which is part of a series of consultation Fir ha been holding with 2SLGBTQ  community since last year  said they should have been consulted before Smith went public with the plan Doctors  nurse and medical group urge province to walk back plan to limit gender affirming careParents of transgender kid want Alberta government to stay out of medical decisionsKristopher Wells  Canada Research Chair for the Public Understanding of Sexual and Gender Minority Youth at MacEwan University in Edmonton  said some asked for Fir to resign  given the harm that these policy will do to young people  He told CBC News after the meeting Fir did not provide any evidence used to develop the policy  It s clear  the premier  had no consultation with her own minister because they know nothing about these policy   Wells said  The minister wa asked if she is prepared to have blood on her hand when these policy are enacted and 2SLGBTQ young people take their own life  That is what is at stake here  Transgender columnist ha mixed reaction to Alberta s policy changes14 day agoDuration 6 21Julia Malott  a transgender columnist  say she support part of Alberta Premier Danielle Smith s planned gender identity policy change but that  more nuance  is needed in some area  such a the issue of hormone therapy Wells said those in the meeting called on the provincial government to provide more access for 2SLGBTQ  health  including a small number of people who need access to gender affirming care  Cheyenne Mihko Kih w  executive director of the Edmonton 2 Spirit Society  said it seemed  a little ironic  that the province wanted to consult stakeholder after the policy had already been created Kih w said group and individual that were consulted didn t reflect the majority of the 2SLGBTQ  community  They wish the premier had been present for the meeting to hear from community member who will be most affected by her decision  If she wa an active ally of our community  then she would have been in that meeting   Kih w said Kih w said they hope the government will continue to hear the voice of the 2SLGBTQ  community  but noted a number of organization  including those serving youth  weren t invited to Tuesday s meeting   Where were the youth at this conversation  None of them were at the table   they said  We re  a adult  trying to use our voice to speak up for the youth  but we should be   allowing them to speak for themselves
