fierce advocate   Pose  actress Cecilia Gentili  who wa a well known transgender activist  died on Tuesday  Feb  6  She wa 52  Gentili s death wa announced in a statement shared on her Instagram page   Our beloved Cecilia Gentili passed away this morning to continue watching over u in spirit   the statement read   Please be gentle with each other and love one another with ferocity  We will be sharing more update about service and what is to come in the following day  At this time  we re asking for privacy  time and space to grieve   The Post ha reached out to rep for Gentili for comment  Born in Argentina  Gentili first came out in 1984  She wa a former sex worker who admitted to living in the US  undocumented  for ten year  She received asylum in the United States in 2012  Afterward  she wa inspired to help others with similar past  causing her to fight for the right of undocumented immigrant  sex worker and the LGBTQIA  community  4 Cecilia Gentili speaks at a press conference about safe consumption space  supervised injection facility  on April 5  2018  at the step of City Hall  Activists carried  End Overdose NY  banner  LightRocket via Getty Images Gentili served a the director of policy at GMHC  the world s first and leading provider of HIV AIDS prevention  care and advocacy from 2016 to 2019  In 2019  she founded Trans Equity Consulting  which  wa committed to building the leadership of trans woman of color  and to the centering of sex worker  immigrant and incarcerated people a expert in creating a more just world   She then co founded Transmissions Fest  the first all trans music festival in New York City  which wa held on June 21  2022  Proceeds benefitted multiple LGBTQ  charity   We are often included in Pride event  but we re not centered   she told Them of the rationale for the event   And there s a difference   4 On the critically acclaimed FX series  Pose   which ran from 2018 to 2021  Gentili played Miss Orlando  a New York City woman who provided discounted plastic surgery  On the critically acclaimed FX series  Pose   which ran from 2018 to 2021  Gentili played Miss Orlando  a New York City woman who provided discounted plastic surgery  After news of her death wa confirmed on social medium  hundred of fan immediately reacted to the sad news   Our community will never be the same without you  Cecilia   wrote US Representative Alexandria Ocasio Cortez   Thank you for giving u so much  relentlessly  every single day  You transformed so many life and shined a light across Jackson Heights  Corona and beyond   Her  Pose  co star  Tobago trans model Dominique Jackson  posted a tribute on Tuesday  sharing that she wa  deeply saddened  by Gentili s passing  4 Cecilia Gentili attends an after party for HBO Documentary Films  the Stroll at Whitney Museum on June 5  2023  in New York City  Getty Images for HBO  I am deeply saddened by your departure dear sister   she wrote   Even in death you are force to be reckoned with  your legacy one of movement  love and compassion unapologetic and true  I thank you dearly for ALL the work you have done  You sacrificed you boldly telling your truth and living it and for that you have changed and influenced many life and the world  I LOVE YOU FOREVER BEAUTIFUL STRONG SISTER  REST WELL   Angelica Ross   Pose  actress and founder and CEO of TransTech Social Enterprises  a firm that help employ transgender people in the tech industry  also commented on Gentili s passing saying   Such a fierce advocate  Rest in Power   Drag performer Chiquitita also paid tribute and posted a video of the pair onstage together  writing   I will honor your name for the rest of my life  Thank you for everything  Thank you for being a mother to me   4 On the critically acclaimed FX series  which ran from 2018 to 2021  Gentili played Miss Orlando  a New York City woman who provided discounted plastic surgery  Instagram    ceciliagentili72 In addition to being an actress and activist  Gentili wa an author and she published  Faltas  Letters to Everyone in My Hometown Who Isn t My Rapist  in 2022   I love telling story   she told Them in an interview   I ve been telling the same story for 10 fucking year  right  But my story are always different  Depending on where I am  how I feel  who s listening  I tell the story differently  If I feel like people need a little bit of compassion  I can put compassion in my story  If I feel like people need to hear the hard truth  I can be hardcore  With the book  you lose that  There is only one way and it s on paper  So when I started writing these story  I hated it    But then it wa like  What about if I write a letter  It wa Cat  Fitzpatrick  of LittlePuss Press  who taught me that  What if the story are part of a letter  And it wa such a beautiful discovery   she added   Because then the story is not about the story  It s the message you want to translate to that person   In 2023  the book won the American Library title: Cecilia Gentili   Pose  Actor LGBTQ  Rights Advocate  Dead 52
summary: The news prompted an outpouring of tribute to the legendary activist

EntertainmentLGBTQDeathPoseCecilia Gentili   Pose  Actor And LGBTQ  Rights Advocate  Dead At 52The news prompted an outpouring of tribute to the legendary activist By Curtis M  WongSenior Culture Reporter  HuffPostFeb 7  2024  06 14 PM ESTLEAVE A COMMENTLOADINGERROR LOADINGCecilia Gentili  a renowned LGBTQ  right advocate  author and actor best known for her portrayal of Miss Orlando on  Pose   ha died  She wa 52  Gentili s death wa confirmed in a post shared on her Instagram account late Tuesday  Our beloved Cecilia Gentili passed away this morning to continue watching over u in spirit   the post read   Please be gentle with each other and love one another with ferocity  Advertisement A cause of death wa not announced The news prompted an outpouring of tribute from elected official a well a fellow advocate  New York s LGBTQ  community ha lost a champion in trans icon Cecilia Gentili   New York Gov  Kathy Hochul  D  wrote on X  formerly Twitter   As an artist and steadfast activist in the trans right movement  she helped countless people find love  joy  and acceptance  Our heart are with her loved one in this difficult time   At the time of Cecilia Gentili s death  the LGBTQ  right advocate  author and actor had been planning to return to the New York stage Slaven Vlasic via Getty ImagesGLAAD CEO and President Sarah Kate Ellis expressed similar sentiment  Cecilia Gentili s death is such a huge loss   she wrote   She impacted so many  especially those in the trans community in New York City and beyond  This is the power of one person who used her identity and gift to help more people be seen and heard  In an Instagram post  actor Dominique Jackson referred to her  Pose  co star a a  dear sister  and a  force to be reckoned with   Advertisement  You sacrificed you boldly telling your truth and living it and for that you have changed and influenced many life and the world   she added  Gentili  who wa born in Argentina  relocated to the U S  at age 26 in hope of being able to safely live her truth a a transgender woman  residing first in Florida and later New York  She supported herself largely though sex work A brief stint in jail on drug possession charge convinced Gentili to focus on recovery and pursue a career in public health  After working with Apicha Community Health Center and GMHC  formerly the Gay Men s Health Crisis   she founded Trans Equity Consulting  an advocacy group focused on developing LGBTQ affirming service in the workplace  in 2019  In 2021  she unveiled Cecilia s Occupational Inclusion Network  which provides free health care for sex worker  through a partnership with Callen Lorde Community Health Center   I never want to judge my work by how  radical  I am  But I do judge it on what I m doing for my people and for myself   wrote Gentili  seen here in 2019 Erik McGregor via Getty ImagesAfter appearing in four episode of  Pose  from 2018 to 2021  Gentili began devoting more time to artistic pursuit  In 2022  she published  Faltas  Letters to Everyone in My Hometown Who Isn t My Rapist   a memoir of her early year  This April  she planned to return to the stage for an encore presentation of  Red Ink   an autobiographical one woman show that debuted last year in New York Advertisement In an essay for the 2023 anthology  Surviving Transphobia   Gentili shrugged off the label of  radical  for her life s work  I say this to trans people  trans woman of color  and to trans woman of color who are undocumented or sex worker or both  people like me  Do what you can to achieve whatever level of empowerment you can get  but also be safe   she wrote   I ll probably never call myself radical  especially in two country with such high rate of trans femicide and history of coup   I never want to judge my work by how  radical  I am   she added   But I do judge it on what I m doing for my people and for myself  Support HuffPostOur 2024 Coverage Needs YouAt HuffPost  we believe that everyone need high quality beloved Cecilia Gentili passed away this morning to continue watching over u in spirit   her Instagram page wrote on Tuesday afternoon   Please be gentle with each other and love one another with ferocity   Gentili immigrated from Argentina to the United States to live a safer life a an openly transgender woman  She supported herself in New York City through sex work  where she wa exposed to drug abuse  and eventually became incarcerated at Rikers in 2009  All of this led to the creation of Trans Equity Consulting in 2019  an organization she founded dedicated to uplifting transwomen of color and  centering of sex worker  immigrant and incarcerated people a expert in creating a more just world   Gentili wa no stranger to the art  she starred a Miss Orlando on Pose and premiered her own one woman show  Red Ink  last year  With Trans Equity Consulting  she created TRANSMISSION  NYC s first transgender music festival  She documented the first 17 year of her life in Argentina in her memoir  Faltas  Letters to Everyone in My Hometown Who Isn t My Rapist  filled with eight letter to people who shaped her childhood  winning the Israel Fishman Nonfiction Award   Cecilia Gentili s death is such a huge loss  She impacted so many  especially those in the trans community in New York City and beyond  This is the power of one person who used her identity and gift to help more people title: South Dakota ha apologized must pay  300K transgender advocate
summary: South Dakota ha apologized and will pay  300 000 under a settlement with a transgender advocacy group that sued Gov  Kristi Noem and her health secretary  The settlement with the Transformation

leaving PSG U S  News South Dakota ha apologized and must pay  300K to transgender advocate FILE   South Dakota Republican Gov  Kristi Noem listens to Standing Rock Sioux Tribal Chairwoman Janet Alkire  unseen  during a tribal flag ceremony  Wednesday  Jan  10  2024  at the state Capitol in Pierre  S D  South Dakota ha apologized to and will pay  300 000 under a settlement with a transgender advocacy group that sued Gov  Noem and her health secretary last year after the state terminated a contract with it  Attorneys for the Transformation Project announced the settlement Monday  Feb  5  2024   AP Photo Jack Dura  File  By JACK DURA Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print South Dakota ha apologized and will pay  300 000 under a settlement with a transgender advocacy group that sued Gov  Kristi Noem and her health secretary last year after the state terminated a contract with it Attorneys for the Transformation Project announced the settlement Monday  The nonprofit sued last year after the state canceled the contract for a community health worker in December 2022  The contract included a roughly  136 000 state administered federal grant  about  39 000 of which the group received  according to it attorney The organization alleged the state s decision  wa based purely on national politics   citing Noem s statement to conservative medium outlet The Daily Signal that the state government shouldn t participate in the group s effort  The outlet had asked Noem about the group and one of it event   This settlement mark a significant milestone in our ongoing commitment to civil right advocacy   lead attorney Brendan Johnson said   We commend the resiliency of the LGBTQ community and remain committed to vigorously upholding their right   READ MORE A former South Dakota attorney general urge the state Supreme Court to let him keep his law license Noem fill 2 legislative seat after South Dakota Supreme Court opinion on legislator conflict South Dakota deputy killed on duty honored with flashing emergency light  packed stadium The apology  in a letter dated Jan  18 and signed by South Dakota Secretary of Health Melissa Magstadt  read   On behalf of the State of South Dakota  I apologize that the Transformation Project s contract wa terminated and for treating the Transformation Project differently than other organization awarded Community Health Worker contract   I want to emphasize that all South Dakotans are entitled to equal treatment under the law   regardless of their race  color  national origin  religion  disability  age  or sex  South Dakota is committed to ensuring that no person is excluded from participation in  denied the benefit of  or subject to discrimination under any program  activity  or service that it provides   she wrote Transformation Project Executive Director Susan Williams said she is glad the lawsuit is over and  it feel good to know that we won   I would say that we settled with the apology  It would have been nice to have the apology come from our governor   she said  Magstadt wa not health secretary at the time the contract wa terminated  Her predecessor announced her retirement day after the state terminated the contract  The Transformation Project had hired a community health worker before the state ended the contract The state alleged contract violation in a letter from the deputy secretary noticing the termination  The group said it had complied Spokespersons for Noem and the state Department of Health did not immediately respond to email request for comment on the settlement Transformation Project Community Health Worker Project Coordinator Jack Fonder said in a statement   I assumed the role of CHW with the intention of providing trans people in our community with the resource they require to succeed in this state  little realizing that doing so would result in my own outing a a trans man for standing up for what is right  We promise to keep up the battle for transgender right and to make sure they have access to the resource they require  Fundraising helped continue Fonder s position  Williams said  Fonder help transgender people find shelter  housing and employment  a well a support with legal paperwork and driving people to appointment  among other need  Williams said the organization would apply for future grant from the state  and she hope similar group  will feel more confident  to apply  too The nonprofit offer help for LGBTQ  people and their family  such a suicide prevention and guiding people through health care and social service  and educates about gender identity South Dakota and other Republican led state have passed law in recent year that have raised complaint about discrimination against transgender people  such a restricting school sport participation and banning gender affirming care for kid  The Associated Press is an independent global news organization Spielmann America Media via AP  Read More By DAVID CRARY Share Share Copy Link copied Email Facebook X Reddit LinkedIn Pinterest Flipboard Print NEW YORK  AP    Even a Catholic dogma continues to repudiate same sex marriage and gender transition  one of the most prominent religious order in the United States   the Jesuits   is strengthening a unique outreach program for LGBTQ  Catholics The initiative   fittingly called Outreach   wa founded two year ago by the Rev  James Martin  a Jesuit who is one of the country s most prominent advocate for greater LGBTQ  inclusion in the Catholic Church Outreach  a ministry of the Jesuit magazine America  sponsored conference in New York City in 2022 and 2023  and last year launched a multifaceted website with news  essay and information about Catholic LGBTQ  resource and event  On Tuesday  there wa another milestone for Outreach   the appointment of journalist and author Michael O Loughlin a it first executive director  O Loughlin  a former staff writer at online newspaper Crux  ha been the national correspondent at America  He is the author of a book recounting the varied way that Catholics in the U S  responded to the AIDS crisis of the 1980s and  90    Hidden Mercy  AIDS  Catholics  and the Untold Stories of Compassion in the Face of Fear   O Loughlin told The Associated Press he s excited by his new job  viewing it a a chance to expand the range of Outreach s program and the national scope of it community   It s an opportunity to highlight the way LGBT people can be Catholic and active in parish  ministry and charity   he said   There s a lot of fear about to being too public about it      I want them to realize they re not alone  O Loughlin say his current outlook evolved a he traveled to score of place around the U S  to promote his book  talking to group of LGBTQ  Catholics  and their family and friend  about how to make the church more welcoming to them  Those conversation made O Loughlin increasingly comfortable publicly identifying a a gay Catholic after year of wondering whether he should remain in the church  Its doctrine still condemns any sexual relation between gay or lesbian partner a  intrinsically disordered  The latest expansion of Outreach occurs amid a time of division within the global Catholic Church a it grapple with LGBTQ  issue  Pope Francis  a Jesuit who ha met with Martin and sent letter of support to Outreach  ha made clear he favor a more welcoming approach to LGBTQ  people  At his direction  the Vatican recently gave priest greater leeway to bless same sex couple and asserted that transgender people  in some circumstance  can be baptized However  there ha been some resistance to the pope s approach  Many conservative bishop in Africa  Europe and elsewhere said they would not implement the new policy regarding blessing  In the U S   some bishop have issued directive effectively ordering diocesan personnel not to recognize transgender people s gender identity Amid those conflicting development  Martin and other Jesuit leader are proud of Outreach s accomplishment and optimistic about it future   There seems to be deep hunger for the kind of ministry that we re doing  not only among LGBTQ Catholics  but also their family and friend   Martin said by email from Ireland  where he wa meeting last week with the the country s Catholic bishop  Pope Francis ha been very encouraging  allowing himself to be interviewed by Outreach and sending personal greeting to our conference last year   Martin added   Perhaps the most surprising support ha been from several bishop who have written for our website  a well a some top notch Catholic theologian who see the need for serious theological reflection on LGBTQ topic  Martin will remain engaged in Outreach s oversight  holding the title of founder The Rev  Brian Paulson  president of the Jesuit Conference of Canada and the United States  evoked both Jesus and the pope when asked why his order had embraced the mission of Outreach  Pope Francis ha repeatedly called leader in the Catholic church to emulate the way Jesus spent his ministry on the periphery  accompanying those who had experienced exclusion   Paulson said email   I think the work of Outreach is a response to this invitation   Paulson also said he wa impressed by Martin s  grace and patience  in responding to the often harsh criticism directed at him by some conservative Catholics There wa ample evidence of Outreach s stature at it conference last June at a branch of Fordham University in New York City  The event wa preceded by a handwritten letter of support sent to Martin by Pope Francis  extending  prayer and good wish  to the participant  It s a special grace for LGBTQ Catholics to know that the pope is praying for them   Martin said Another welcoming letter came from Cardinal Timothy Dolan  the archbishop of New York  It is the sacred duty of the Church and Her minister to reach out to those on the periphery   he wrote to the conference attendee  The keynote speaker included Fordham s president  Tania Tetlow  and the closing Mass wa celebrated by Archbishop John Wester of Santa Fe  New title: New York School District Sued Treating Girl Boy Without Mother Knowledge
summary: A New York mother is suing the Skaneateles Central School District for allegedly treating her middle school daughter a a boy without parental knowledge or consent  Jennifer Vitsaxaki took legal action on Wednesday after discovering the alleged deception  which took place during the 2020 2021 school year  The complaint  filed in the U S  District Court for the Northern District of New York  alleges that school employee concealed from the mother
source_text: York School District Sued for Treating Girl a Boy Without Mother s Knowledge Parents  not the government  have the right to direct the upbringing  education  and health care of their child Friends Read FreeStudents walk to class at Yung Wing School P S  124 in New York  on March 7  2022   Michael Loccisano Getty Images By Caden Pearson2 1 2024Updated  2 1 2024PrintX 10 00A New York mother is suing the Skaneateles Central School District for allegedly treating her middle school daughter a a boy without parental knowledge or consent Jennifer Vitsaxaki took legal action on Wednesday after discovering the alleged deception  which took place during the 2020 2021 school year The complaint  filed in the U S  District Court for the Northern District of New York  alleges that school employee concealed from the mother that they had begun to treat her daughter a a boy  including being called a masculine name and using  they  and  them  pronoun When Ms  Vitsaxaki s daughter began to exhibit anxiety and depression and became reluctant to go to school  she turned to her daughter s teacher and school official  who repeatedly told the mother they hadn t noticed anything to worry about  Those repeated reassurance concealed the truth   lawyer from Alliance Defending Freedom wrote in the complaint However  during this time  teacher and school district official were  socially transitioning  Ms  Vitsaxaki s daughter and concealing this alleged fact from her mother  at the request of a school psychologist and per district policy  according to the complaint Related StoriesAlberta to Restrict Medical Transition for Children1 31 2024Montana Governor Supports CFS Amid Case of Daughter Removed From Parents Refusing to Affirm Gender Transition1 30 2024The lawsuit argues that by  socially transitioning  the student without parental consent and concealing crucial information about her well being  the district violated Mrs  Vitsaxaki s fundamental parental right and her deeply held religious belief After a school counselor instructed staff to socially transition the girl by calling her a boy s name and using third person plural pronoun  a school psychologist who began to secretly meet with the girl without her mother s knowledge  told school staff to keep their action secret   No one informed Mrs  Vitsaxaki that the school district had made any of these decision   and taken all of these action toward her daughter   the complaint read Lawyers for Ms  Vitsaxaki stated in the complaint that the mother wa kept in the dark about her daughter s struggle with gender identity and the school official  effort to counsel her  This counseling included  sending her resource for medical transition   while the middle school girl s  mental condition got worse  The young girl resisted going to school  became anxious  and began to speak negatively about herself  Her mother became so desperate to find out what wa wrong that she took a job driving the school bus  By concealing from Mrs  Vitsaxaki this important information about her daughter  the School District betrayed Mrs  Vitsaxaki s trust  It also violated the U S  Constitution   the complaint read The lawsuit wa filed on behalf of the mother by Alliance Defending Freedom  whose senior counsel  Kate Anderson  said that the U S  Constitution grant parent the right to make decision about their child s upbringing  education  and health care  Parents  not the government  have the right to direct the upbringing  education  and health care of their child   Ms  Anderson said in a statement  Parents should be able to drop their kid off at school without fear that school staff will conceal critical information or cut them out of weighty decision with the potential for life long impact on their kid  Because school official concealed their action from Mrs  Vitsaxaki  they prevented her from helping her daughter at a time when she needed her mother s loving guidance most  Schools shouldn t hide important information from parent like Mrs  Vitsaxaki   Ms  Anderson added When Ms  Vitsaxaki confronted school official  they defended their action  citing district policy  according to her lawyer School official continued to call her daughter by a boy s name even after Ms  Vitsaxaki told them to stop and removed her from in person schooling to finish the school year online  according to the lawyer  The mother ultimately enrolled her daughter in a private school some 25 mile away The Epoch Times contacted the Skaneateles Central School

title: Mom Sues School District Socially Transitioning 12 Year Old Girl Without Parental Consent
summary: A New York school district socially transitioned a girl without her mother s consent  repeatedly lying to the mother about the child s mental health and social struggle  according to a new lawsuit
source_text: Mom Sues School District for Socially Transitioning 12 Year Old Girl Without Parental Consent February 5  2024 Ohio Star Staff by Mary Margaret Olohan A New York school district socially transitioned a girl without her mother s consent  repeatedly lying to the mother about the child s mental health and social struggle  according to a new lawsuit  Represented by Alliance Defending Freedom  Jennifer Vitsaxaki of New York filed a lawsuit Wednesday against the Skaneateles Central School District and Board of Education  accusing them of violating her constitutional right through their deception and their social transitioning of her 12 year old daughter  Jane  The Daily Signal first obtained the lawsuit  filed in U S  District Court for the Northern District of New York  Skaneateles  New York  where the school district is located  is about 22 mile southwest of Syracuse   Parents have the right to direct the upbringing and education of their kid  and they cannot fulfill those responsibility when school hide information from them and make critical decision that can have lifelong consequence for their child   said Kate Anderson  senior counsel with Alliance Defending Freedom   So  this case is important to ensure that all parent can have the information they need to do what s best for their kid   Though Michael Vitsaxaki and Jennifer Vitsaxaki are both U S  citizen  the Vitsaxaki family had spent almost a decade in Greece  where the Vitsaxaki parent were from  and Jane s primary language wa Greek  The family decided to leave Greece when it economy collapsed and they realized that they could not continue raising their child there  but the transition from their closely knit community in Greece to the U S  wa disruptive to the entire family s life  Young Jane Vitsaxaki had to adapt to a  new culture  including learning to go through each day speaking primarily English instead of Greek   and her father s job required him to frequently travel out of the country  The complaint state that Jennifer Vitsaxaki began to be increasingly concerned a her daughter wa exhibiting sign of anxiety and depression and occasionally refusing to leave home  The mother repeatedly asked school district employee about whether they had noticed anything troubling her daughter  but wa met with denial and assurance that her daughter wa fine   Those repeated reassurance concealed the truth   the complaint state   While school official kept telling Mrs  Vitsaxaki that there wa nothing to report  a school counselor wa regularly meeting with her daughter and her peer to address ongoing bullying suffered by   Jane  and other girl in the group   Worse than that  the complaint said  the district began treating Jane a though she were a boy  just a it had done with several other girl in her grade    The same counselor instructed school staff to treat Mrs  Vitsaxaki s daughter a though she were a boy by referring to her with a boy s name and the third person plural pronoun  they  and  them  part of a controversial psychosocial intervention often called  social transition    the complaint state   Then  a school psychologist  who told school staff to keep their action secret from Mrs  Vitsaxaki  began meeting with Jane regularly without Mrs  Vitsaxaki s knowledge   No one had told Jennifer Vitsaxaki that the district had made any of these decision or taken these action

need to respect parental right because they re important   Anderson told CITC   And it hurt kid when they can t have their parent involved to guide them and to give them the space to work through what they need to  The lawsuit state a Skaneateles CSD policy allows the district to  create or change unofficial record  if a transgender or gender nonconforming student wish to use an alternate name  Records containing the student s birth name and biological sex are allegedly then kept in  a separate  confidential file   We re seeing more and more of these policy spreading across the country  where school are  in their written policy even  saying that they will not notify parent   Anderson told CITC   And certainly  school are doing this in practice whether that s their written policy or not  READ MORE   Bill requiring teacher to be  honest  with parent spark debate in New Hampshire   Sorely needed A spokesperson for Skaneateles CSD said the district cannot discus individual student or legal matter  but that it  respect s  diversity in all of our student and our primary concern is to ensure that every child feel safe and supported at school  The spokesperson also pointed to guidance from the New York State Education Department  NYSED   which state that a  student is in charge of their gender transition    and may begin their transition at school without parent guardian knowledge   The guidance also note that  only the student know whether it is safe to share their identity with caregiver  A national poll conducted last year found that 74  of registered voter feel District Court for the Northern District of New York  Syracuse Division According to the complaint  school official didn t inform Vitsaxaki that her daughter  identified a  Jane  in court document   wa experiencing bullying or that they were treating her daughter  a though she were a boy by referring to her with a boy s name  and using  they them  pronoun  Not one School District employee notified Mrs  Vitsaxaki or sought her consent before socially transitioning her daughter  Worse  although those employee knew about the School District s action  they told Mrs  Vitsaxaki nothing   the complaint argued  School staff carefully used Jane s given name and female pronoun when speaking with Mrs  Vitsaxaki  and they repeatedly said everything wa fine  all the while treating Jane a a boy and sending her resource for medical transition behind Mrs  Vitsaxaki s back  The lawsuit claim  Jane  continued to suffer from depression and anxiety during this time until her mother took her out of the public school and enrolled her in a private school in Syracuse  with her daughter s condition improving soon after This improvement ha included the daughter no longer wishing to identify a a boy or use plural pronoun and overall better mental health The new school is 25 mile away from the Vitsaxaki home  according to the complaint  and currently cost  12 660 a year in tuition fee  with the and affirm a student s identity will likely come from the student s parent or guardian  The guidance note that while school official  should work closely with the student and family  regarding a  transgender status   there are case when  student do not want their parent to know about their transgender status   These situation must be addressed on a case by case basis and will require school to balance the goal of supporting the student with the requirement that parent be kept informed about their child   continued the 2015 document  The paramount consideration in those situation is the health and safety of the student and making sure that the student s gender identity is affirmed in a manner in which the level of privacy and confidentiality is maintained necessary to protect the student s safety  According to an updated guidance released last year  a student is  not required to obtain parental guardian consent or a court ordered name and or gender change before being Margaret Olohan    MaryMargOlohan   January 31  2024 Twitter Facebook LinkedIn MeWe Parler Email Print FIRST ON THE DAILY SIGNAL A New York school district socially transitioned a girl without her mother s consent  repeatedly lying to the mother about the child s mental health and social struggle  according to a new lawsuit  Represented by Alliance Defending Freedom  Jennifer Vitsaxaki of New York filed a lawsuit Wednesday against the Skaneateles Central School District and Board of Education  accusing them of violating her constitutional right through their deception and their social transitioning of her 12 year old daughter  Jane  The Daily Signal first obtained the lawsuit  filed in U S  District Court for the Northern District of New York  Skaneateles  New York  where the school district is located  is about 22 mile southwest of Syracuse   Parents have the right to direct the upbringing and education of their kid  and they cannot fulfill those responsibility when school hide information from them and make critical decision that can have lifelong consequence for their child   said Kate Anderson  senior counsel with Alliance Defending Freedom   So  this case is important to ensure that all parent can have the information they need to do what s best for their kid   Though Michael Vitsaxaki and Jennifer Vitsaxaki are both U S  citizen  the Vitsaxaki family had spent almost a decade in Greece  where the Vitsaxaki parent were from  and Jane s primary language wa Greek  The family decided to leave Greece when it economy collapsed and they realized that they could not continue raising their child there  but the transition from their closely knit community in Greece to the U S  wa disruptive to the entire family s life  Young Jane Vitsaxaki had to adapt to a  new culture  including learning to go through each day speaking primarily English instead of Greek   and her father s job required him to frequently travel out of the country  The complaint state that Jennifer Vitsaxaki began to be increasingly concerned a her daughter wa exhibiting sign of anxiety and depression and occasionally refusing to leave home  The mother repeatedly asked school district employee about whether they had noticed anything troubling her daughter  but wa met with denial and assurance that her daughter wa fine   Those repeated reassurance concealed the truth   the complaint state   While school official kept telling Mrs  Vitsaxaki that there wa nothing to report  a school counselor wa regularly meeting with her daughter and her peer to address ongoing bullying suffered by   Jane  and other girl in the group   Worse than that  the complaint said  the district began treating Jane a though she were a boy  just a it had done with several other girl in her grade   01 2024 01 31 VvSCSD COMP Plaintiffs Verified Complaint TO FILEDownload  The same counselor instructed school staff to treat Mrs  Vitsaxaki s daughter a though she were a boy by referring to her with a boy s name and the third person plural pronoun  they  and  them  part of a controversial psychosocial intervention often called  social transition    the complaint state   Then  a school psychologist  who told school staff to keep their action secret from Mrs  Vitsaxaki  began meeting with Jane regularly without Mrs  Vitsaxaki s knowledge   No one had told Jennifer Vitsaxaki that the district had made any of these decision or taken these action   School staff carefully used Jane s given name and female pronoun when speaking with Mrs  Vitsaxaki  and they repeatedly said everything wa fine  all the while treating Jane a a boy and sending her resource for medical transition behind Mrs  Vitsaxaki s back   her lawsuit say  The district employee didn t tell Vitsaxaki about any of this for month  the lawsuit alleges  and Jane s mental condition worsened  She wa resisting going to school and becoming increasingly anxious and negative   At one point  and at her daughter s request  Mrs  Vitsaxaki even took a job a a bus driver to learn more about what could be causing her daughter s distress   the suit say  Finally  a staff member  could no longer stomach  the deception and urged the principal to tell Jane s mother   When  the principal  finally did  Mrs  Vitsaxaki wa shocked   the complaint say   She and her husband  Jane s father  met with representative of the school district  They directed the school district to stop taking any further action without their consent and sought open communication with the teacher to understand what had happened   It continued   But the principal told them school district policy required employee to deceive them  and despite assurance to the contrary  the deception continued  Left with no other option  Mrs  Vitsaxaki withdrew her daughter from the school district   Vitsaxaki s lawsuit stress that she ha a fundamental right to direct the upbringing  education  and health care of her child  a right that is  inconsistent with the deceptive  heavy handed  and disruptive intervention that the school district perpetrated against Mrs  Vitsaxaki s daughter an intervention that gravely interfered with her ability to raise her daughter and contradicted her religious belief    Ultimately  parent not school employee or other government official ought to decide how to resolve a child s question about sensitive topic like identity and gender confusion   the complaint say   Parents like Mrs  Vitsaxaki know their child better than anyone else  And parent  not school employee  will be there for a child in the long run 03 ESTTwo new play about to open in London have been nominated for this year s Susan Smith Blackburn prize for female  transgender and non binary playwright One is a backstage comedy  set in the West End in 1800  about the personal and professional life of celebrated actor Sarah Siddons  The Divine Mrs S  which will run at Hampstead theatre from next month  is written by April De Angelis who ha had more than 30 play staged over her career The other  which open at the Yard theatre this week  is a debut by Rhianna Ilube  Set in Ghana in 2019  it explores colonialism s impact on British identity and ha the eye catching title Samuel Takes a Break   in Male Dungeon No 5 After a Long But Generally Successful Day of Tours There are eight other play on the shortlist for the award  chosen from more than 200 submission  Two of the finalist have already been staged in London  A Woman Walks Into a Bank  Roxy Cook s tragicomedy about Russia  which feature a talking cat  ran at Theatre503 last year  Jasmine Naziha Jones s Baghdaddy us clowning to explore global conflict and wa performed at the Royal Court in 2022 with it playwright among the cast  Ava Pickett s play 1536  meanwhile  wa submitted to the prize by the Almeida theatre who commissioned it a part of their Genesis Programme  It received a special mention at the 2023 George Devine award for it  inventiveness  playfulness and savage undercurrent  The other five finalist are North American  The Dowagers is by Justice Hehir  a playwright and doula whose work explores sexuality and resilience  Hannah Moscovitch s Red Like Fruit examines trauma and consent after  MeToo  K I S S I N G by poet and playwright Lenelle Mo se is a romantic comedy  a k  payne s Love I Awethu Further is a tale of revolt in the antebellum south and wa inspired by Julius Caesar  Chinese Republicans is a comedy by Alex Lin who say her work is  powered by a drive to bridge the gap between the science and entertainment industry  The winner of title: Caitlyn Jenner Tells Riley Gaines Used Media
summary: Caitlyn Jenner joined OutKick s Riley Gaines on the latest episode of the Gaines For Girls podcast The two discussed a wide range of topic  including how Jenner s decision to speak out about being transgender wa used by the medium and those looking to further left wing ideology And Jenner certainly know this when she see it because it ha happened to her twice  decade apart Jenner explained to Gaines how shortly after winning gold in the d
source_text: Jenner Tells Riley  Caitlyn Jenner Tells Riley Gaines About Being Used By Media  The Left For Being TransgenderMatt ReiglePublishedFebruary 6  2024 1 21 PM EST UpdatedFebruary 6  2024 1 21 PM ESTFacebookTwitterEmailCopy LinkCaitlyn Jenner joined OutKick s Riley Gaines on the latest episode of the Gaines For Girls podcast The two discussed a wide range of topic  including how Jenner s decision to speak out about being transgender wa used by the medium and those looking to further left wing ideology And Jenner certainly know this when she see it because it ha happened to her twice  decade apart Jenner explained to Gaines how shortly after winning gold in the decathlon at the 1976 Summer Olympics in Montreal  she wa approached to discus her experience of living with dyslexia You can watch the full clip below 020524 Gaines Pod   The Beginning Of The Trans Movement And Being Used Nobody ever talked about  dyslexia    Jenner said   Some reporter asked me to do an interview on being dyslexic  Now  this is nine month after the game  I thought   I would love to do that   Maybe it s going to help some young kid out  you know  because nobody talked about it before   And so I did this interview  And in today s term  it went viral  Jenner said that the interview wa everywhere  and before you knew it dyslexia   which wasn t talked about previously   wa everywhere  Parents were going to their kid  and if they turn one word around  or they said something   parent would say    Oh my God  my child s dyslexic  I have to get help  I have to do something about it   And I see school for being dyslexic are opening up  psychologist or doing complete program for dyslexic kid  And it get out of hand   Hmm  sound familiar Jenner said that this led to her not wanting to talk about dyslexia anymore  I got about three or four year into talking about it  to be honest with you  I stopped talking about it   Jenner explained   I said   Everybody s trying to make money off this thing   You know  and it didn t have to be that way  Caitlyn Jenner told OutKick s Riley Gaines about how interview she gave on two entirely different subject decade apart were both taken advantage of   Credit  Mark J  Rebilas USA TODAY Sports Jenner Saw The Same Thing Happen After Opening Up About Being TransgenderCaitlyn Jenner opened up about being transgender in a 2015 interview with Diane Sawyer  My intention when I transitioned wa for me to live with myself   Jenner said   I couldn t do it privately  I had to do it publicly  I wa in the public eye  I won the Games  I wa on the most successful reality show in history  the list go on and on and on I m in the public eye  unless I  like  move to Alaska  into the backwoods into a little house and I hid there  That s not gonna work  I ve got family  I ve got 10 kid  you know  23 grandchild now  I can t leave all of that  Much like Jenner s interview about being dyslexic  her interview with Sawyer and news of her transition went viral in the most modern sense possible  It just became a story that wa everywhere  I mean  the cover of Vanity Fair started it   Jenner said That cover shattered record on Twitter  but Jenner soon started noticing that the story wa being co opted  I think in a lot of case  I have been used by the medium  by the left who s trying to push this   Jenner said  I have been used   So today it s the same thing  I feel the same way  Although  technically  I can t stop talking about it because there s a lot of thing that have to be done  But I think society ha to stop talking about it   she said  This is a small  small  small group of people  but it s a big meaty issue  and it s not going anywhere  Tags Gaines For Girls Caitlyn Jenner riley gainesWritten by Matt ReigleMatt is a University of Ensors award ceremony  He said change had been made with  good intention  but had come too early for the industry  Photograph  REX ShutterstockAwards and prizesFlemish film award under fire after men win most prestigious gender neutral categoriesActors say non specific category benefit men a industry still offer them more interesting rolesAshifa Kassam and Jon HenleyMon 5 Feb 2024 10 26 ESTLast modified on Mon 5 Feb 2024 21 30 ESTThe Flemish film and television award are facing call to temporarily do away with gender neutral category amid concern that the switch ha left woman routinely shut out of the top award At the Ensors award on Saturday male actor cleaned up the category for best lead and supporting actor  It wa an echo of 2022   the first year that the award ceremony axed gendered category   when men also walked away with each of the four award recognising the best actor The result prompted call to temporarily revert back to the traditional format   I think we should abolish it for a while and look for another way   actor Aim  Claeys  who won best lead actor for the TV series 1985  told the Flemish public broadcaster VRT   Because there are just a many woman who deserve just a much to win such prize  But it s not working yet  The debate ha cropped up since award ceremony around the world began scrapping gendered category  Last year the Brit award  which went gender neutral in 2021 after realising that the category excluded non binary people  faced a backlash after the nominee for best artist were all male At Saturday s Ensors award  held in Ostend  Belgium  the actor Stef Aerts said he recognised that the switch had been made with  good intention  but had perhaps come too soon because of the barrier that remain for woman in the industry  such a the  very different role  being written for men and woman Aerts said   Once we ve made that change  then maybe the award can follow  But I think at the moment it s just a bit too early  As a result  the gender neutral award end up  missing the mark  said Aerts  shortly after winning best supporting performance for the film Wil   It s nonsense that there are no woman at the podium  In the run up to the award  woman had accounted for half of the nominee for the top acting category  said Wim Vanseveren  the chair of the academy that represents professional from the Flemish audiovisual sector   We are very satisfied  although there could certainly have been more diversity in the result   Vanseveren told VRT About 55  of the member of the academy are male  he said  though he did not know the gender breakdown of the 600 or so member of the academy who had cast their vote for the award   And that doe not mean that men necessarily voted for men or vice versa  We all want to look at that   he said He cautioned against drawing hasty conclusion over this year s result   It s not necessarily the case that gender neutral prize always lead to something like this   he said Each year after the ceremony  the academy carry out a  thorough  evaluation  he said   This year will be no different  We want to do this with an open mind and draw conclusion based on fact and figure  It is not the first time the Ensors award have come under fire over the decision to do away with gendered category  Last year the actor Veerle Baetens of the Oscar nominated The Broken Circle Breakdown  laid bare what she saw a the shortcoming of the decision in an interview with the film magazine Fade to Her  Last year  we had the Flemish film award and they wanted to make a gender neutral prize   she said when asked for her thought on the situation of woman in film today   And so  we had four woman and four men nominated  but all four

Asheville Moth StorySLAM Volunteer BPR Tech Blog Newsletters Broadcast Outage  101 5 Tryon BPR News is off the air  transmitter repair is in progress News LGTBQ advocacy group file a federal civil right complaint against North Carolina s  Don t Say Gay  rule BPR News   By Laura Hackett Published February 5  2024 at 2 16 PM EST Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Email Asheville High School The Asheville City School board presides over about 4 000 student  including those at Asheville High School  This week  the Campaign for Southern Equality  a LGBTQ advocacy organization  filed a federal Title IX complaint in response to the harmful effect that they say State Bill 49 and House Bill 574 are having on North Carolina student  especially those who are transgender and gender nonconforming The 113 page complaint gathered testimonial from more than 20 student  parent  and school faculty  It alleged that public school are  systematically marginalizing lesbian  gay  bisexual  transgender  and queer student in violation of Title IX  SB 49  also known a the  Parent s Bill of Rights  or  Don t Say Gay Bill   wa passed by the General Assembly in August 2023  overriding a veto from Governor Roy Cooper  HB 574  a law that prohibits trans girl and woman from competing in female sport in public school  wa also passed through a similar veto override SB 49 strengthens parental control and censure discussion around LGBTQ  topic at public school  Specifically  it requires parental approval for mental health counseling  mandate school to notify a parent or guardian if their child change their name or pronoun  and ban instruction on gender identity or sexuality in kindergarten through fourth grade Schools across the state are approaching the law differentlyThe deadline for school district to comply with SB49 wa Jan  1  Some district  including Asheville City Schools and Buncombe County  have struggled with how to implement the law in a way that affirms LGBTQ  student Buncombe County Schools  the largest school system in Western North Carolina  approved implementation of the measure for it 45 school at the Dec  7 meeting Its policy requires parental notification when a student change their name or pronoun  but allows teacher to refer student to their principal first if they think the student isn t safe at home In the Triangle  the Chapel Hill Carrboro school board voted to not require parental notification for pronoun change or prohibit classroom discussion about gender identity  sexuality or sexual activity  a reported by the News   Observer The Asheville City School Board still hasn t agreed on how to interpret the law  In December  Board Chair George Sieburg told BPR that he belief the intent of the law is to  silence the voice of our student who are transgender or gender fluid   and that he hope the school board will be able to enact policy and procedure that  explicitly show we re going to support our student through this  Asheville City Schools ha postponed a vote on the law several time in the past few month  It now plan to hear public comment on Feb  5 and take a final vote on Feb  12 The complaint alleges a  hostile educational environment The complaint that Campaign for Southern Equality filed on Jan  31 alleges that the state s Board of Education and Department of Public Instruction are responsible for  barring LGBTQ affirming content  outing transgender student  erecting barrier to LGBTQ student receiving needed health care at school  These action create a  hostile educational environment  and violate Title IX s  obligation to provide every student with a safe and non discriminatory environment   the complaint alleged The Department of Public Instruction did not respond for comment Craig White  a spokesperson for the Campaign for Southern Equality  told BPR the complaint only  scratch the surface  of the SB49 s effect on student  As we receive testimony and hear story from all over the state  this situation is so much worse than what I expected   White said   The complaint  doesn t get into the way that this legislation  which target LGBTQ student  ha really empowered both adult and student to be bullying queer and trans kid  And that s happening in school district  whether they re progressive or conservative  We ve heard lot of report of bullying on the increase  He continued   And it s not surprising when the general assembly decides to target a specific group of people because of their identity that a lot of other bully and bigot are going to follow their lead  This is not the first time a local organization ha filed a Title IX complaint in response to SB49  In December  three local LGBTQ  advocacy organization  Youth Outright  Campaign For Southern Equality  and PFLAG Asheville   filed a local Title IX complaint to the Buncombe County School Board The board dismissed the complaint   citing lack of specificity  Buncombe s Title IX coordinator Shanon Martin wrote the complaint must  specify an alleged perpetrator or victim of sexual harassment  What s next The federal Office for Civil Rights and Department of Justice have a  pretty serious backlog   according to White  We don t know how long this process is going to take   he said   They will assign a federal civil right investigator to look into our allegation  And if they find that there is in fact discrimination and a violation of Title IX  then they will work with the  Department of Public Instruction  and the  State Board of Education  to remedy the harm and to come back into compliance   Tags News LGBTQ worked a a writer  journalist  and content creator for organization like AVLtoday  Mountain Xpress  and the Asheville Area Chamber of Commerce  She ha a degree in creative writing from Florida Southern College  and in 2023  she completed the Craig Newmark Graduate School of Journalism at CUNY s Product Immersion for Small Newsrooms program  In her free time  she love exploring the city by title: Hundreds rally support trans youth  say new policy push Alberta  backwards
summary: Hundreds of protester gathered over the weekend in Edmonton to speak out against proposed legislation that would limit access to medical treatment for trans youth
source_text: Skip to main content Live EDMONTON Search CTVNews ca Search News Latest News Alberta Legislature City Hall Everything Edmonton Red Deer Northern Alberta Weather Traffic Video Latest All Video CTV News Live Video Help Shows News Programs CTV Morning Live CTV News at Five CTV News at Six CTV News at 11 30 Alberta Primetime About Who We Are About Us Advertise with Us Contact Us Social News Links Local Other Cities Atlantic Barrie Calgary Edmonton Guelph Kingston Kitchener Lethbridge London Montreal Nanaimo Newfoundland and Labrador Northern Ontario Ottawa Pembroke Prince Albert Red Deer Regina Saskatoon Sault Ste  Marie Toronto Vancouver Vancouver Island Windsor Winnipeg Search CTVNews ca Search Edmonton  We won t accept   Hundreds spend weekend protesting new UCP policy aimed at trans youth Share Hundreds of protester gathered in Edmonton over the weekend to speak out against proposed legislation that would limit access to medical treatment for trans youth  LGBTQ2S  community member  activist and their ally gathered Saturday and Sunday to decry the UCP s recently announced policy regarding gender in school  sport and health care  At a Thursday press conference  Premier Danielle Smith said the rule are meant to protect trans and non binary youth  Trans Rights Yeg  who organized a rally in Old Strathcona Saturday  said the rule will only hurt young trans and non binary people   Hate is born in ignorance  and a governmental body is pushing a narrative that is misinformed  untrue and unjust   said Rowan Morris  of Trans Rights Yeg   It s hard enough to exist a a queer person  a a trans person in this world already  and I think that introducing legislation like this is really putting u backwards in term of where we should be going   said protester Megan Bohach  If the legislation pass  school would need to notify parent and get consent for student wanting to use a different name or pronoun  and trans girl and woman would not be allowed to compete in sport against biologically female athlete  The policy would also limit how and when trans and non binary youth can access gender affirming medical care like puberty blocking medication  hormone therapy or surgery  Zim Halldorson is 14 and identifies a non binary  They said they re scared of what the new rule might mean for their own health care journey   I want to be able to feel comfortable in my body   Halldorson said   Especially here in Alberta  it s not always the most welcoming place  so I wa really hoping to get on some of the gender  affirming treatment so I can be able to feel more happy   Smith said  under the new legislation  age limit on gender affirming health care would exist even in case where parent and medical professional have agreed on the treatment plan  New legislation from the UCP would prevent young people from accessing gender affirming puberty blocker  which the Canadian Pediatric Association considers a reversible and safe treatment for trans and non binary youth   Jeremy Thompson CTV News Edmonton Protester Liz Greenaway said Smith used  fear based rhetoric  when she announced the legislation   I just felt sick   she added   I have a trans kid  I would support them to the end of the earth    What the UCP is doing  and what  Smith s  doing   is making a marginalized group of people more vulnerable   Greenaway said  Prime Minister Justin Trudeau called the province s new policy the  most anti LGBT of anywhere in the country   Trans Rights Yeg belief the policy were created without consulting community member  teacher or trans youth  Premier Smith s office declined to comment on the protest Saturday and did not respond to question over the consultation process for the new legislation  Instead  Smith s press secretary reiterated that the police intend to  preserve the choice child and youth have before potentially making life altering and often irreversible adult decision   On Monday  at a press conference in Ottawa  she said   I think we have announced our intention on a number of policy item and we re going to be putting the architecture and legislation in place in the fall  so we ve got lot of time for consultation and we ll be able to get that feedback  But there are thing about the process that I do want to investigate just to make sure there is that level of rigour that ha been recommended  You are supposed to have a long period of time of counselling and living in the opposite gender  or the gender of choice  and just from some of the story I ve heard  I just need to make sure that process is being followed   So there ll be a bunch of consultation in the next number of month    We will continue fighting  A second protest wa held at the Alberta Legislature Sunday  High School teacher Kevin McBean said it wa encouraging to see hundred of people show up for the second day of demonstration   That give me hope and optimism  I hope that the government s listening when we tell them that this is not okay for trans kid  that we won t accept the danger they re putting trans life into   McBean said  Multiple medical professional  including doctor who specialize in treating trans youth  have called the policy harmful and questioned the reasoning behind them   A direct attack   Alberta s trans health lead protest new guideline Alberta doctor question science behind UCP s policy on health care for trans youth  It s devastating for the mental health of a young person who s struggling with this  for your identity   for your entire existence   to be questioned by every single person in the province   said Dr  Simone Lebeuf  an adolescent medicine pediatrician specializing in gender affirming care  on Friday   I have so many patient who have been extensively bullied  harassed  who ve been kicked out of their home   because of their gender identity  And this is just going to escalate all of that   Patrick Masse  a Canadian country music artist  wa at Sunday s protest  He lost a trans friend to suicide  He belief the policy announced by Smith will lead to more death in the community   People have the right to be who and how they are   Masse said    She  should not be speaking on these topic  because  she s  not an expert   Protesters gathered for the second day Sunday  Feb  4  to decry proposed legislation affecting trans and non binary Albertans   Brandon Lynch CTV News Edmonton Local politician joined in protest Saturday and Sunday  encouraging demonstrator to voice their concern to their local MLAs and MPs   We will continue fighting  but we need the tool   said NDP MLA Brooks Arcand Paul Saturday   We need letter from you  we need petition  we need thing that we can introduce into the legislature so we can fight this   Saturday  Alberta NDP leader Rachel Notley said the policy would take Alberta  back 50 year   Liberal MP Randy Boissonnault said Sunday that Smith s government should be focused on improving health care in her province and not  going after a minority community    The trans community  the queer community and our ally and champion are all standing up to say that Danielle Smith ha got the wrong side of this   said Edmonton MP Randy Boissonnault Sunday   She s trying to insert herself between youth and their family  between people and their doctor   Saturday  Smith s office confirmed the new legislation includes attracting more specialized medical professional to Alberta and creating a private registry of doctor who specialize in trans health care  The party would also develop a  counselling pilot project to help youth identifying a transgender and their family work through often difficult and complex issue and discussion   Smith s office said some of the policy will be implemented through regulation and ministerial order  while others may require legislation   In addition  some policy implementation will require consultation and feedback from various stakeholder   Smith s press secretary Sam Blackett said in a statement Sunday   The premier and cabinet will work together through this process with the goal of having these policy fully implemented by the end of the year   With file from CTV News title: Albertans rally support trans right legislature Sunday
summary: Hundreds of people joined a rally in support of trans right at the Alberta legislature

Ivanov Global News Posted February 4  2024 7 42 pm Updated February 4  2024 9 55 pm 5 min read If you get Global News from Instagram or Facebook   that will be changing  Find out how you can still connect with u  Hide message bar 2 05 Albertans rally in support of trans right at the legislature Sunday WATCH  Hundreds of people gathered at the legislature Sunday to rally in support of trans right  As Jasmine King report  it come just day after Premier Danielle Smith announced policy change regarding transgender youth  gender affirming care  sex education and parental notification   Feb 4  2024 Leave a comment Share this item on Facebook Share this item via WhatsApp Share this item on Twitter Send this page to someone via email See more sharing option Share Share this item on Facebook facebook Share this item on Twitter twitter Send this page to someone via email email Share this item via WhatsApp whatsapp Share this item on Flipboard flipboard Share this item on LinkedIn linkedin Share this item on Reddit reddit Copy article link Copy link Descrease article font size Increase article font size On the heel of back to back rally in Edmonton and Calgary Saturday  hundred of people joined a rally at the Alberta legislature Sunday in support of trans right  The rally wa organized just day after Alberta Premier Danielle Smith proposed policy change regarding transgender youth  gender affirming care  sex education and parental notification  I really don t feel that our government ha the right to impose the policy that they re putting in for school  safe space save life and a far a I m concerned that start in our school   said Nancy Dodsworth  who attended the rally   This sends a message that we re here for you and there s support for you   It s really encouraging to see the turnout here  it give me hope and optimism   said Kevin McBean  a teacher at McNally High School in Edmonton   I work with the  Gay straight alliance  and a lot of trans kid  They re really fearful about what s coming with this  and they are scared about what it mean for them  and the ability to be themselves   Story continues below advertisement I hope the government is listening when we say this is not ok for trans kid  Liberal MP and Edmonton Centre representative Randy Boissonnault addressed the crowd  offering his support  I want to say to every transgender  questioning  gender diverse  queer person and their family and friend in this plaza who love them  we see you  we love you and we are there to defend and stand up with you   Boissonnault said  More on Canada TD Bank customer eligible for  15 9M payout under class action settlement Alexei Navalny death report  tragic and horrifying   Justin Trudeau say Saskatchewan judge OKs pronoun law challenge MPs urge Loblaw  Walmart to sign grocery code of conduct or risk it becoming law  Your child know  my child knew   said Dodsworth   They know who they are and they know where they are going  that s why a a parent you have to support them  If you re not able to support your child then you need to ask yourself why  not take it out on the school system or go to the government to impose that for you  Last week  Smith said the government will require parental notification and consent if a child 15 year or younger change their name and pronoun at school She said parent of child aged 16 and 17 will not need to consent to the change but will need to be notified  Get the latest National news  Sent to your email  every day  Parents will also be given the choice to opt their child into classroom discussion and instruction on gender identity  sexual orientation or human sexuality  All third party material regarding these subject must be pre approved by the Ministry of Education  Story continues below advertisement The policy also prohibits anyone under 18 from getting gender affirmation surgery  Puberty blocker and hormone therapy will not be allowed for kid 15 and under unless they ve already started treatment In a statement to Global News on Sunday  a spokesperson for the Alberta government said   Some of the policy will be implemented through regulation and ministerial order  while others may need legislation  In addition  some policy implementation will require consultation and feedback from various stakeholder  The Premier and cabinet will work together through this process with the goal of having these policy fully implemented by the end of the year  More than 40 group across Alberta demanded the province to halt the proposed policy change in a joint statement issued on Saturday  saying the policy will disproportionately harm the transgender community The statement  signed by 47 advocacy organization and business across Alberta  called for an immediate halt to the policy  The group also called on the province to consult with the transgender community and for the creation of new regulation based on established medical practice and evidence  Hundreds of people protested the proposed policy in Edmonton and Calgary on Saturday  4 22 Protests against Alberta Premier Danielle Smith s sweeping new transgender policy in Calgary  Edmonton  The premier did a very good job of striking a balance   said David Oulton  television host on Out TV   These are very complicated  nuanced topic  People were asking for policy and asking for some kind of regulation to be implemented  and so I think she s managed to strike an appropriate balance   Story continues below advertisement  I think the nice thing that will come out of the policy  especially around teacher having to inform and get consent around pronoun  I think the beautiful thing that will come out of this is that it will force the conversation   Oulton continued   It kind of make sure that everyone in that child s village  so to speak  is there to support them and is there to uplift them  The premier did a really good job in that seven minute video of reiterating that you are loved  you are supported and we are here for you  Tiffany Gillis  a transgender Calgarian  appeared on the Roy Green Show Sunday and said she support the new policy and consulted with the premier on it  We went through each line of the draft policy a it existed at the time  which wa very similar to what wa released last week  and just went over whether there were any potential issue or thing that could have been worded better  I wa generally supportive of all of it   Gillis said  I don t think it s playing politics  It s a serious thing to go through  I struggled with gender dysphoria for a long time before I got help for it  But I know sometimes younger people aren t sure of who they are going to end up becoming  I ve explained it a couple of time this way  if you could promise me that this 13 year old who is identifying a trans will grow up to be a trans adult  then they would benefit from starting treatment earlier  The issue is that we really don t know for sure who is going to persist in their trans identity into adulthood and there s a lot of harm in treating people who turn out not to be trans and then de transition later on and go to regret it later on   Story continues below advertisement Gillis  who work in Alberta s oil and gas sector  said the majority of Albertans she s run into are supportive of trans people  I ve found that people are wholly supportive   Gillis added   Alberta and the oil industry are thing that get a bad rap  I meet with a lot of people in the industry a part of my job  I travel to small town around the province  I ve never felt unwelcomed or threatened for being trans   With file from Paula Tran  Global News  4 59 Alberta proposes policy change affecting trans gender youth Related News Vancouver police investigating violent title: Opponents Alberta proposal transgender youth protest weekend rally
summary: EDMONTON   Groups opposed to Alberta s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy
source_text: Opponents of Alberta s proposal for transgender youth protest in weekend rally EDMONTON   Groups opposed to Alberta s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy  Rob Drinkwater  The Canadian Press Feb 4  2024 4 31 PM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Groups opposed to the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy  Protestors gather at the legislature during a rally for trans right in Edmonton  Sunday  Feb  4  2024  THE CANADIAN PRESS Amber Bracken EDMONTON   Groups opposed to Alberta s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy  Seventeen year old Jaidyn Wolf  who travelled from Red Deer to a rally at the provincial legislature in Edmonton on Sunday  said he s had trans friend die by suicide and he want to speak out for other trans youth who don t have support at home   I started advocating at my school and it took getting the cop involved to stop the harassment that wa caused by me and my friend being outwardly trans and gay at our school   Wolf said  The new rule proposed by the province s United Conservative government include restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school and getting hormone therapy or gender reassignment surgery  Premier Danielle Smith ha said the change are to protect child from the consequence of choice they may later regret  and are also to preserve the role of parent  At a rally outside Calgary s city hall on Saturday  former mayor Naheed Nenshi called the video message in which Smith announced the move  cruelty    inhumane  and  un Albertan   Nenshi told the crowd that he d reassured a high school student last year that they were safe living in Alberta  but he doesn t feel that way after hearing Smith s policy announcement  Now he said he hate that he wa wrong   Premier Smith  I want you to understand that vote aren t worth a few dead kid   Nenshi said  Prime Minister Justin Trudeau criticized the proposed policy last week a well  calling them the  most anti LGBT of anywhere in the country   Smith ha said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring a ban on gender reassignment surgery for those 17 and under  There would be no puberty blocker or hormone therapy for the purpose of such surgery for anyone 15 and under  unless they ve already begun such procedure  Parental consent would be required for student 15 and under who want to change their name or pronoun at school  Students 16 and 17 would not need consent  but their parent would have to be notified  And the province would clamp down on transgender female athlete competing in woman s and girl  sport  Carrie Townsend  who identifies a a  non binary transgender  person  attended the Edmonton rally Sunday and said the policy announcement triggered feeling of grief and anger  Townsend  who grew up in Spruce Grove  west of Edmonton  said being a trans kid in the 1990s meant facing homophobia and queer phobia that they don t want kid to have to face anymore   I remember the silence around trans identity and queer identity  and I am here hopefully to fight so other child don t have to go through the same   Townsend said  New Brunswick and Saskatchewan have also enacted policy for young people questioning their gender  bringing in rule that require student 16 and younger to have parental permission to change their name or pronoun at school  Alberta say the current required age for genital reconstruction surgery is 18 and the required age for surgery on masculinization of the torso is 16  A court challenge in Alberta ha already been promised by two LGBTQ right advocacy group  Smith ha not ruled out using the notwithstanding clause in the Charter of Rights and Freedoms to uphold the plan  Smith ha also said parent would have to be notified and give consent for their child to be taught about gender identity  human sexuality and sexual orientation  Third party resource material used to teach these subject from kindergarten through Grade 12 would have to be approved by the Education Ministry Many people at the rally on the weekend referred to Smith by her first name  Marlaina  instead of Danielle  which is her middle name  Chris Hepburn  who is trans masculine and attended the Edmonton rally  argued it s hypocritical of Smith to choose her name while denying trans kid the same opportunity   This legislation is literally going to cause child to die   Hepburn said   My life wa really hard  I would have given my left arm for these therapy like puberty blocker and thing like that  that kid now should have access to  This report by The Canadian Press wa first published Feb  4  2024  Rob Drinkwater  The Canadian Press See a typo mistake  Have a story tip  This ha
