title: Opponents Alberta proposal transgender youth protest weekend rally
summary: EDMONTON   Groups opposed to Alberta s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy
source_text: Alberta News Opponents of Alberta s proposal for transgender youth protest in weekend rally Rob Drinkwater  The Canadian Press Feb 4  2024 5 31 PM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Groups opposed to the Alberta government s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy  Protestors gather at the legislature during a rally for trans right in Edmonton  Sunday  Feb  4  2024  THE CANADIAN PRESS Amber Bracken EDMONTON   Groups opposed to Alberta s planned policy around transgender youth held rally in Calgary and Edmonton over the weekend  with many of the attendee warning the plan will out trans kid and put their life in jeopardy  Seventeen year old Jaidyn Wolf  who travelled from Red Deer to a rally at the provincial legislature in Edmonton on Sunday  said he s had trans friend die by suicide and he want to speak out for other trans youth who don t have support at home   I started advocating at my school and it took getting the cop involved to stop the harassment that wa caused by me and my friend being outwardly trans and gay at our school   Wolf said  The new rule proposed by the province s United Conservative government include restriction on youth changing their name or pronoun at school and getting hormone therapy or gender reassignment surgery  Premier Danielle Smith ha said the change are to protect child from the consequence of choice they may later regret  and are also to preserve the role of parent  At a rally outside Calgary s city hall on Saturday  former mayor Naheed Nenshi called the video message in which Smith announced the move  cruelty    inhumane  and  un Albertan   Nenshi told the crowd that he d reassured a high school student last year that they were safe living in Alberta  but he doesn t feel that way after hearing Smith s policy announcement  Now he said he hate that he wa wrong   Premier Smith  I want you to understand that vote aren t worth a few dead kid   Nenshi said  Prime Minister Justin Trudeau criticized the proposed policy last week a well  calling them the  most anti LGBT of anywhere in the country   Smith ha said the fall sitting of the legislature would bring a ban on gender reassignment surgery for those 17 and under  There would be no puberty blocker or hormone therapy for the purpose of such surgery for anyone 15 and under  unless they ve already begun such procedure  Parental consent would be required for student 15 and under who want to change their name or pronoun at school  Students 16 and 17 would not need consent  but their parent would have to be notified  And the province would clamp down on transgender female athlete competing in woman s and girl  sport  Carrie Townsend  who identifies a a  non binary transgender  person  attended the Edmonton rally Sunday and said the policy announcement triggered feeling of grief and anger  Townsend  who grew up in Spruce Grove  west of Edmonton  said being a trans kid in the 1990s meant facing homophobia and queer phobia that they don t want kid to have to face anymore   I remember the silence around trans identity and queer identity  and I am here hopefully to fight so other child don t have to go through the same   Townsend said  New Brunswick and Saskatchewan have also enacted policy for young people questioning their gender  bringing in rule that require student 16 and younger to have parental permission to change their name or pronoun at school  Alberta say the current required age for genital reconstruction surgery is 18 and the required age for surgery on masculinization of the torso is 16  A court challenge in Alberta ha already been promised by two LGBTQ right advocacy group  Smith ha not ruled out using the notwithstanding clause in the Charter of Rights and Freedoms to uphold the plan  Smith ha also said parent would have to be notified and give consent for their child to be taught about gender identity  human sexuality and sexual orientation  Third party resource material used to teach these subject from kindergarten through Grade 12 would have to be approved by the Education Ministry Many people at the rally on the weekend referred to Smith by her first name  Marlaina  instead of Danielle  which is her middle name  Chris Hepburn  who is trans masculine and attended the Edmonton rally  argued it s hypocritical of Smith to choose her name while denying trans kid the same opportunity   This legislation is literally going to cause child to die   Hepburn said   My life wa really hard  I would have given my left arm for these therapy like puberty blocker and thing like that  that kid now should have access to  This report by The Canadian Press wa first published Feb  4  2024  Rob Drinkwater  The Canadian Press See a typo mistake  Have a story tip  This story wa important to me or our necessarily reflect the view of The Christian Post  Opinions expressed are solely those of the author s  HomeOpinionWhen the government come for your child By Michael Brown  Op ed Contributor Monday  February 05  2024Getty Images It s one of the ultimate nightmare  You find yourself living under a totalitarian regime which is militantly opposed to your personal belief and conviction  But you refuse to yield or cave in  To compromise is to lose your very soul  So  the government fight back   Go ahead   the authority say   and be a hero  But it will cost you dearly  We are taking away your child  As a reader  your first thought might be   Thank God we live in America  Well  think again What I described ha now taken place right here in the USA  the land of the free and the home of the brave Of course  thing like this have happened under communism for year  where the state remove child from Christian home and put them in government school to be indoctrinated and brainwashed A 2009 report on a homeschooling website stated that  The plight of German homeschoolers may have gotten worse  Despite rule regarding the freedom of movement in the European Union  German government official appear to have taken an unprecedented step of persuading French authority to take four child from a family who fled Germany to France in order to escape persecution aimed at homeschoolers  The headline itself wa chilling   German Homeschooled Children Seized by French Social Workers  A few year ago  a distraught mother living in a  progressive  country outside the US told me her own horror story Her 16 year old daughter had begun to identify a transgender  quite out of the blue  and without the parent  knowledge  the school informed her that if her parent were not supportive  the daughter could be removed from their home and raised in an affirming environment This mom and dad were shocked beyond word when they learned this from school authority  Who on earth gave them that right But what about here in America  where homeschooling is widely practiced  where there is not a totalitarian communist regime  and where there is le infringement on our private life  When is the government actually taking away anyone s child  other than because of case involving the real endangerment of the child Back in 2022  the Washington Examiner shared the heartbreaking story of Abby Martinez   who tried to fight back when a Los Angeles school  county social worker  and an LGBT group sought to transition her confused 15 year old daughter  But once Yaeli Martinez wa moved into foster care and later injected with testosterone  the heartbroken mother could only watch helplessly a the girl spiraled into depression that ended when she stepped in front of an oncoming train   They killed my daughter   a tearful Martinez told the Washington Examiner   They had to pick piece of her off of the track   You might say   But there were other factor involved in that story  and the government wa looking out for the child s best interest  The grieving mother would beg to differ  with every fiber of her being  And again  who empowered the state to make these kind of decision That s why there s such grave concern over a growing number of state   11 a of June 2023   declaring themselves sanctuary state for trans identified minor  Come here   they proclaim   and get the medical care that you need  the care that all those state that are withholding from you  We ll help you here  even without your parent  consent  And what happens to a trans identified minor child who make his or her way to one of these sanctuary state seeking trans related care  against their parent  wish  Does the sanctuary state now have legal authority over that child  Do the parent have a way to get their child back These are some of the very real  contemporary legal debate But rather than speculate  we can ask a couple in Montana what happened to their daughter As reported in the New York Post   The parent told Reduxx that their issue with the state agency started when official received a call in August 2023 that Jennifer  whose name wa changed for publication at their request  expressed suicidal thought at school  A CFS caseworker came to speak with the teen and inspect the house where Jennifer claimed she drank toilet bowl cleaner and took painkiller in an attempt to take her own life  the outlet reported  The teen reportedly showed no related symptom  and a test at the hospital showed she didn t consume any toxin  But her hospital stay stretched to multiple day  in which staff there noted that Jennifer identified a male and wanted to be called Leo  The parent said they quickly but unsuccessfully objected   We were very clear to the emergency room staff a well a  CFS  that this go against our value  moral and our religious belief   Krista Kolstad recalled to Reduxx  accusing the hospital of consistently undermining her and her husband s authority  And what happened next  Jennifer wa eventually moved to a specialized residential care facility in Wyoming despite her parent  concern  Kolstad told Reduxx she and Todd were worried about Jennifer being cared for in the state  where minor can receive gender affirming care without parental consent   They showed up at our home to serve u with paper to take Jennifer out of our care   Kolstad alleged   They told me the reason wa that we were  unable or refusing to provide medical care   That s just not true   Jennifer returned in September to a Montana youth facility  where she remains  Earlier this month  a court put the teen in the custody of CFS  Reduxx reported  Need I say more  other than that we ve been warning you that these day would come Do you believe me now Dr  Michael Brown  http R    Courtesy of Katrina Smith She expects Democrats will continue to introduce similar bill   if they re in the majority   If they re in the minority  it will have no chance and will be crushed   she transition medical procedure into Maine  Maine wouldn t consider this action to be child kidnapping under the bill Maine mother Alicia Lawson belief the state would have been able to take Ms  Lawson s  She talked extensively with her daughter about the transgender feeling  and in a few year  her child grew out of them  Ms  Lawson said These feeling were complicated because her daughter is autistic  she said To navigate this topic  Ms  Lawson took her daughter to a pediatrician  who said signing her daughter up for gender transition surgery now would help her get through the long wait list for the procedure  By the time she s 18 to make her own choice  then she won t have to wait on the waitlist   the pediatrician said  Ms  Lawson said she refused this offer Today  her daughter no longer Courtesy of Heather Sprague Groups such a Planned Parenthood support and provide transgender procedure and the Planned Parenthood Action Fund  support many Democrat campaign nationwide Maine Health  a title: Hundreds Albertans protest  uninformed  provincial gender policy
summary: Hundreds of Albertans took to the street in Calgary and Edmonton Saturday to show their support for the transgender community

Hundreds of Albertans took to the street in Calgary and Edmonton Saturday to show their support for the transgender community  The massive protest come day after controversial provincial policy were unveiled that will limit access to medical treatment for trans youth  LGBTQ2S  community member  activist and their ally gathered to demand the UCP government roll back those legislation proposal that deal with gender in school  sport and health care   You just hope the  government  is actually listening   Calgary protester Alyssa Quinney said   We would all rather be anywhere else  but here we are   At a Thursday press conference  Premier Danielle Smith said the rule are meant to protect trans youth and offer their parent more peace of mind  But her announcement ha been met with swift opposition across the country   specifically from people arguing the proposal are going to have the exact opposite effect  Many in Calgary call the move political posturing meant for the fringe of Smith s base    Parental right  is a big blanket umbrella term being used to get people fired up about a non issue   parent Victoria Desjardins told CTV News   It speaks to the fact that the UCP doesn t know what the majority of Albertans want   Leah Zurbrigg added  Roughly 1 200 people gathered in Calgary  including representative from city council  the Alberta NDP  the Alberta Teachers  Association and more  Cardinal policy So just how did we get here  On Thursday  Smith said she had help in creating the new proposal   I ve been very influenced over many year talking to many individual in the transgender community   she said   I met with Lois Cardinal  who  a you may know  ha felt that she wa rushed into bottom surgery and is having consequence of that   CTV News caught up with Cardinal this weekend  She say she came out and began transitioning at 19 year old  Two year later   at 21   she wa approved for surgery and flown to Montreal  She say she felt  pushed through  the system and is angry doctor didn t stop her  Cardinal now refers to herself a being  sterilized    I had several complication with vaginoplasty and also with a neurological condition   she said   I wa at a breaking point   Cardinal ha met with Smith and been mentioned by the premier multiple time  She s on board with the proposed change   What we are giving  kid  is time   she said   There s no rush   It s such a personal experience  and I think loving parent and guardian should be involved   At least partially inspired by Cardinal  Smith say she want to make sure the post op experience is improved  That s especially where Cardinal say she felt let down once she returned home   We want to attract somebody into our province who can do the surgery here   Smith said Thursday   So the aftercare can be done here   Not the same  CTV News asked multiple protestors on Saturday about Cardinal s impact on the premier  Jake Donaldson  who is a family physician  say he feel for the Saddle Lake resident   Unfortunately  regret is just a reality of life   Donaldson said   What we re weighing is the risk of regret for these young individual versus the risk of doing nothing and forcing them through a puberty that doesn t match their gender identity   And there are multiple marked difference between Cardinal s story and the story of those who will be impacted by what Smith ha brought forward  Firstly  Cardinal wa 21 when she transitioned  no longer a child who needed parental supervision  And though she feel rushed  many younger teen in the gender affirming process have even longer than two year to figure out what they want  Alberta s current system ha a lengthy waitlist and backlog  and surgery are reserved for adult only  Lastly  the data suggests Cardinal is an outlier  Multiple North American study   including a report out of Princeton University in 2022   show the overwhelming majority of those young people who transition stick with it  Donaldson say it s unfair to colour the policy with one case   People regret having kid   he said   And getting tattoo  We re not going to ban those   Smith is expected to turn the proposal into legislation this autumn title: Transgender ally gather Calgary Edmonton rally proposed government policy
summary: Premier Danielle Smith said her government will introduce legislation this fall to support the planned policy change affecting transgender and non binary youth and adult
source_text: Transgender ally gather in Calgary and Edmonton to rally against proposed government policy   CBC News LoadedCalgaryTransgender ally gather in Calgary and Edmonton to rally against proposed government policiesPremier Danielle Smith said her government will introduce legislation this fall to support the planned policy change affecting transgender and non binary youth and adult Premier Danielle Smith say new legislation affecting transgender and non binary youth coming this fallCBC News   Posted  Feb 03  2024 5 05 PM EST   Last Updated  February 5Hundreds of protester rallied outside Calgary city hall Saturday to support the province s transgender community   Helen Pike CBC Social SharingProtesters gathered in both Calgary and Edmonton Saturday to support the province s transgender community and express their dissatisfaction with new measure proposed by Premier Danielle Smith related to the province s student gender identity  sport and surgery policy  In Edmonton  hundred of activist  ally and member of the transgender community gathered at Dr  Wilbert McIntyre Park in Old Strathcona In Calgary  more than a thousand people attended the protest in front of city hall Rowan Morris  who is with Trans Rights YEG   one of the group behind the Edmonton rally  said the proposed policy are not only harmful to trans youth  but to the entire trans community in Alberta   Knowing that there s youth who are going to be growing up in an environment where they re not safe  and knowing the statistic behind gender affirming care  we re here today because what is happening is absolutely not OK   said Morris  Morris  who us the pronoun he him and they them  said the Alberta he fell in love with when he moved to the province in 2015 ha changed   A complete stifling of who we are In Edmonton  ally of the transgender community rallied in Dr  Wilbert McIntyre Park in Old Strathcona  Another protest is planned for Sunday   Charles Delisle Radio Canada  I felt like I came to my first day of high school and it wa fine being new because everyone had been new before  everyone had been different before   Morris said  But I don t feel that anymore in Alberta today  I don t feel this welcoming for people who are different  I don t feel this appreciation for individuality  What I m feeling right now is a complete rollback on trans and queer right  and a complete stifling of who we are a people  Eddie Punko  who attended the rally in Edmonton  said he wa devastated after hearing about the proposed policy   There s so many kid I work with  who  are so excited to explore their identity and grow up  But these kind of policy make it really hard to think about even growing up and becoming an adult when it s so hard to just exist a a person  Punko added that part of the reason he attended the rally wa to spread joy amid uncertainty   Whatever policy get put in place  that say  you don t deserve to be safe  we re all here to say that you do and that we love you so much   he said  addressing the transgender community James Demers  a transgender man and organizer of the rally in Calgary with the group Queer Citizens United  said the demonstration wa about creating a show of solidarity with those who oppose the proposed policy WATCH   Protesters voice opposition to Alberta s gender identity policy  Hundreds protest Alberta s new gender identity policies12 day agoDuration 2 09Hundreds of people gathered outside Alberta s legislature to push back against recently announced plan to make sweeping change to some of the province s policy around transgender youth  Rather than protesting a specific action  this is about creating a demonstration of love for the community  so that the sense of isolation and loneliness which is trying to be accomplished through this legislation is combated   said Demers  It s extremely draconian legislation  even in the context of other province who have attempted to similarly discriminate against gender diverse people  Is the queer community surprised that the UCP  government  is attacking u through legislation  Not even remotely    The UCP  will not and have not made any effort to change  AnalysisDanielle Smith bid to transcend politics with Canada s toughest trans youth rulesDoctors  nurse and medical group urge province to walk back plan to limit gender affirming careLeah Zurbrigg said it wa important to her to attend the rally in Calgary to share her support of transgender youth and adult alike   It s really crazy important that we stand up and get this fixed  because this is not something that we can let stand   said Zurbrigg  I have a lot of trans friend who I value very deeply and I know people who are in dangerous situation at home  and the fact that they could be outed put them and their life at risk  So I can t just sit and watch  James Demers at the protest in Calgary in front of city hall  More than a thousand people attended   Helen Pike CBC A small number of representative from the group 1 Million March 4 Children  which opposes gender identity education in school  wa also present in Calgary to demonstrate support for the premier s proposed policy Athletes  advocate push back against Alberta s new transgender policiesOn Thursday  Smith said her government will introduce legislation this fall to support the planned policy change affecting transgender and non binary youth and adult The measure being proposed are  Top and bottom surgery will be banned for minor aged 17 and under  Doctors say bottom surgery aren t performed on youth and top surgery are rare  Puberty blocker and hormone therapy for gender affirmation will not be permitted for child aged 15 and under  Youths aged 16 and 17 will be permitted to start hormone therapy for gender affirmation  a long a they are deemed mature enough  and have parental  physician and psychologist approval  Parental notification and consent will be required for a school to alter the name or pronoun of any child aged 15 and under  Students who are 16 or 17 won t need permission but school will need to let their parent know first  Parents will have to  opt in  their child every time a teacher plan to teach about gender identity  sexual orientation or sexuality  Alberta law currently requires parental notification and give them the option to opt student out  All third party teaching material on gender identity  sexual orientation or sexuality will need to be approved in advance by the education ministry  Transgender woman will be banned from competing in woman s sport league  Smith said the government will work with league to set up co ed or gender neutral division for sport  WATCH   Will there be repercussion for Smith  A political watcher weighs in  The political pulse behind Danielle Smith s sweeping transgender youth policies13 day agoDuration 8 24Postmedia columnist Rick Bell break down the political reaction to the Alberta government s

reddit Copy article link Copy link Descrease article font size Increase article font size More than 40 group across Alberta demanded the province to halt the proposed parental right policy in a joint statement issued on Saturday  saying the policy will disproportionately harm the transgender community  The statement  signed by 47 advocacy organization and business across Alberta  called for an immediate halt to the policy  The group also called on the province to consult with the transgender community and for the creation of new regulation based on established medical practice and evidence  The Premier s suite of measure seeking to restrict healthcare for transgender child  disclose private information regarding their gender identity without their consent   segregate transgender woman from participation in sport do not reflect the value of our community   the statement read  Any proposal regarding the health and welfare of transgender child need to include expert medical advice  and involve consultation with all concerned party  teacher  social worker  family  legal professional  and most importantly the transgender community  Story continues below advertisement  Instead  the UCP s proposal interferes with Canadians  protected charter right and run contrary to the evidence based medical practice and research over the past 80 year  If implemented  this suite of measure risk placing trans youth who have unsupportive family in harmful situation  segregate trans woman from participation in social activity  and limit access to resource for trans youth  even with parental consent  Joint Statement Regarding  Alberta UCP Policies Voncerning Trans Youth   Hender Affirming Care As citizen of Alberta  we condemn the recent proposal by Premier Danielle Smith seeking to limit transgender healthcare and participation in society  1   pic twitter com YvbZUzIfEK  QCU yyc   QCUyyc  February 3  2024This come after Alberta Premier Danielle Smith published a video on social medium Wednesday saying the government will require parental notification and consent if a child 15 year or younger change their name and pronoun at school In the video on X  formerly known a Twitter  Smith said parent of child aged 16 and 17 will not need to consent to the change but will need to be notified  Story continues below advertisement Smith said it is the responsibility of parent  teacher and community leader to  preserve  child s right to grow and develop into mature adult so they are  better prepared to make the most impactful decision affecting their life   Get the latest National news  Sent to your email  every day  Smith said she looked to other jurisdiction while considering these rule  While she said Saturday that the UCP  consulted very broadly  on this issue  she ha not said who or what group or expert were consulted  We just think that s the responsible way of approaching this issue so that kid are not precluded from all the future choice that come to them when they decide to make the decision that s going to have potentially serious ramification on their reproductive  health    Smith told reporter on Thursday  More on Calgary Le Petit Chef take centre stage at The Dorian Hotel Calgary man sentenced in death of 3 year old Ivy Wick  Lots of fun   Calgary area senior hit the ice in wheelchair Next of kin sought for unidentified man found dead in Calgary The joint statement come a protest against the new policy were held in Edmonton and Calgary on Saturday  Hundreds attended the rally in Edmonton  while thousand attended the rally in Calgary  These policy that have been released by the  United Conservative  cabinet are not in line with the belief of modern society and not Albertans in general   said Victoria Bucholtz  a community organizer with Queer Citizens United Bucholtz said she is happy to see a people coming to the rally  and said this is proof that Albertans are willing to rally to protect LGBTQ2 right Although the policy wa  somewhat expected   she told Global News the policy still shocked her  Story continues below advertisement  This is a test  This is a test of the progress  this is a test of the tolerance of our society  We haven t stepped back  but we could   Bucholtz said   This is where we need to band together and examine our moral  Rowan Morris  primary organizer with Trans Rights YEG  said he felt helpless and scared when Smith announced the policy on social medium  He called the policy  transphobic   and decided to organize the rally in Edmonton on Saturday The rally is supporting all trans people in Alberta  he said  1 44 Alberta policy on trans youth most anti LGBTQ in Canada  Trudeau Trending Now Donald Trump  son  business fined US 364M in NY civil fraud case A woman dying of cancer  and the struggle to get treatment to reduce her pain  The community is feeling attacked because their medical right are being threatened  Their right to simply existing  and  existing happily   Especially for youth   Morris told Global News   Many youth  not only trans youth  use different name in school  It s not specifically a trans issue   Story continues below advertisement In a response to the rally  the premier s office maintained the policy were made to  preserve the choice child and youth have before potentially making life altering and often irreversible adult decision   To reaffirm our support for the transgender community  we are also providing additional support to assist transgender adult to secure the health care they need like bringing medical professional who specialize in transgender care to Alberta   said Sam Blackett  press secretary to the Office of the Premier  in an emailed statement on Saturday afternoon  We re also developing a private registry of medical professional who specialize in this field to make it easier for transgender Albertans to access needed medical treatment and care  Additionally  we re developing a counselling pilot project to help youth identifying a transgender and their family work through often difficult and complex issue and discussion  But Morris said the policy a a whole will exacerbate mental and physical health issue for many trans youth across the province A study published by Duke University in 2022 surveyed more than 58 000 trans and non binary people  2 million cisgender woman and 2 million cisgender men and found trans people had significantly higher rate of mortality at nearly every age compared to their cisgender counterpart Morris said the disparity in mortality rate is because of policy similar to Alberta s  Story continues below advertisement  It s going to exacerbate violence against trans individual   he said   All of these policy reveals are going to be a domino effect that will result in trans youth dying  Noah  who attended the rally in Edmonton  said he want to see trans youth live happy and healthy life  He accused the provincial government of distracting Albertans from  real issue  like the housing crisis and the health care crisis  They re a distraction of the real issue that we have going on  They re trying to incite hatred in people  they re trying to lie to everybody   he told Global News   It s trying to pit people against each other   Love your kid for who they are  not who you think they should be   With file from Emily Mertz  Global News  4 59 Alberta proposes pronoun change at school  Demoralizing  and  draconian   reaction pour in over Alberta s new transgender policy Alberta s proposed gender identity change will affect 2SLGBTQ  life  expert As for Gender Identity  Heads To White House  Photo by LEONARDO MUNOZ AFP via Getty Images  Brandon Poulter Contributor February 03  2024 1 35 PM ET Font Size  A policy that will codify protection for  transgender  student and change how school respond to sexual misconduct on campus wa sent to the Office of Management and Budget  OMB  for review Friday  according to a government website  The policy will unravel former Education Secretary Betsy Devos  Title IX rule  which ordered school to conduct cross examination during sexual misconduct investigation and conduct live hearing of them  according to Politico  Democrats and civil right group have been pressuring the Department of Education  ED  to finalize the rule  which would codify protection for  gender identity    RELATED  Elite University Donor Pledges To Pull Funding  Calls On President To Resign Over Diversity  Equity And Inclusion  The Biden Harris Administration is committed to ensuring all student are guaranteed an educational environment free from discrimination on the basis of sex   an ED spokesperson told Politico   The Department of Education ha taken the next step to advance a rule  first proposed in 2022  that strengthens protection for student from sexual harassment and for LGBTQI  student   US Education Secretary Miguel Cardona speaks during a back to school K 12 Cybersecurity Summit in the East Room of were immediately upset by the revelation   I ve heard from parent in Western Heights and throughout Oklahoma who are deeply concerned about the message being sent by a district that would put a drag queen in charge of one of our school  It is simply unacceptable   Walters said in announcing the investigation   Mr  Murnan ha been clear that he is  very open  about his alter ego and ha shared it not only on publicly available social medium but ha performed in public library under a very thin veil of would be anonymity  These are not the action of a school leader concerned about the well being of child   Initially  at least  the school district supported Murnan amid the backlash   Recently  information began circulating about Dr  Murnan and the charge he faced more than 20 year ago for an alleged crime involving child pornography  According to news report at the time  those charge were dismissed by the court  and the record of the charge ha been expunged   read a district statement from superintendent Brayden Savage   Since that time  Dr  Murnan ha continued to be certified a an elementary school teacher and principal  including having his certificate renewed in April of 2023 and signed by State Superintendent Ryan Walters  The State Department of Education would have conducted another felony background check upon renewing his certification   According to Murnan  the district s support began to wane after a meeting between Savage and Walters in December  and he wa given an ultimatum to resign or be fired   It really make me angry because all this time   Savage  told me she wa supporting me and she wasn t going to fire me   Murnan said on NonDoc   She supported me multiple time with multiple people a witness in the room  And then she  said  I have a choice to be terminated or resign   Drag queen don t belong in the classroom  This is common sense   libsoftiktok pic twitter com Efnk3yOeuj  Superintendent Ryan Walters   RyanWaltersSupt  February 2  2024 But Walters say Murnan s departure from the school  whether forced or not  is necessary   Exposing Murnan and forcing the resignation is a necessary step to protect kid in Oklahoma  Our student will be protected from predatory behavior  and I have been crystal clear that I will not allow Oklahoma school to become a training ground in drag queen propaganda   Walters said  Walters recently appointed source_text: Ference feel NHL making progress with support of LGBTQ 2S community Share TORONTO   Andrew Ference feel the NHL ha made progress in it support of the LGBTQ  community  The former defenceman and the NHL s director of social impact  growth and fan development wa in attendance for the first Pride Cup at the league s all star weekend  The NHL  Scotiabank and Pride Tape hosted player from the Toronto Gay Hockey Association competing in a ball hockey game at Metro Toronto Convention Centre on Saturday morning   The overwhelming majority of hockey player and people in the locker room are incredibly supportive and incredibly proud to support cause like this and many great positive cause within the hockey community   he said  adding that  there s always a social cost  with freedom to have one s own view regarding the continued ban on theme night pre game jersey   So I think like anything in life when you live in a free country  and in North America  you re going to have different viewpoint  You re not always going to agree with them and that s OK   But I think within hockey  we see the overwhelming support for this community and that s incredibly encouraging for me   Top sport headline  all in one place The NHL received backlash last year when it halted the theme night pre game jersey for the 2023 24 season last June  It wa a result of a handful of player refusing to wear Pride jersey for differing reason and that causing a distraction from the league s view  It then issued an updated memo last October which included a ban on Pride Night tape for pre game warm ups that brought along further criticism  The NHL then rescinded the ban on the tape  saying player had the choice to support cause with stick tape throughout the season  Edmonton Oilers star Connor McDavid and Toronto Maple Leafs defenceman Morgan Rielly were among those who spoke out in disagreement to the league s move in 2023  Arizona Coyotes defenceman Travis Dermott proceeded to go against the ban on Oct  21  leading to the league rescinding the ban on the stick tape three day later   There s always going to be more to be done  there s always going to be room for more support  more progress   Ference said   But sometimes it s baby step  Culture change  sometimes  frustratingly slow and especially sometimes in sport   You deal with that and I think if you do the right thing  you support good people and you support proud  strong community in hockey  you re always on the right side of history   Longtime NHL executive and current executive director of the Professional Women s Hockey League Players  Association  Brian Burke  who ha long been a strong supporter of the LGBTQ  community  had called the ban a  surprising and serious setback  at the time  On Saturday  however  he had a different tune    NHL Commissioner  Gary Bettman s been a great ally  I think people are focused on the fact that they got rid of Pride sweater   Burke said Saturday   They still do Pride Nights  just not the Pride sweater  The league s been an ally  We haven t got everything we d like from the league but we get great support   I think we just keep going the way we re going and keep adding event  keep adding awareness  keep changing and breaking down the barrier that constrict u   he added   I see the world a a very different place than when my son came out    We ve made great gain and we got to keep focusing on that and not what hasn t happened   Pride Tape co founder Dr  Kristopher Wells found Saturday s event to be a way of fixing the NHL s standing with the community   This is about repairing harm that ha been done to the community   Wells said   The Pride Tape ban hurt a lot of people and that s why you saw the worldwide response about that decision   So I hope that Pride Cup is a start of building a new relationship  One where we re all working together because at the end of the day  the young people who love hockey  they want the game to love them back the NHL ha made progress in it support of the LGBTQ  community  Abdulhamid Ibrahim  The Canadian Press Feb 3  2024 1 24 PM Feb 3  2024 1 35 PM Share by Email Share on Facebook Share on X Share on LinkedIn Print Share via Text Message Former Edmonton Oilers  Andrew Ference speaks to the medium during the Humboldt Hockey Day event in Humboldt  Sask   Friday  August 24  2018  Ference feel the NHL ha made progress in it support of the LGBTQ  community  The former defenceman and the NHL s director of social impact  growth and fan development wa in attendance for the first Pride Cup at the league s all star weekend  THE CANADIAN PRESS Kayle Neis TORONTO   Andrew Ference feel the NHL ha made progress in it support of the LGBTQ  community  The former defenceman and the NHL s director of social impact  growth and fan development wa in attendance for the first Pride Cup at the league s all star weekend  The NHL  Scotiabank and Pride Tape hosted player from the Toronto Gay Hockey Association competing in a ball hockey game at Metro Toronto Convention Centre on Saturday morning   The overwhelming majority of hockey player and people in the locker room are incredibly supportive and incredibly proud to support cause like this and many great positive cause within the hockey community   he said  adding that  there s always a social cost  with freedom to have one s own view regarding the continued ban on theme night pre game jersey   So I think like anything in life when you live in a free country  and in North America  you re going to have different viewpoint  You re not always going to agree with them and that s OK   But I think within hockey  we see the overwhelming support for this community and that s incredibly encouraging for me   The NHL received backlash last year when it halted the theme night pre game jersey for the 2023 24 season last June  It wa a result of a handful of player refusing to wear Pride jersey for differing reason and that causing a distraction from the league s view  It then issued an updated memo last October which included a ban on Pride Night tape for pre game warm ups that brought along further criticism  The NHL then rescinded the ban on the tape  saying player had the choice to support cause with stick tape throughout the season  Edmonton Oilers star Connor McDavid and Toronto Maple Leafs defenceman Morgan Rielly were among those who spoke out in disagreement to the league s move in 2023  Arizona Coyotes defenceman Travis Dermott proceeded to go against the ban on Oct  21  leading to the league rescinding the ban on the stick tape three day later   There s always going to be more to be done  there s always going to be room for more support  more progress   Ference said   But sometimes it s baby step  Culture change  sometimes  frustratingly slow and especially sometimes in sport   You deal with that and I think if you do the right thing  you support good people and you support proud  strong community in hockey  you re always on the right side of history   Longtime NHL executive and current executive director of the Professional Women s Hockey League Players  Association  Brian Burke  who ha long been a strong supporter of the LGBTQ  community  had called the ban a  surprising and serious setback  at the time  On Saturday  however  he had a different tune    NHL Commissioner  Gary Bettman s been a great ally  I think people are focused on the fact that they got rid of Pride sweater   Burke said Saturday  They still do Pride Nights  just not the Pride sweater  The league s been an ally  We haven t got everything we d like from the league but we get great support    I think we just keep going the way we re going and keep adding event  keep adding awareness  keep changing and breaking down the barrier that constrict u   he added   I see the world a a very different place than when my son came out    We ve made great gain and we got to keep focusing on that and not what hasn t happened   Pride Tape co founder Dr  Kristopher Wells found Saturday s event to be a way of fixing the NHL s standing with the community   This is about repairing harm that ha been done to the community   Wells said   The Pride Tape ban hurt a lot of people and that s why you saw the worldwide response about that decision   So I hope that Pride Cup is a start of building a new relationship  One where we re all working together because at the end of the day  the young people who love hockey  they want the game to love them back   Bettman wa on hand Saturday to present the Pride Cup trophy to the winning side and a  25 000 cheque to the Toronto Gay Hockey Association  Burke and Ference served a coach to the team  while PWHL player Alex Carpenter  Emily Clark  Emerance Maschmeyer and Erin Ambrose competed in the game  This report by The Canadian Press wa first published Feb  3  2024  Abdulhamid Ibrahim  The Canadian Press See a typo mistake  Have a story tip  Get your daily
